[The Society for the Recovery of [London Antiquities]740-london antiquities]2005-the society for the recovery of london antiquities met a month after in [a corrugated iron hall on the outskirts of one of [the southern suburbs of [London]17-london]742-the southern suburbs of london]741-a corrugated iron hall on the outskirts of one of the southern suburbs of london . [A large number of [people]1752-people]743-a large number of people had collected there under the coarse and flaring gas - jets when [the King]1924-the king arrived , perspiring and genial . On taking off [his]1924-the king great - coat , [he]1924-the king was perceived to be in evening dress , wearing the Garter . [His]1924-the king appearance at the small table , adorned only with a glass of water , was received with respectful cheering .

[The chairman]746-the chairman ( [Mr. Huggins]256-mr. huggins ) said that [he]746-the chairman was sure that [they]747-they had all been pleased to listen to [such distinguished lecturers]748-such distinguished lecturers as [they]747-they had heard for some time past ( hear , hear ) . [Mr. Burton]257-mr. burton ( hear , hear ) , [Mr. Cambridge]245-cambridge , [Professor King]258-professor king ( loud and continued cheers ) , [[our]749-our old friend]750-our old friend [Peter Jessop]259-peter , [Sir William White]260-sir william white ( loud laughter ) , and [other eminent men]751-other eminent men , had done honour to [their]747-they little venture ( cheers ) . But there were other circumstances which lent a certain unique quality to the present occasion ( hear , hear ) . So far as [his]1924-the king recollection went , and in connection with [the Society for the Recovery of [London]17-london]752-the society for the recovery of london Antiquities it went very far ( loud cheers ) , [he]1924-the king did not remember that [any of [[their]747-they lecturers]754-their lecturers]753-any of their lecturers had borne the title of King . [He]1924-the king would therefore call upon [King Auberon]261-auberon briefly to address the meeting .

[The King]261-auberon began by saying that this speech might be regarded as the first declaration of [his]261-auberon new policy for [the nation]755-the nation . " At this supreme hour of [my]261-auberon life [I]261-auberon feel that to [no one]416-no one but [the members of the Society for the Recovery of [London]17-london Antiquities]2024-the members of the society for the recovery of london antiquities can [I]261-auberon open [my]261-auberon heart ( cheers ) . If [the world]352-the world turns upon [my]261-auberon policy , and the storms of popular hostility begin to rise ( no , no ) , [I]261-auberon feel that it is here , with [[my]261-auberon brave Recoverers]2026-my brave recoverers around [me]261-auberon , that [I]261-auberon can best meet [them]2026-my brave recoverers , sword in hand "[261-auberon] ( loud cheers ) .

[[His]261-auberon Majesty]756-his majesty then went on to explain that , now old age was creeping upon [him]261-auberon , [he]261-auberon proposed to devote [his]261-auberon remaining strength to bringing about a keener sense of local patriotism in [the various municipalities of [London]17-london]757-the various municipalities of london . How few of [them]757-the various municipalities of london knew the legends of [[their]758-their own boroughs]759-their own boroughs ! How many there were who had never heard of the true origin of [the Wink of [Wandsworth]59-wandsworth]760-the wink of wandsworth ! What [a large proportion of [the younger generation in [Chelsea]60-chelsea]762-the younger generation in chelsea]761-a large proportion of the younger generation in chelsea neglected to perform the old [Chelsea]60-chelsea Chuff ! [Pimlico]55-pimlico no longer pumped [the Pimlies]262-the pimlies . [Battersea]61-battersea had forgotten the name of [Blick]263-blick .

There was a short silence , and then a voice said " Shame ! "[1924-the king]

[The King]261-auberon continued : " Being called , however unworthily , to [this high estate]2027-this high estate , [I]261-auberon have resolved that , so far as possible , this neglect shall cease . [I]261-auberon desire no military glory . [I]261-auberon lay claim to no constitutional equality with [Justinian]264-justinian or [Alfred]265-kensington . If [I]261-auberon can go down to history as [the man who saved from extinction a few old English customs]2028-the man who saved from extinction a few old english customs , if [[our]2029-our descendants]2030-our descendants can say it was through [this man]2031-this man , humble as [he]2031-this man was , that the Ten Turnips are still eaten in [Fulham]62-fulham , and [the Putney parish councillor]2032-the putney parish councillor still shaves one half of [his]2031-this man head , [I]261-auberon shall look [[my]261-auberon great fathers]2033-my great fathers reverently but not fearfully in the face when [I]261-auberon go down to [the last house of [Kings]597-kings]2034-the last house of kings . "[261-auberon]

[The King]1924-the king paused , visibly affected , but collecting [himself]1924-the king , resumed once more .

" [I]1924-the king trust that to [very few of [you]2037-you]2036-very few of you , at least , [I]1924-the king need dwell on the sublime origins of these legends . The very names of [[your]2037-you boroughs]2038-your boroughs bear witness to them . So long as [Hammersmith]63-hammersmith is called [Hammersmith]63-hammersmith , [its people]2039-its people will live in the shadow of [that primal hero]2040-that primal hero , [the Blacksmith]2041-the blacksmith , who led [the democracy of [the Broadway]64-the broadway]2042-the democracy of the broadway into battle till [he]2040-that primal hero drove [the chivalry of [Kensington]65-kensington]2043-the chivalry of kensington before [him]2040-that primal hero and overthrew [them]2043-the chivalry of kensington at that place which in honour of [the best blood of [the defeated aristocracy]2045-the defeated aristocracy]2044-the best blood of the defeated aristocracy is still called [Kensington Gore]66-kensington gore . [Men of [Hammersmith]63-hammersmith]2046-men of hammersmith will not fail to remember that the very name of [Kensington]265-kensington originated from the lips of [[their]2046-men of hammersmith hero]2047-their hero . For at the great banquet of reconciliation held after the war , when [the disdainful oligarchs]2048-the disdainful oligarchs declined to join in the songs of [the men of the Broadway ( which are to this day of a rude and popular character]2049-the men of the broadway ( which are to this day of a rude and popular character ) , [the great Republican leader]2050-the great republican leader , with [his]2050-the great republican leader rough humour , said the words which are written in gold upon [his]2050-the great republican leader monument , ' Little birds that can sing and wo n't sing , must be made to sing . ' So that [the Eastern Knights]266-the eastern knights were called [Cansings or Kensings]2051-cansings or kensings ever afterwards . But [you]2052-you also have great memories , [O men of [Kensington]65-kensington]2053-o men of kensington ! [You]2052-you showed that [you]2052-you could sing , and sing great war - songs . Even after the dark day of [Kensington Gore]66-kensington gore , history will not forget [those three Knights who guarded [[your]2052-you disordered retreat]2055-your disordered retreat from [Hyde Park]68-hyde park ( so called from [[your]2052-you hiding there]2056-your hiding there ) , [those three Knights after whom [Knightsbridge]69-knightsbridge is named]2057-those three knights after whom knightsbridge is named]2054-those three knights who guarded your disordered retreat from hyde park ( so called from your hiding there ) , those three knights after whom knightsbridge is named . Nor will it forget the day of [your]2052-you re - emergence , purged in the fire of calamity , cleansed of [your]2052-you oligarchic corruptions , when , sword in hand , [you]2052-you drove [the Empire of [Hammersmith]63-hammersmith]2058-the empire of hammersmith back mile by mile , swept [it]2058-the empire of hammersmith past [its]2058-the empire of hammersmith own Broadway , and broke it at last in a battle so long and bloody that the birds of prey have left [their]2059-their name upon it . [Men]357-men have called it , with austere irony , [the Ravenscourt]70-the ravenscourt . [I]1924-the king shall not , [I]1924-the king trust , wound the patriotism of [Bayswater]54-bayswater , or the lonelier pride of [Brompton]71-brompton , or that of [any other historic township]2061-any other historic township , by taking these two special examples . [I]1924-the king select them , not because they are more glorious than the rest , but partly from personal association ( [I]1924-the king am [myself]1924-the king descended from [one of [the three heroes of [Knightsbridge]69-knightsbridge]2063-the three heroes of knightsbridge]2062-one of the three heroes of knightsbridge ) , and partly from the consciousness that [I]1924-the king am [an amateur antiquarian]2064-an amateur antiquarian , and can not presume to deal with times and places more remote and more mysterious . It is not for [me]1924-the king to settle the question between two such men as [Professor Hugg]267-professor hugg and [Sir William]260-sir william white Whisky as to whether [Notting Hill]2-notting hill means [Nutting Hill]72-nutting hill ( in allusion to [the rich woods which no longer cover it]2065-the rich woods which no longer cover it ) , or whether it is a corruption of Nothing - ill , referring to [its]2-notting hill reputation among [the ancients]2066-the ancients as [an Earthly Paradise]2067-an earthly paradise . When [a Podkins]2068-a podkins and [a Jossy]2069-a jossy confess [themselves]2070-themselves doubtful about the boundaries of [West Kensington]73-west kensington ( said to have been traced in the blood of [Oxen]74-oxen ) , [I]1924-the king need not be ashamed to confess a similar doubt . [I]1924-the king will ask [you]2071-you to excuse [me]1924-the king from further history , and to assist [me]1924-the king with [your]2071-you encouragement in dealing with the problem which faces [us]2072-us to - day . Is this ancient spirit of [the London townships]2073-the london townships to die out ? Are [[our]2072-us omnibus conductors]2074-our omnibus conductors and [policemen]2075-policemen to lose altogether that light which [we]2072-us see so often in [their]768-their eyes , the dreamy light of[1924-the king]

' Old unhappy far - off things And battles long ago '

--to quote the words of [a little - known poet who was [a friend of [my]0-i youth]765-a friend of my youth]764-a little - known poet who was a friend of my youth ? [I]0-i have resolved , as [I]0-i have said , so far as possible , to preserve the eyes of [policemen]2075-policemen and [omnibus conductors]767-omnibus conductors in [their]768-their present dreamy state . For what is a state without dreams ? And the remedy [I]0-i propose is as follows:--

" To - morrow morning at twenty - five minutes past ten , if [Heaven]268-heaven spares [my]0-i life , [I]0-i purpose to issue a Proclamation . It has been the work of [my]0-i life , and is about half finished . With the assistance of a whisky and soda , [I]0-i shall conclude the other half to - night , and [[my]0-i people]1765-my people will receive it to - morrow . [All these boroughs where [you]2078-you were born , and hope to lay [your]2078-you bones]2077-all these boroughs where you were born , and hope to lay your bones , shall be reinstated in [[their]2077-all these boroughs where you were born , and hope to lay your bones ancient magnificence,--Hammersmith]2079-their ancient magnificence,--hammersmith , [Kensington]65-kensington , [Bayswater]54-bayswater , [Chelsea]60-chelsea , [Battersea]61-battersea , [Clapham]49-clapham , [Balham]75-balham , and a hundred others . Each shall immediately build a city wall with gates to be closed at sunset . Each shall have [a city guard , armed to the teeth]2080-a city guard , armed to the teeth . Each shall have a banner , a coat - of - arms , and , if convenient , a gathering cry . [I]0-i will not enter into the details now , [my]0-i heart is too full . They will be found in the proclamation itself . [You]2078-you will all , however , be subject to enrolment in [the local city guards]2081-the local city guards , to be summoned together by a thing called [the Tocsin]269-the tocsin , the meaning of which [I]0-i am studying in [my]0-i researches into history . Personally , [I]0-i believe [a tocsin]2082-a tocsin to be [some kind of highly paid official]2083-some kind of highly paid official . If , therefore , any of [you]2078-you happen to have such a thing as a halberd in [the house]1727-the house , [I]0-i should advise [you]2078-you to practise with it in [the garden]2085-the garden . "[0-i]

Here [the King]1924-the king buried [his]1924-the king face in [his]1924-the king handkerchief and hurriedly left [the platform]770-the platform , overcome by emotions .

[The members of [the Society for the Recovery of [London]17-london]752-the society for the recovery of london Antiquities]2024-the members of the society for the recovery of london antiquities rose in an indescribable state of vagueness . [Some]773-some were purple with indignation ; [an intellectual few]774-an intellectual few were purple with laughter ; [the great majority]775-the great majority found [their]775-the great majority minds a blank . There remains a tradition that [one pale face with burning blue eyes]776-one pale face with burning blue eyes remained fixed upon [the lecturer]777-the lecturer , and after the lecture [a red - haired boy]778-a red - haired boy ran out of [the room]696-the room .

CHAPTER II--_The Council of [the Provosts]780-the provosts _

[The King]1924-the king got up early next morning and came down three steps at a time like [a schoolboy]782-a schoolboy . Having eaten [his]1924-the king breakfast hurriedly , but with an appetite , [he]1924-the king summoned [one of [the highest officials of [the Palace]785-the palace]784-the highest officials of the palace]783-one of the highest officials of the palace , and presented [him]783-one of the highest officials of the palace with a shilling . " Go and buy [me]1924-the king , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said , " a shilling paint - box , which [you]2086-you will get , unless the mists of time mislead [me]1924-the king , in [a shop at [the corner of [the second and dirtier street]2089-the second and dirtier street that leads out of [Rochester Row]76-rochester row]2088-the corner of the second and dirtier street that leads out of rochester row]2087-a shop at the corner of the second and dirtier street that leads out of rochester row . [I]1924-the king have already requested [the Master of [the Buckhounds]270-the buckhounds]2090-the master of the buckhounds to provide [me]1924-the king with cardboard . It seemed to [me]1924-the king ( [I]1924-the king know not why ) that it fell within [[his]2090-the master of the buckhounds department]2091-his department . "[1924-the king]

[The King]1924-the king was happy all that morning with [his]1924-the king cardboard and [his]1924-the king paint - box . [He]1924-the king was engaged in designing the uniforms and coats - of - arms for [the various municipalities of [London]17-london]757-the various municipalities of london . [They]757-the various municipalities of london gave [him]1924-the king deep and no inconsiderable thought . [He]1924-the king felt the responsibility .

" [I]1924-the king can not think , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said , " why [people]1752-people should think the names of [places in [the country]449-the country]2093-places in the country more poetical than those in [London]17-london . [Shallow romanticists]2095-shallow romanticists go away in [trains]2096-trains and stop in [places called Hugmy - in - [the - Hole]2098-the - hole]2097-places called hugmy - in - the - hole , or [Bumps - on - the - Puddle]77-bumps - on - the - puddle . And all the time [they]2095-shallow romanticists could , if [they]2095-shallow romanticists liked , go and live at [a place with the dim , divine name of St. John 's Wood]2099-a place with the dim , divine name of st. john 's wood . [I]1924-the king have never been to [St. John 's Wood]78-st. john 's wood . [I]1924-the king dare not . [I]1924-the king should be afraid of the innumerable night of fir trees , afraid to come upon a blood - red cup and the beating of the wings of the Eagle . But all these things can be imagined by remaining reverently in [the Harrow train]2100-the harrow train . "[1924-the king]

And [he]1924-the king thoughtfully retouched [his]1924-the king design for the head - dress of the halberdier of [St. John 's Wood]78-st. john 's wood , a design in black and red , compounded of a pine tree and the plumage of an eagle . Then [he]1924-the king turned to another card . " Let [us]2101-us think of milder matters , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said . " [Lavender Hill]79-lavender hill ! Could any of [your]2102-your glebes and combes and all the rest of it produce so fragrant an idea ? Think of [a mountain of lavender]2103-a mountain of lavender lifting itself in purple poignancy into the silver skies and filling [men]357-men 's nostrils with a new breath of life -- a purple hill of incense . It is true that upon [my]1924-the king few excursions of discovery on [a halfpenny tram]2105-a halfpenny tram [I]1924-the king have failed to hit the precise spot . But it must be there ; [some poet]2106-some poet called it by its name . There is at least warrant enough for the solemn purple plumes ( following the botanical formation of lavender ) which [I]1924-the king have required [people]1752-people to wear in [the neighbourhood of [Clapham Junction]80-clapham junction]2108-the neighbourhood of clapham junction . It is so everywhere , after all . [I]1924-the king have never been actually to [Southfields]81-southfields , but [I]1924-the king suppose a scheme of lemons and olives represent [their]1752-people austral instincts . [I]1924-the king have never visited [[Parson]271-parson 's Green]2109-parson 's green , or seen either the Green or [the Parson]271-parson , but surely the pale - green shovel - hats [I]1924-the king have designed must be more or less in the spirit . [I]1924-the king must work in the dark and let [my]1924-the king instincts guide [me]1924-the king . "[1924-the king]

As [he]788-he was reflecting in this vein , the door was flung open , and [an official]789-an official announced [Mr. Barker]247-barker and [Mr. Lambert]226-lambert .

[Mr. Barker]247-barker and [Mr. Lambert]226-lambert were not particularly surprised to find [the King]1924-the king sitting on the floor amid a litter of water - colour sketches . [They]791-they were not particularly surprised because the last time [they]791-they had called on [him]1924-the king [they]791-they had found [him]1924-the king sitting on the floor , surrounded by a litter of [children]367-children 's bricks , and the time before surrounded by a litter of wholly unsuccessful attempts to make paper darts . But the trend of [the royal infant]793-the royal infant 's remarks , uttered from amid this infantile chaos , was not quite the same affair .

For some time [they]791-they let [him]1924-the king babble on , conscious that [his]1924-the king remarks meant nothing . And then a horrible thought began to steal over the mind of [James Barker]247-barker . [He]788-he began to think that [the King]1924-the king 's remarks did not mean nothing .

" In [God]199-god 's name , [Auberon]261-auberon , "[788-he] [he]788-he suddenly volleyed out , startling [the quiet hall]795-the quiet hall , " [you]261-auberon do n't mean that [you]261-auberon are really going to have [these city guards]2111-these city guards and city walls and things ? " The Great Proclamation of the Charter of [the Free Cities]2126-the free cities "[1924-the king] appeared in due course that morning , and was posted by bill - stickers all over the front of [the Palace]785-the palace , [the King]1924-the king assisting [them]800-them with animated directions , and standing in the middle of [the road]583-the road , with [his]1924-the king head on one side , contemplating the result . [His]1924-the king excitement had positively to be quieted like that of [a child]362-a child .

The reception which the Charter of [the Cities]692-the cities met at the hands of [the public]1857-the public may mildly be described as mixed . In one sense it was popular enough . In [many happy homes]809-many happy homes that remarkable legal document was read aloud on winter evenings amid uproarious appreciation , when everything had been learnt by heart from that quaint but immortal old classic , [Mr. W. W. Jacobs]272-mr. w. w. jacobs . But when it was discovered that [the King]1924-the king had every intention of seriously requiring the provisions to be carried out , of insisting that [the grotesque cities]811-the grotesque cities , with [[their]811-the grotesque cities tocsins]812-their tocsins and [city guards]813-city guards , should really come into existence , things were thrown into a far angrier confusion . [Londoners]814-londoners had no particular objection to [the King]1924-the king making a fool of [himself]1924-the king , but [they]814-londoners became indignant when it became evident that [he]1924-the king wished to make fools of [them]814-londoners ; and protests began to come in .

[The Lord High Provost of [the Good and Valiant City of [West Kensington]73-west kensington]82-the good and valiant city of west kensington]816-the lord high provost of the good and valiant city of west kensington wrote a respectful letter to [the King]1924-the king , explaining that upon State occasions it would , of course , be [his]1924-the king duty to observe what formalities [the King]1924-the king thought proper , but that it was really awkward for [a decent householder]819-a decent householder not to be allowed to go out and put a post - card in a pillar - box without being escorted by [five heralds , who announced , with formal cries and blasts of a trumpet]820-five heralds , who announced , with formal cries and blasts of a trumpet , that [the Lord High Provost]821-the lord high provost desired to catch the post .

[The Lord High Provost of [North Kensington]83-north kensington]822-the lord high provost of north kensington , who was [a prosperous draper]823-a prosperous draper , wrote a curt business note , like [a man complaining of [a railway company]825-a railway company]824-a man complaining of a railway company , stating that definite inconvenience had been caused [him]1924-the king by the presence of [the halberdiers]826-the halberdiers , whom [he]1924-the king had to take with [him]1924-the king everywhere . [The Lord High Provost of [Shepherd 's Bush]53-shepherd 's bush]831-the lord high provost of shepherd 's bush said [[his]831-the lord high provost of shepherd 's bush wife]832-his wife did not like [men]357-men hanging round [the kitchen]834-the kitchen .

[The King]1924-the king was always delighted to listen to these grievances , delivering lenient and kingly answers , but as [he]1924-the king always insisted , as the absolute _ sine qua non _ , that verbal complaints should be presented to [him]1924-the king with the fullest pomp of trumpets , plumes , and halberds , only a few resolute spirits were prepared to run the gauntlet of [the little boys in [the street]394-the street]836-the little boys in the street .

Among these , however , was prominent [the abrupt and business - like gentleman who ruled [North Kensington]83-north kensington]838-the abrupt and business - like gentleman who ruled north kensington . [I]0-i refer to the great affair of [the improvements in [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]843-the improvements in notting hill . The negotiations , buyings , sellings , bullying and bribing took ten years , and by the end of it [Buck]273-buck , who had conducted them almost single - handed , had proved [himself]273-buck [a man of the strongest type of material energy and material diplomacy]848-a man of the strongest type of material energy and material diplomacy . And just as [his]273-buck splendid patience and more splendid impatience had finally brought [him]273-buck victory , when [workmen]849-workmen were already demolishing [houses]1729-houses and walls along the great line from [Hammersmith]63-hammersmith , a sudden obstacle appeared that had neither been reckoned with nor dreamed of , a small and strange obstacle , which , like a speck of grit in a great machine , jarred the whole vast scheme and brought it to a stand - still , and [Mr. Buck]273-buck , [the draper]851-the draper , getting with great impatience into [his]273-buck robes of office and summoning with indescribable disgust [[his]273-buck halberdiers]852-his halberdiers , hurried over to speak to [the King]1924-the king .

Ten years had not tired [the King]1924-the king of [his]1924-the king joke . [Mr. James Barker]247-barker , whose guard was attired in a splendid blue , and whose blue banner bore three gold birds singing , rushed , in [his]247-barker blue and gold robes , into [the room]696-the room . Despite the absurdity of all the dresses , it was worth noticing that [he]247-barker carried [his]247-barker better than the rest , though [he]247-barker loathed it as much as any of [them]905-them . [He]247-barker was [a gentleman]906-a gentleman , and [a very handsome man]907-a very handsome man , and could not help unconsciously wearing even [his]247-barker preposterous robe as it should be worn . [He]247-barker spoke quickly , but with the slight initial hesitation [he]247-barker always showed in addressing [the King]1924-the king , due to suppressing an impulse to address [[his]247-barker old acquaintance]909-his old acquaintance in the old way .

" [[Your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty -- pray forgive [my]247-barker intrusion . It is about [this man in [Pump Street]88-pump street]2180-this man in pump street . [I]247-barker see [you]1946-your majesty have [Buck]273-buck here , so [you]1946-your majesty have probably heard what is necessary . [I--]247-barker "[247-barker]

[The King]1924-the king swept [his]1924-the king eyes anxiously round [the room]696-the room , which now blazed with the trappings of [three cities]912-three cities .

" There is one thing necessary , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said .

" A little yellow , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king , firmly . " Send for [the Provost of [West Kensington]73-west kensington]2183-the provost of west kensington . "[1924-the king]

Amid some materialistic protests [he]1924-the king was sent for , and arrived with [his]1924-the king yellow halberdiers in [his]1924-the king saffron robes , wiping [his]1924-the king forehead with a handkerchief . After all , placed as [he]1924-the king was , [he]1924-the king had a good deal to say on the matter .

" Welcome , [West Kensington]73-west kensington , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king . " [I]1924-the king have long wished to see [you]73-west kensington touching that matter of the [Hammersmith]63-hammersmith land to [the south of [the Rowton House]89-the rowton house]2184-the south of the rowton house . "[1924-the king]

" No , [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty ; [I]2183-the provost of west kensington 'd rather not , "[2183-the provost of west kensington] said [the Provost of [West Kensington]73-west kensington]2183-the provost of west kensington , who was [a pale young man with a fair moustache and whiskers , who kept a successful dairy]916-a pale young man with a fair moustache and whiskers , who kept a successful dairy .

[The King]1924-the king struck [him]2183-the provost of west kensington heartily on the shoulder .

" The fierce old West Kensington blood , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said ; " [they]2188-they are not wise who ask it to do homage . "[1924-the king]

Then [he]1924-the king glanced again round [the room]696-the room . It was full of a roaring sunset of colour , and [he]1924-the king enjoyed the sight , possible to [so few artists]919-so few artists -- the sight of [his]1924-the king own dreams moving and blazing before [him]1924-the king . The crests of these again brightened suddenly into green as the almost woodland colours of [Bayswater]54-bayswater rose behind [them]920-them . And over and behind all , the great purple plumes of [North Kensington]83-north kensington showed almost funereal and black .

" There is something lacking , "[2189-the king--"something] said [the King--"something]2189-the king--"something lacking . What can -- Ah , there it is ! there it is ! "[2189-the king--"something]

CHAPTER III--_Enter [a Lunatic _

[The King of [the Fairies]925-the fairies]924-the king of the fairies , who was , it is to be presumed , [the godfather of [King Auberon]261-auberon]926-the godfather of king auberon]923-a lunatic _ the king of the fairies , who was , it is to be presumed , the godfather of king auberon , must have been very favourable on this particular day to [[his]923-a lunatic _ the king of the fairies , who was , it is to be presumed , the godfather of king auberon fantastic godchild]927-his fantastic godchild , for with the entrance of the guard of [the Provost of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]928-the provost of notting hill there was a certain more or less inexplicable addition to [his]923-a lunatic _ the king of the fairies , who was , it is to be presumed , the godfather of king auberon delight . [The wretched navvies and sandwich - men who carried the colours of [Bayswater]54-bayswater or [South Kensington]56-south kensington]929-the wretched navvies and sandwich - men who carried the colours of bayswater or south kensington , engaged merely for the day to satisfy the Royal hobby , slouched into [the room]696-the room with a comparatively hang - dog air , and a great part of [the King]1924-the king 's intellectual pleasure consisted in the contrast between the arrogance of [their]929-the wretched navvies and sandwich - men who carried the colours of bayswater or south kensington swords and feathers and the meek misery of [their]929-the wretched navvies and sandwich - men who carried the colours of bayswater or south kensington faces . But these Notting Hill halberdiers in [their]929-the wretched navvies and sandwich - men who carried the colours of bayswater or south kensington red tunics belted with gold had the air rather of an absurd gravity . [They]929-the wretched navvies and sandwich - men who carried the colours of bayswater or south kensington seemed , so to speak , to be taking part in the joke . [They]929-the wretched navvies and sandwich - men who carried the colours of bayswater or south kensington marched and wheeled into position with an almost startling dignity and discipline .

[They]929-the wretched navvies and sandwich - men who carried the colours of bayswater or south kensington carried a yellow banner with a great red lion , named by [the King]1924-the king as the Notting Hill emblem , after [a small public - house in [the neighbourhood]934-the neighbourhood , which [he]1924-the king once frequented]933-a small public - house in the neighbourhood , which he once frequented .

Between the two lines of [[his]923-a lunatic _ the king of the fairies , who was , it is to be presumed , the godfather of king auberon followers]935-his followers there advanced towards [the King]1924-the king [a tall , red - haired young man , with high features and bold blue eyes]937-a tall , red - haired young man , with high features and bold blue eyes . [He]937-a tall , red - haired young man , with high features and bold blue eyes would have been called handsome , but that a certain indefinable air of [his]937-a tall , red - haired young man , with high features and bold blue eyes nose being too big for [his]937-a tall , red - haired young man , with high features and bold blue eyes face , and [his]937-a tall , red - haired young man , with high features and bold blue eyes feet for [his]937-a tall , red - haired young man , with high features and bold blue eyes legs , gave [him]937-a tall , red - haired young man , with high features and bold blue eyes a look of awkwardness and extreme youth . [His]937-a tall , red - haired young man , with high features and bold blue eyes robes were red , according to [the King]1924-the king 's heraldry , and , alone among [the Provosts]780-the provosts , [he]937-a tall , red - haired young man , with high features and bold blue eyes was girt with a great sword . This was [Adam Wayne]280-wayne , [the intractable Provost of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]940-the intractable provost of notting hill .

[The King]1924-the king flung [himself]1924-the king back in [his]1924-the king chair , and rubbed [his]1924-the king hands .

" What a day , what a day ! "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said to [himself]1924-the king . " Now there 'll be a row . [I]1924-the king 'd no idea it would be such fun as it is . [These Provosts]2191-these provosts are so very indignant , so very reasonable , so very right . [This fellow]2192-this fellow , by the look in [his]2192-this fellow eyes , is even more indignant than the rest . No sign in those large blue eyes , at any rate , of ever having heard of a joke . [He]2192-this fellow 'll remonstrate with [the others]2193-the others , and [they]2193-the others 'll remonstrate with [him]2192-this fellow , and [they]2193-the others 'll all make [themselves]2193-the others sumptuously happy remonstrating with [me]1924-the king . "[1924-the king]

" Welcome , [[my]1924-the king Lord]2134-my lord , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said aloud . " What news from [the Hill of [a Hundred Legends]2196-a hundred legends]2195-the hill of a hundred legends ? What have [you]1924-the king for the ear of [[your]1924-the king King]2197-your king ? And [I]1924-the king doubt not , and can not doubt , that [your]1924-the king love for [me]1924-the king is not less tender , no less ardent , than [theirs]2198-these others . "[1924-the king]

[Mr. Buck]273-buck made a bitter face , and [James Barker]247-barker 's nostrils curled ; [Wilson]274-wilson began to giggle faintly , and [the Provost of [West Kensington]73-west kensington]2183-the provost of west kensington followed in a smothered way . But the big blue eyes of [Adam Wayne]280-wayne never changed , and [he]280-wayne called out in an odd , boyish voice down the hall--

" [I]280-wayne bring homage to [[my]280-wayne King]2201-my king . [I]280-wayne bring [him]2201-my king the only thing [I]280-wayne have -- [my]280-wayne sword . "[280-wayne]

And with a great gesture [he]280-wayne flung it down on the ground , and knelt on one knee behind it .

There was a dead silence .

" [I]1924-the king beg [your]280-wayne pardon , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king , blankly .

" [You]280-wayne speak well , [sire]2202-sire , "[280-wayne] said [Adam Wayne]280-wayne , " as [you]280-wayne ever speak , when [you]280-wayne say that [my]280-wayne love is not less than the love of these . "[280-wayne]

[ Illustration : " [I]273-buck BRING HOMAGE TO [[MY]273-buck KING]2201-my king . "[273-buck] ]

The eyes of [all five men]944-all five men stood out of [their]944-all five men heads .

Then [Buck]273-buck said , in [his]273-buck jolly , jarring voice : " Is [the whole world]2207-the whole world mad ? "[273-buck]

[The King]1924-the king sprang to [his]1924-the king feet , and [his]1924-the king eyes blazed .

" Yes , "[273-buck] [he]273-buck cried , in a voice of exultation , " [the whole world]2207-the whole world is mad , but [Adam Wayne]280-wayne and [me]273-buck . "[1924-the king]

"[1924-the king]

" If [they]2270-these modern improvers have blood [they]2270-these modern improvers will , "[876-the provost] said [the Provost]876-the provost .

" And [I]1924-the king suppose , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king , with [his]1924-the king head back among the cushions , " that it never crossed [your]280-wayne mind that"--his[1924-the king] voice seemed to lose itself luxuriantly--"never crossed [your]280-wayne mind that [any one]2145-any one ever thought that the idea of a Notting Hill idealism was -- er -- slightly -- slightly ridiculous ? " [You]1924-the king have been [[my]876-the provost tutor]2278-my tutor , [Sire]2202-sire , "[876-the provost] said [the Provost]876-the provost , " in all that is high and honourable . "[876-the provost]

" It was [[your]280-wayne Majesty]1946-your majesty who first stirred [my]876-the provost dim patriotism into flame . But [I]876-the provost need have had no fear . Then was [I]876-the provost taught to understand [Kingliness]2287-kingliness . [You]2202-sire neither shrank nor frowned . [The King]1924-the king was lying back in [his]1924-the king chair , a kind of wreck .

[The King]261-auberon smiled .

[The King]1924-the king made no answer .

[Adam]280-wayne went on , [his]280-wayne voice ringing in the roof .

" This laughter with which [men tyrannise]2319-men tyrannise is not the great power [you]261-auberon think it . [Peter]259-peter was crucified , and crucified head downwards . [Auberon]261-auberon was flicking dust off [his]261-auberon sleeve with quite a new seriousness on [his]261-auberon face , distinct from the owlish solemnity which was the pose of [his]261-auberon humour .

[The Provost of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]928-the provost of notting hill seemed to have fallen into a kind of trance ; in [his]928-the provost of notting hill eyes was an elvish light .

" [I]928-the provost of notting hill know of a magic wand , but it is a wand that [only one or two]2343-only one or two may rightly use , and only seldom . "[928-the provost of notting hill]

" How humane [you]1924-the king are , how tender , how considerate ! But for the things that make life itself worthy or miserable -- how humane [you]1924-the king are ! If , as [[your]1924-the king rich friends]2366-your rich friends say , there are [no gods]2367-no gods , and the skies are dark above [us]2368-us , what should [a man]388-a man fight for , but the place where [he]388-a man had [the Eden of childhood and [the short heaven of first love]2371-the short heaven of first love]2370-the eden of childhood and the short heaven of first love ? [The King]1924-the king walked a little restlessly up and down [the daïs]964-the daïs .

" [I]287-buck said to [him]1924-the king quite plainly -- the public interests-- "[287-buck]

[Auberon]261-auberon turned on [Wayne]280-wayne with violence .

" [I]1924-the king do n't think [you]280-wayne have , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king cried .

BOOK III

CHAPTER I--_The Mental Condition of [Adam Wayne]280-wayne _

A little while after [the King]261-auberon 's accession a small book of poems appeared , called " Hymns on [the Hill]647-the hill . "[991-they] [They]991-they were not good poems , nor was the book successful , but it attracted a certain amount of attention from [one particular school of [critics]993-critics]992-one particular school of critics . [The King]261-auberon [himself]261-auberon , who was [a member of [the school]995-the school]994-a member of the school , reviewed it in [his]261-auberon capacity of literary critic to " Straight from [the Stables]2374-the stables , "[991-they] a sporting journal . [They]995-the school were known as the [Hammock School]99-hammock school , because it had been calculated malignantly by an enemy that no less than thirteen of [their]995-the school delicate criticisms had begun with the words , " [I]261-auberon read this book in a hammock : half asleep in the sleepy sunlight , [I]261-auberon ... "[261-auberon] ; after that there were important differences . Under these conditions [they]995-the school liked everything , but especially everything silly . " Next to authentic goodness in a book , "[995-the school] [they]995-the school said--"next to authentic goodness in a book ( and that , alas ! [we]995-the school never find ) [we]995-the school desire a rich badness . "[995-the school] Thus it happened that [their]995-the school praise ( as indicating the presence of a rich badness ) was not universally sought after , and [authors]996-authors became a little disquieted when [they]996-authors found the eye of [the Hammock School]99-hammock school fixed upon [them]996-authors with peculiar favour .

The peculiarity of " Hymns on [the Hill]2-notting hill "[995-the school] was the celebration of the poetry of [London]17-london as distinct from the poetry of [the country]449-the country . This sentiment or affectation was , of course , not uncommon in the twentieth century , nor was it , although sometimes exaggerated , and sometimes artificial , by any means without a great truth at its root , for there is one respect in which [a town]998-a town must be more poetical than [the country]449-the country , since [it]998-a town is closer to the spirit of [man]384-man ; for [London]17-london , if it be not one of the masterpieces of [man]384-man , is at least one of [his]384-man sins . [A street]721-a street is really more poetical than [a meadow]1003-a meadow , because [a street]721-a street has a secret . [A street]721-a street is going somewhere , and [a meadow]1003-a meadow nowhere . But , in the case of the book called " Hymns on [the Hill]2-notting hill , "[261-auberon] there was another peculiarity , which [the King]1924-the king pointed out with great acumen in [his]1924-the king review . [He]1924-the king was naturally interested in the matter , for [he]1924-the king had [himself]1924-the king published a volume of lyrics about [London]17-london under [his]1924-the king pseudonym of " [Daisy Daydream]288-daisy daydream . "[1924-the king]

This difference , as [the King]261-auberon pointed out , consisted in the fact that , while [mere artificers]1008-mere artificers like " [Daisy Daydream]288-daisy daydream "[1924-the king] ( on whose elaborate style [the King]1924-the king , over [his]1924-the king signature of " Thunderbolt , "[1924-the king] was perhaps somewhat too severe ) thought to praise [London]17-london by comparing it to [the country]449-the country -- using nature , that is , as a background from which all poetical images had to be drawn -- [the more robust author of " Hymns on]2375-the more robust author of " hymns on [the Hill]2-notting hill "[1924-the king] praised [the country]449-the country , or nature , by comparing [it]1012-it to [the town]348-the town , and used [the town itself]1014-the town itself as a background . " Take , "[1015-the critic] said [the critic]1015-the critic , " the typically feminine lines , ' To [the Inventor of The Hansom Cab'--[1015-the critic]

' Poet , whose cunning carved this amorous shell , Where twain]2376-the inventor of the hansom cab'-- ' poet , whose cunning carved this amorous shell , where twain may dwell . ' "[1015-the critic]

" Surely , "[1924-the king] wrote [the King]1924-the king , " [no one]416-no one but [a woman]385-a woman could have written those lines . [A woman]385-a woman has always a weakness for nature ; with [her]385-a woman art is only beautiful as an echo or shadow of it . [She]385-a woman is praising [the hansom cab]2380-the hansom cab by theme and theory , but [her]385-a woman soul is still a child by [the sea]1866-the sea , picking up shells . [She]385-a woman can never be utterly of [the town]348-the town , as [a man]388-a man can ; indeed , do [we]2384-we not speak ( with sacred propriety ) of ' [a man about [town]491-town]2385-a man about town ' ? Who ever spoke of [a woman about [town]491-town]2387-a woman about town ? However much , physically , ' about [town]491-town ' [a woman]385-a woman may be , [she]385-a woman still models [herself]385-a woman on nature ; [she]385-a woman tries to carry nature with [her]385-a woman ; [she]385-a woman bids grasses to grow on [her]385-a woman head , and furry beasts to bite [her]385-a woman about the throat . In [the heart of [a dim city]2392-a dim city]2391-the heart of a dim city , [she]385-a woman models [her]385-a woman hat on [a flaring cottage garden of flowers]2393-a flaring cottage garden of flowers . [We]2394-we , with [our]2394-we nobler civic sentiment , model [ours]2394-we on a chimney pot ; the ensign of civilisation . And rather than be without birds , [she]385-a woman will commit massacre , that [she]385-a woman may turn [her]385-a woman head into a tree , with dead birds to sing on it . "[1924-the king]

This kind of thing went on for several pages , and then [the critic]1015-the critic remembered [his]1015-the critic subject , and returned to it .

" [Poet]2395-poet , whose cunning carved this amorous shell , Where twain may dwell . "[1015-the critic]

" The peculiarity of these fine though feminine lines , "[1015-the critic] continued " [Thunderbolt]289-thunderbolt , "[1015-the critic] " is , as [we]2394-we have said , that [they]2396-they praise [the hansom cab]2380-the hansom cab by comparing it to the shell , to a natural thing . Now , hear [the author of ' Hymns on [the Hill]2-notting hill]2398-the author of ' hymns on the hill , ' and how [he]2398-the author of ' hymns on the hill deals with the same subject . In [his]2398-the author of ' hymns on the hill fine nocturne , entitled ' [The Last Omnibus]2399-the last omnibus ' [he]2398-the author of ' hymns on the hill relieves the rich and poignant melancholy of the theme by a sudden sense of rushing at the end--[1015-the critic]

' The wind round [the old street corner]1018-the old street corner Swung sudden and quick as [a cab]1019-a cab . '

" Here the distinction is obvious . ' [Daisy Daydream]288-daisy daydream ' thinks it a great compliment to a hansom cab to be compared to one of [the spiral chambers of [the sea]1866-the sea]2400-the spiral chambers of the sea . And [the author of ' Hymns on [the Hill]2-notting hill]2398-the author of ' hymns on the hill ' thinks it a great compliment to the immortal whirlwind to be compared to [a hackney coach]2403-a hackney coach . [He]2398-the author of ' hymns on the hill surely is [the real admirer of [London]17-london]2404-the real admirer of london . [We]2405-we have no space to speak of all [his]2398-the author of ' hymns on the hill perfect applications of the idea ; of the poem in which , for instance , [a lady]2406-a lady 's eyes are compared , not to stars , but to two perfect street - lamps guiding [the wanderer]2407-the wanderer . [We]2405-we have no space to speak of the fine lyric , recalling the Elizabethan spirit , in which [the poet]2408-the poet , instead of saying that the rose and the lily contend in [her]2408-the poet complexion , says , with a purer modernism , that the red omnibus of [Hammersmith]63-hammersmith and the white omnibus of [Fulham]62-fulham fight there for the mastery . How perfect the image of two contending omnibuses ! "[1015-the critic]

Here , somewhat abruptly , the review concluded , probably because [the King]1924-the king had to send off [his]1924-the king copy at that moment , as [he]1924-the king was in some want of money . But [the King]1924-the king was [a very good critic]1022-a very good critic , whatever [he]1924-the king may have been as [King]261-auberon , and [he]1924-the king had , to a considerable extent , hit the right nail on the head . " Hymns on [the Hill]2-notting hill "[1924-the king] was not at all like the poems originally published in praise of the poetry of [London]17-london . And the reason was that it was really written by [a man who had seen nothing else but [London]17-london , and who regarded it , therefore , as the universe]1023-a man who had seen nothing else but london , and who regarded it , therefore , as the universe . It was written by [a raw , red - headed lad of seventeen , named [Adam Wayne]280-wayne , who had been born in [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]1024-a raw , red - headed lad of seventeen , named adam wayne , who had been born in notting hill . An accident in [his]280-wayne seventh year prevented [his]280-wayne being taken away to [the seaside]1025-the seaside , and thus [his]280-wayne whole life had been passed in [his]280-wayne own Pump Street , and in [[its]1026-its neighbourhood]1027-its neighbourhood . And the consequence was , that [he]280-wayne saw the street - lamps as things quite as eternal as the stars ; the two fires were mingled . [He]280-wayne saw [the houses]2365-the houses as things enduring , like [the mountains]1029-the mountains , and so [he]280-wayne wrote about them as one would write about [mountains]1030-mountains . [Nature]221-nature puts on a disguise when [she]221-nature speaks to [every man]1863-every man ; to [this man]2031-this man [she]221-nature put on the disguise of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill . Nature would mean to [a poet born in [the Cumberland hills]1034-the cumberland hills]1033-a poet born in the cumberland hills , a stormy sky - line and [sudden rocks]1035-sudden rocks . [Nature]221-nature would mean to [a poet born in [the Essex flats]1037-the essex flats]1036-a poet born in the essex flats , [a waste of splendid waters and splendid sunsets]1038-a waste of splendid waters and splendid sunsets . So nature meant to [this man Wayne a line of violet roofs and lemon lamps]1039-this man wayne a line of violet roofs and lemon lamps , the chiaroscuro of [the town]348-the town . [He]280-wayne did not think it clever or funny to praise the shadows and colours of [the town]348-the town ; [he]280-wayne had seen no other shadows or colours , and so [he]280-wayne praised them -- because they were shadows and colours . [He]280-wayne saw all this because [he]280-wayne was [a poet]1042-a poet , though in practice [a bad poet]1043-a bad poet . It is too often forgotten that just as [a bad man]1044-a bad man is nevertheless [a man]388-a man , so [a bad poet]1043-a bad poet is nevertheless [a poet]1042-a poet .

[Mr. Wayne]290-wayne 's little volume of verse was a complete failure ; and [he]290-wayne submitted to the decision of fate with a quite rational humility , went back to [his]290-wayne work , which was that of [[a draper]1048-a draper 's assistant]1049-a draper 's assistant , and wrote no more . [He]290-wayne still retained [his]290-wayne feeling about [the town of Notting Hill]1050-the town of notting hill , because [he]290-wayne could not possibly have any other feeling , because it was the back and base of [his]290-wayne brain . But [he]290-wayne does not seem to have made any particular attempt to express it or insist upon it .

[He]290-wayne was [a genuine natural mystic]1051-a genuine natural mystic , [one of those who live on [the border of fairyland]1053-the border of fairyland]1052-one of those who live on the border of fairyland . But [he]290-wayne was perhaps the first to realise how often the boundary of fairyland runs through [a crowded city]1054-a crowded city . Twenty feet from [him]290-wayne ( for [he]290-wayne was very short - sighted ) the red and white and yellow suns of the gas - lights thronged and melted into each other like an orchard of fiery trees , the beginning of [the woods of elf - land]1055-the woods of elf - land .

But , oddly enough , it was because [he]290-wayne was [a small poet]1056-a small poet that [he]290-wayne came to [his]290-wayne strange and isolated triumph . It was because [he]290-wayne was a failure in literature that [he]290-wayne became a portent in English history . [He]290-wayne was one of [those to whom nature has given the desire without the power of artistic expression]1057-those to whom nature has given the desire without the power of artistic expression . [He]290-wayne had been [a dumb poet from [his]290-wayne cradle]1058-a dumb poet from his cradle . [He]290-wayne might have been so to [his]290-wayne grave , and carried unuttered into the darkness a treasure of new and sensational song . But [he]290-wayne was born under the lucky star of a single coincidence . [He]290-wayne happened to be at the head of [[his]290-wayne dingy municipality]1059-his dingy municipality at the time of [the King]1924-the king 's jest , at the time when [all municipalities]1061-all municipalities were suddenly commanded to break out into banners and flowers . Out of the long procession of [the silent poets , who have been passing since the beginning of]1062-the silent poets , who have been passing since the beginning of [the world]352-the world , [this one man]1064-this one man found [himself]1064-this one man in the midst of an heraldic vision , in which [he]1064-this one man could act and speak and live lyrically . While [the author]1065-the author and [the victims alike]1066-the victims alike treated the whole matter as a silly public charade , [this one man]1064-this one man , by taking it seriously , sprang suddenly into a throne of artistic omnipotence . Armour , music , standards , watch - fires , the noise of drums , all the theatrical properties were thrown before [him]1064-this one man . [This one poor rhymster]1068-this one poor rhymster , having burnt [his]1068-this one poor rhymster own rhymes , began to live that life of open air and acted poetry of which [all the poets of [the earth]670-the earth]1069-all the poets of the earth have dreamed in vain ; the life for which the Iliad is only a cheap substitute .

Upwards from [his]290-wayne abstracted childhood , [Adam Wayne]290-wayne had grown strongly and silently in a certain quality or capacity which is in [modern cities]1071-modern cities almost entirely artificial , but which can be natural , and was primarily almost brutally natural in [him]290-wayne , the quality or capacity of patriotism . It exists , like other virtues and vices , in a certain undiluted reality . It is not confused with all kinds of other things . [A child speaking of [[his]1072-a child speaking of his country or his village country]1073-his country or [[his]1072-a child speaking of his country or his village village]1074-his village]1072-a child speaking of his country or his village may make every mistake in [Mandeville]102-mandeville or tell every lie in [Munchausen]103-munchausen , but in [his]1072-a child speaking of his country or his village statement there will be no psychological lies any more than there can be in a good song . [Adam Wayne]290-wayne , as [a boy]567-a boy , had for [[his]290-wayne dull streets]1076-his dull streets in [Notting Hill]2-notting hill the ultimate and ancient sentiment that went out to [Athens]27-athens or [Jerusalem]28-jerusalem . [He]290-wayne knew the secret of the passion , those secrets which make real old national songs sound so strange to [[our]1077-our civilisation]1078-our civilisation . [He]290-wayne knew that real patriotism tends to sing about sorrows and forlorn hopes much more than about victory . [He]290-wayne knew that in proper names themselves is half the poetry of all national poems . Above all , [he]290-wayne knew the supreme psychological fact about patriotism , as certain in connection with it as that a fine shame comes to [all lovers]1079-all lovers , the fact that [the patriot]1080-the patriot never under any circumstances boasts of the largeness of [[his]1080-the patriot country]1073-his country , but always , and of necessity , boasts of the smallness of it .

All this [he]290-wayne knew , not because [he]290-wayne was [a philosopher]1082-a philosopher or [a genius]1083-a genius , but because [he]290-wayne was [a child]362-a child . [Any one who cares to walk up [a side slum like [Pump Street]88-pump street]1086-a side slum like pump street]1085-any one who cares to walk up a side slum like pump street , can see [a little Adam]1087-a little adam claiming to be [king of a paving - stone]1088-king of a paving - stone . And [he]290-wayne will always be proudest if the stone is almost too narrow for [him]290-wayne to keep [his]290-wayne feet inside it .

It was while [he]290-wayne was in such a dream of defensive battle , marking out some strip of [street or fortress of steps]1089-street or fortress of steps as the limit of [his]290-wayne haughty claim , that [the King]1924-the king had met [him]290-wayne , and , with a few words flung in mockery , ratified for ever the strange boundaries of [his]290-wayne soul . Thenceforward the fanciful idea of the defence of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill in war became to [him]290-wayne a thing as solid as eating or drinking or lighting a pipe . [He]290-wayne disposed [his]290-wayne meals for it , altered [his]290-wayne plans for it , lay awake in the night and went over it again . [Two or three shops]1091-two or three shops were to [him]290-wayne [an arsenal]1092-an arsenal ; [an area]1093-an area was to [him]290-wayne [a moat]1094-a moat ; corners of balconies and turns of stone steps were points for the location of a culverin or [an archer]1095-an archer . It is almost impossible to convey to any ordinary imagination the degree to which [he]290-wayne had transmitted the leaden [London]17-london landscape to a romantic gold . The process began almost in babyhood , and became habitual like a literal madness . It was felt most keenly at night , when [London]17-london is really [herself]17-london , when [her]17-london lights shine in the dark like the eyes of innumerable cats , and the outline of [the dark houses]1096-the dark houses has the bold simplicity of [blue hills]1097-blue hills . But for [him]290-wayne the night revealed instead of concealing , and [he]290-wayne read all the blank hours of morning and afternoon , by a contradictory phrase , in the light of that darkness . To [this man]2031-this man , at any rate , the inconceivable had happened . [The artificial city]1099-the artificial city had become to [him]290-wayne nature , and [he]290-wayne felt the curbstones and gas - lamps as things as ancient as the sky .

One instance may suffice . Walking along [Pump Street]88-pump street with [a friend]1100-a friend , [he]290-wayne said , as [he]290-wayne gazed dreamily at the iron fence of [a little front garden]1101-a little front garden , " How those railings stir [one]1758-one 's blood ! "[290-wayne]

[[His]290-wayne friend]1102-his friend , who was also [a great intellectual admirer]1103-a great intellectual admirer , looked at them painfully , but without any particular emotion . [He]290-wayne was so troubled about it that [he]290-wayne went back quite a large number of times on quiet evenings and stared at the railings , waiting for something to happen to [his]290-wayne blood , but without success . At last [he]290-wayne took refuge in asking [Wayne]290-wayne [himself]290-wayne . [He]290-wayne discovered that the ecstacy lay in the one point [he]290-wayne had never noticed about the railings even after [his]290-wayne six visits -- the fact that they were , like the great majority of others -- in [London]17-london , shaped at the top after the manner of a spear . As [a child]362-a child , [Wayne]290-wayne had half unconsciously compared them with the spears in pictures of [Lancelot]291-lancelot and [St. George]104-st. george , and had grown up under the shadow of the graphic association . Now , whenever [he]290-wayne looked at them , [they]1105-they were simply the serried weapons that made a hedge of steel round [the sacred homes of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]1106-the sacred homes of notting hill . [He]290-wayne could not have cleansed [his]290-wayne mind of that meaning even if [he]290-wayne tried . It was not a fanciful comparison , or anything like it . It would not have been true to say that the familiar railings reminded [him]290-wayne of spears ; it would have been far truer to say that the familiar spears occasionally reminded [him]290-wayne of railings .

A couple of days after [his]290-wayne interview with [the King]1924-the king , [Adam Wayne]290-wayne was pacing like a caged lion in front of [five shops that occupied the upper end of [the disputed street]1109-the disputed street]1108-five shops that occupied the upper end of the disputed street . [They]1108-five shops that occupied the upper end of the disputed street were [a grocer]1110-a grocer 's , [a chemist]1111-a chemist 's , [a barber]1112-a barber 's , [an old curiosity shop]1113-an old curiosity shop and [a toy - shop that sold also newspapers]1114-a toy - shop that sold also newspapers . It was [these five shops which [his]290-wayne childish fastidiousness had first selected as the essentials of the Notting Hill campaign]1115-these five shops which his childish fastidiousness had first selected as the essentials of the notting hill campaign , [the citadel of [the city]1941-the city]1116-the citadel of the city . If [Notting Hill]2-notting hill was [the heart of [the universe]519-the universe]1118-the heart of the universe , and [Pump Street]88-pump street was [the heart of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]1120-the heart of notting hill , this was [the heart of [Pump Street]88-pump street]1121-the heart of pump street . The fact that [they]1108-five shops that occupied the upper end of the disputed street were all small and side by side realised that feeling for a formidable comfort and compactness which , as [we]1122-we have said , was the heart of [his]290-wayne patriotism , and of all patriotism . [The grocer ( who had a wine and spirit licence )]1123-the grocer ( who had a wine and spirit licence ) was included because [he]1123-the grocer ( who had a wine and spirit licence ) could provision [the garrison]1124-the garrison ; [the old curiosity shop]1125-the old curiosity shop because [it]1125-the old curiosity shop contained enough swords , pistols , partisans , cross - bows , and blunderbusses to arm [a whole irregular regiment]1126-a whole irregular regiment ; [the toy and paper shop]1127-the toy and paper shop because [Wayne]290-wayne thought [a free press an essential centre for the soul of [Pump Street]88-pump street]1128-a free press an essential centre for the soul of pump street ; [the chemist]1129-the chemist 's to cope with outbreaks of disease among [the besieged]1130-the besieged ; and [the barber]1131-the barber 's because [it]1132-it was in the middle of all the rest , and [[the barber]1131-the barber 's son]1134-the barber 's son was [an intimate friend and spiritual affinity]1135-an intimate friend and spiritual affinity .

It was a cloudless October evening settling down through purple into pure silver around the roofs and chimneys of [the steep little street , which looked black and sharp and dramatic]1136-the steep little street , which looked black and sharp and dramatic . In the deep shadows the gas - lit [shop fronts]1137-shop fronts gleamed like five fires in a row , and before them , darkly outlined like a ghost against some purgatorial furnaces , passed to and fro the tall bird - like figure and eagle nose of [Adam Wayne]290-wayne .

[He]290-wayne swung [his]290-wayne stick restlessly , and seemed fitfully talking to [himself]290-wayne .

" There are , after all , enigmas , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne said " even to [the man who has faith]2410-the man who has faith . There are doubts that remain even after the true philosophy is completed in every rung and rivet . And here is one of them . Is the normal human need , the normal human condition , higher or lower than those special states of the soul which call out a doubtful and dangerous glory ? those special powers of knowledge or sacrifice which are made possible only by the existence of evil ? Which should come first to [our]2411-our affections , the enduring sanities of peace or the half - maniacal virtues of battle ? Which should come first , [the man great in the daily round]2412-the man great in the daily round or [the man]574-the man great in emergency ? Which should come first , to return to the enigma before [me]290-wayne , [the grocer]2414-the grocer or [the chemist]1129-the chemist ? Which is more certainly the stay of [the city]1941-the city , [the swift chivalrous chemist]2417-the swift chivalrous chemist or [the benignant all - providing grocer]2418-the benignant all - providing grocer ? In such ultimate spiritual doubts it is only possible to choose a side by the higher instincts , and to abide the issue . In any case , [I]290-wayne have made [my]290-wayne choice . May [I]290-wayne be pardoned if [I]290-wayne choose wrongly , but [I]290-wayne choose [the grocer]2414-the grocer . "[290-wayne]

" Good morning , [sir]1754-sir , "[2414-the grocer] said [the grocer]2414-the grocer , who was [a middle - aged man , partially bald , with harsh red whiskers and beard , and forehead lined with all the cares of the small tradesman]1139-a middle - aged man , partially bald , with harsh red whiskers and beard , and forehead lined with all the cares of the small tradesman . " What can [I]2414-the grocer do for [you]1754-sir , [sir]1754-sir ? "[2414-the grocer]

[Wayne]290-wayne removed [his]290-wayne hat on entering [the shop]1140-the shop , with a ceremonious gesture , which , slight as it was , made [the tradesman]1141-the tradesman eye [him]290-wayne with the beginnings of wonder .

" [I]290-wayne come , [sir]1754-sir , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne said soberly , " to appeal to [your]1754-sir patriotism . "[290-wayne]

" Why , [sir]1754-sir , "[2414-the grocer] said [the grocer]2414-the grocer , " that sounds like the times when [I]2414-the grocer was [a boy]567-a boy and [we]2425-we used to have elections . "[2414-the grocer]

" [You]1754-sir will have them again , "[290-wayne] said [Wayne]290-wayne , firmly , " and far greater things . Listen , [Mr. Mead]292-mr. mead . [I]290-wayne know the temptations which [a grocer]1110-a grocer has to a too cosmopolitan philosophy . [I]290-wayne can imagine what it must be to sit all day as [you]1754-sir do surrounded with wares from all the ends of [the earth]670-the earth , from [strange seas that [we]2425-we have never sailed and strange forests that [we]2425-we could not even picture]2428-strange seas that we have never sailed and strange forests that we could not even picture . [No Eastern king]2429-no eastern king ever had such argosies or such cargoes coming from the sunrise and the sunset , and [Solomon]293-solomon in all [his]293-solomon glory was not enriched like one of [you]1754-sir . [India]105-india is at [your]1754-sir elbow , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne cried , lifting [his]290-wayne voice and pointing [his]290-wayne stick at a drawer of rice , [the grocer]2414-the grocer making a movement of some alarm , " [China]106-china is before [you]1754-sir , [Demerara]107-demerara is behind [you]1754-sir , [America]18-america is above [your]1754-sir head , and at this very moment , like [some old Spanish admiral]2430-some old spanish admiral , [you]1754-sir hold [Tunis]294-tunis in [your]1754-sir hands . "[2414-the grocer]

[Mr. Mead]292-mr. mead dropped the box of dates which [he]292-mr. mead was just lifting , and then picked it up again vaguely .

[Wayne]290-wayne went on with a heightened colour , but a lowered voice ,

" [I]290-wayne know , [I]290-wayne say , the temptations of so international , so universal a vision of wealth . [I]290-wayne know that it must be [your]1754-sir danger not to fall like [many tradesmen]2431-many tradesmen into too dusty and mechanical a narrowness , but rather to be too broad , to be too general , too liberal . If a narrow nationalism be the danger of [the pastry - cook]2432-the pastry - cook , who makes [his]2432-the pastry - cook own wares under [his]2432-the pastry - cook own heavens , no less is cosmopolitanism the danger of [the grocer]2414-the grocer . But [I]290-wayne come to [you]1754-sir in the name of that patriotism which no wanderings or enlightenments should ever wholly extinguish , and [I]290-wayne ask [you]1754-sir to remember [Notting Hill]2-notting hill . For , after all , in this cosmopolitan magnificence , [she]2-notting hill has played no small part . [Your]1754-sir dates may come from [the tall palms of [Barbary]108-barbary]2434-the tall palms of barbary , [your]1754-sir sugar from [the strange islands of the tropics]2435-the strange islands of the tropics , [your]1754-sir tea from [the secret villages of [the Empire of the Dragon]2437-the empire of the dragon]2436-the secret villages of the empire of the dragon . That [this room]2438-this room might be furnished , forests may have been spoiled under [the Southern Cross]109-the southern cross , and leviathans speared under [the Polar Star]110-the polar star . But [you]1754-sir [yourself]1754-sir -- surely no inconsiderable treasure -- [you]1754-sir [yourself]1754-sir , the brain that wields these vast interests -- [you]1754-sir [yourself]1754-sir , at least , have grown to strength and wisdom between [these grey houses]2439-these grey houses and under this rainy sky . [This city which made [you]1754-sir , and thus made [your]1754-sir fortunes]2440-this city which made you , and thus made your fortunes , is threatened with war . Come forth and tell to the ends of [the earth]670-the earth this lesson . Oil is from [the North]111-the north and fruits from [the South]112-the south ; rices are from [India]105-india and spices from [Ceylon]113-ceylon ; [sheep]2442-sheep are from [New Zealand]114-new zealand and [men]357-men from [Notting Hill]2-notting hill . "[290-wayne]

[The grocer]2414-the grocer sat for some little while , with dim eyes and [his]2414-the grocer mouth open , looking rather like a fish . Then [he]2414-the grocer scratched the back of [his]2414-the grocer head , and said nothing . Then [he]2414-the grocer said--

" Anything out of [the shop]1140-the shop , [sir]1754-sir ? "[2414-the grocer]

" Yes , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne said ; " [I]290-wayne 'll take those . "[290-wayne]

" Very good , [sir]1754-sir ; thank [you]1754-sir , [sir]1754-sir , "[2414-the grocer] said [the grocer]2414-the grocer with animation . " [You]1754-sir may count upon [my]2414-the grocer patriotism , [sir]1754-sir . "[2414-the grocer]

" [I]290-wayne count upon it already , "[290-wayne] said [Wayne]290-wayne , and passed out into the gathering night .

[The grocer]2414-the grocer put the box of dates back in its place .

" What [a nice fellow]2450-a nice fellow [he]2414-the grocer is ! "[2414-the grocer] [he]2414-the grocer said . " It 's odd how often [they]2451-they are nice . Much nicer than those as are all right . "[2414-the grocer]

[Meanwhile Adam Wayne]290-wayne stood outside [the glowing chemist 's shop]1150-the glowing chemist 's shop , unmistakably wavering .

" What a weakness it is ! "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne muttered . " [I]290-wayne have never got rid of it from childhood -- the fear of [this magic shop]2452-this magic shop . [The grocer]2414-the grocer is rich , [he]2414-the grocer is romantic , [he]2414-the grocer is poetical in the truest sense , but [he]2414-the grocer is not -- no , [he]2414-the grocer is not supernatural . But [the chemist]1129-the chemist ! All [the other shops]2455-the other shops stand in [Notting Hill]2-notting hill , but this stands in [Elf - land]2456-elf - land . Look at those great burning bowls of colour . It must be from them that [God]199-god paints the sunsets . It is superhuman , and the superhuman is all the more uncanny when it is beneficent . That is the root of the fear of [God]199-god . [I]290-wayne am afraid . But [I]290-wayne must be [a man]388-a man and enter . "[290-wayne]

[He]1151-he was [a man]388-a man , and entered . [A short , dark young man]1153-a short , dark young man was behind the counter with spectacles , and greeted [him]1151-he with a bright but entirely business - like smile .

" A fine evening , [sir]1754-sir , "[1153-a short , dark young man] [he]1153-a short , dark young man said .

" Fine indeed , [strange Father]295-strange father , "[290-wayne] said [Adam]290-wayne , stretching [his]290-wayne hands somewhat forward . " It is on such clear and mellow nights that [[your]1754-sir shop]2459-your shop is most itself . Then they appear most perfect , those moons of green and gold and crimson , which from afar oft guide the pilgrim of pain and sickness to [this house of merciful witchcraft]2460-this house of merciful witchcraft . "[290-wayne]

" Can [I]1129-the chemist get [you]1129-the chemist anything ? "[1129-the chemist] asked [the chemist]1129-the chemist .

" Let [me]290-wayne see , "[290-wayne] said [Wayne]290-wayne , in a friendly but vague manner . " Let [me]290-wayne have some sal volatile . "[290-wayne]

" Eightpence , tenpence , or one and sixpence a bottle ? "[1155-the young man] said [the young man]1155-the young man , genially .

" One and six -- one and six , "[290-wayne] replied [Wayne]290-wayne , with a wild submissiveness . " [I]290-wayne come to ask [you]1129-the chemist , [Mr. Bowles]296-mr. bowles , a terrible question . "[290-wayne]

[He]290-wayne paused and collected [himself]290-wayne .

" It is necessary , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne muttered--"it is necessary to be tactful , and to suit the appeal to each profession in turn . "[290-wayne]

" [I]290-wayne come , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne resumed aloud , " to ask [you]1129-the chemist a question which goes to the roots of [your]1129-the chemist miraculous toils . [Mr. Bowles]296-mr. bowles , shall all this witchery cease ? "[290-wayne] And [he]290-wayne waved [his]290-wayne stick around [the shop]1140-the shop .

Meeting with no answer , [he]290-wayne continued with animation--

" In [Notting Hill]2-notting hill [we]2461-we have felt to its core the elfish mystery of [your]1129-the chemist profession . And now [Notting Hill]2-notting hill itself is threatened . "[290-wayne]

" Anything more , [sir]1754-sir ? "[1129-the chemist] asked [the chemist]1129-the chemist .

" Oh , "[290-wayne] said [Wayne]290-wayne , somewhat disturbed--"oh , what is it [chemists]2463-chemists sell ? Quinine , [I]290-wayne think . Thank [you]296-mr. bowles . Shall it be destroyed ? [I]290-wayne have met [these men of [Bayswater]54-bayswater and [North Kensington]83-north kensington]2464-these men of bayswater and north kensington -- [Mr. Bowles]296-mr. bowles , [they]2464-these men of bayswater and north kensington are [materialists]2465-materialists . [They]2464-these men of bayswater and north kensington see no witchery in [your]1129-the chemist work , even when it is wrought within [their]2464-these men of bayswater and north kensington own borders . [They]2464-these men of bayswater and north kensington think [the chemist]1129-the chemist is commonplace . [They]2464-these men of bayswater and north kensington think [him]1129-the chemist human . "[290-wayne]

[The chemist]1129-the chemist appeared to pause , only a moment , to take in the insult , and immediately said--

" And the next article , please ? "[1129-the chemist]

" [Alum]297-alum , "[876-the provost] said [the Provost]876-the provost , wildly . " [I]876-the provost resume . It is in [this sacred town]2467-this sacred town alone that [your]1129-the chemist priesthood is reverenced . Therefore , when [you]1129-the chemist fight for [us]2468-us [you]1129-the chemist fight not only for [yourself]1129-the chemist , but for everything [you]1129-the chemist typify . [You]1129-the chemist fight not only for [Notting Hill]2-notting hill , but for [Fairyland]115-fairyland , for as surely as [Buck]287-buck and [Barker]287-buck and [such men]2469-such men hold sway , the sense of [Fairyland]115-fairyland in some strange manner diminishes . "[876-the provost]

" Anything more , [sir]1754-sir ? "[296-mr. bowles] asked [Mr. Bowles]296-mr. bowles , with unbroken cheerfulness .

" Oh yes , [jujubes]2471-jujubes -- [Gregory powder]116-gregory powder -- [magnesia]117-magnesia . The danger is imminent .
