[I]1129-the chemist know [I]1129-the chemist can count upon [you]2474-you . "[1129-the chemist]

" Oh yes , [sir]1754-sir , "[1129-the chemist] said [the chemist]1129-the chemist , with great animation ; " [we]2476-we are always glad to oblige [a good customer]2477-a good customer . "[1129-the chemist]

[Adam Wayne]290-wayne went out of [the shop]1140-the shop with a deep sense of fulfilment of soul .

" It is so fortunate , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne said , " to have tact , to be able to play upon the peculiar talents and specialities , the cosmopolitanism of [the grocer]2414-the grocer and the world - old necromancy of [the chemist]1129-the chemist . Where should [I]290-wayne be without tact ? "[290-wayne]

CHAPTER II--_The [Remarkable Mr. Turnbull]298-turnbull _

After two more interviews with [shopmen]1162-shopmen , however , [the patriot]1080-the patriot 's confidence in [his]1080-the patriot own psychological diplomacy began vaguely to wane . Despite the care with which [he]1080-the patriot considered the peculiar rationale and the peculiar glory of [each separate shop]1164-each separate shop , there seemed to be something unresponsive about [the shopmen]1165-the shopmen . Whether it was a dark resentment against the uninitiate for peeping into [their]1165-the shopmen masonic magnificence , [he]1080-the patriot could not quite conjecture .

[His]1080-the patriot conversation with [the man who kept [the shop of curiosities]1167-the shop of curiosities]1166-the man who kept the shop of curiosities had begun encouragingly . [The man who kept [the shop of curiosities]1167-the shop of curiosities]1166-the man who kept the shop of curiosities had , indeed , enchanted [him]1080-the patriot with a phrase . [He]1166-the man who kept the shop of curiosities was standing drearily at the door of [[his]1166-the man who kept the shop of curiosities shop]1170-his shop , [a wrinkled man with a grey pointed beard]1171-a wrinkled man with a grey pointed beard , evidently [a gentleman who had come down in [the world]352-the world]1172-a gentleman who had come down in the world .

" And how does [your]574-the man commerce go , [[you]574-the man strange guardian of the past]2480-you strange guardian of the past ? "[290-wayne] said [Wayne]290-wayne , affably .

" Well , [sir]1754-sir , not very well , "[574-the man] replied [the man]574-the man , with that patient voice of [his]574-the man class which is one of the most heart - breaking things in [the world]352-the world . " Things are terribly quiet . "[574-the man]

[Wayne]290-wayne 's eyes shone suddenly .

" A great saying , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne said , " worthy of [a man whose merchandise is human history]2482-a man whose merchandise is human history . Terribly quiet ; that is in two words the spirit of this age , as [I]290-wayne have felt it from [my]290-wayne cradle . [I]290-wayne sometimes wondered how many [other people]1807-other people felt the oppression of this union between quietude and terror . [I]290-wayne see [blank well - ordered streets]2484-blank well - ordered streets and [men in black]2485-men in black moving about inoffensively , sullenly . It goes on day after day , day after day , and nothing happens ; but to [me]290-wayne it is like a dream from which [I]290-wayne might wake screaming . To [me]290-wayne the straightness of [our]2486-we life is the straightness of a thin cord stretched tight . Its stillness is terrible . It might snap with a noise like thunder . And [you]2487-you who sit , amid the _ débris _ of the great wars , [you]2487-you who sit , as it were , upon [a battlefield]2488-a battlefield , [you]2487-you know that war was less terrible than this evil peace ; [you]2487-you know that [the idle lads who carried those swords under [Francis]299-francis or [Elizabeth]300-elizabeth , [the rude Squire]2490-the rude squire or [Baron who swung that mace about in]2491-baron who swung that mace about in [Picardy]118-picardy or [Northumberland]119-northumberland battles]2489-the idle lads who carried those swords under francis or elizabeth , the rude squire or baron who swung that mace about in picardy or northumberland battles , may have been terribly noisy , but were not like [us]2486-we , terribly quiet . "[290-wayne]

Whether it was a faint embarrassment of conscience as to the original source and date of the weapons referred to , or merely an engrained depression , [the guardian of the past]1176-the guardian of the past looked , if anything , a little more worried .

" But [I]290-wayne do not think , "[290-wayne] continued [Wayne]290-wayne , " that this horrible silence of modernity will last , though [I]290-wayne think for the present it will increase . What a farce is this modern liberality ! Freedom of speech means practically , in [our]2486-we modern civilisation , that [we]2486-we must only talk about unimportant things . [We]2486-we must not talk about religion , for that is illiberal ; [we]2486-we must not talk about bread and cheese , for that is talking shop ; [we]2486-we must not talk about death , for that is depressing ; [we]2486-we must not talk about birth , for that is indelicate . It can not last . Something must break this strange indifference , this strange dreamy egoism , this strange loneliness of [millions in a crowd]2492-millions in a crowd . Something must break it . Why should it not be [you]1177-the shopman and [I]290-wayne ? Can [you]1177-the shopman do nothing else but guard relics ? "[290-wayne]

[The shopman]1177-the shopman wore a gradually clearing expression , which would have led those unsympathetic with the cause of [the Red Lion]301-the red lion to think that the last sentence was the only one to which [he]1177-the shopman had attached any meaning .

" [I]1177-the shopman am rather old to go into a new business , "[1177-the shopman] [he]1177-the shopman said , " and [I]1177-the shopman do n't quite know what to be , either . "[1177-the shopman]

" Why not , "[290-wayne] said [Wayne]290-wayne , gently having reached the crisis of [his]290-wayne delicate persuasion--"why not be [a colonel]2493-a colonel ? "[290-wayne]

It was at this point , in all probability , that the interview began to yield more disappointing results . [The man]574-the man appeared inclined at first to regard the suggestion of becoming [a colonel]2493-a colonel as outside the sphere of immediate and relevant discussion . A long exposition of the inevitable war of independence , coupled with the purchase of a doubtful sixteenth - century sword for an exaggerated price , seemed to resettle matters . [Wayne]290-wayne left [the shop]1140-the shop , however , somewhat infected with the melancholy of [its owner]1181-its owner .

That melancholy was completed at [[the barber]1131-the barber 's]1183-the barber 's .

" Shaving , [sir]1754-sir ? "[1184-that artist] inquired [that artist]1184-that artist from inside [[his]1184-that artist shop]1170-his shop .

" War ! "[290-wayne] replied [Wayne]290-wayne , standing on the threshold .

" [I]618-the other beg [your]290-wayne pardon , "[618-the other] said [the other]618-the other , sharply .

" War ! "[290-wayne] said [Wayne]290-wayne , warmly . " But not for anything inconsistent with the beautiful and the civilised arts . War for beauty . War for [society]2495-society . War for peace . A great chance is offered [you]290-wayne of repelling that slander which , in defiance of the lives of [so many artists]2496-so many artists , attributes poltroonery to those who beautify and polish the surface of [our]2497-our lives . Why should not [hairdressers]2498-hairdressers be [heroes]2499-heroes ? Why should not-- "[290-wayne]

" Now , [you]290-wayne get out , "[1131-the barber] said [the barber]1131-the barber , irascibly . " [We]2497-our do n't want any of [your]290-wayne sort here . [You]290-wayne get out . "[1131-the barber]

And [he]1131-the barber came forward with the desperate annoyance of [a mild person]1188-a mild person when enraged .

[Adam Wayne]290-wayne laid [his]290-wayne hand for a moment on the sword , then dropped it .

" [Notting Hill]2-notting hill , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne said , " will need [[her]2-notting hill bolder sons]2500-her bolder sons ; "[290-wayne] and [he]290-wayne turned gloomily to [the toy - shop]1189-the toy - shop .

It was [one of [those queer little shops]1191-those queer little shops so constantly seen in [the side streets of [London]17-london]1192-the side streets of london]1190-one of those queer little shops so constantly seen in the side streets of london , which must be called [toy - shops]1193-toy - shops only because toys upon the whole predominate ; for the remainder of goods seem to consist of almost everything else in [the world]352-the world -- tobacco , exercise - books , sweet - stuff , novelettes , halfpenny paper clips , halfpenny pencil sharpeners , bootlaces , and cheap fireworks . [It]1189-the toy - shop also sold newspapers , and a row of dirty - looking posters hung along the front of [it]1189-the toy - shop .

" [I]290-wayne am afraid , "[290-wayne] said [Wayne]290-wayne , as [he]290-wayne entered , " that [I]290-wayne am not getting on with [these tradesmen]2501-these tradesmen as [I]290-wayne should . Is it that [I]290-wayne have neglected to rise to the full meaning of [their]2501-these tradesmen work ? Is there some secret buried in each of [these shops]2502-these shops which [no mere poet]2503-no mere poet can discover ? "[290-wayne]

[He]290-wayne stepped to the counter with a depression which [he]290-wayne rapidly conquered as [he]290-wayne addressed [the man on the other side of]1195-the man on the other side of [it,--a man of short stature , and hair prematurely white , and the look of a large baby]1196-it,--a man of short stature , and hair prematurely white , and the look of a large baby .

" [Sir]1754-sir , "[290-wayne] said [Wayne]290-wayne , " [I]290-wayne am going from [house]2505-house to [house]2505-house in [this street of [ours]2508-ours]2507-this street of ours , seeking to stir up some sense of the danger which now threatens [[our]2508-ours city]2509-our city . Nowhere have [I]290-wayne felt [my]290-wayne duty so difficult as here . For [the toy - shop keeper]2510-the toy - shop keeper has to do with all that remains to [us]2508-ours of [Eden]120-eden before the first wars began . [You]1754-sir sit here meditating continually upon the wants of that wonderful time when every staircase leads to the stars , and every garden - path to [the other end of nowhere]2511-the other end of nowhere . Is it thoughtlessly , do [you]1754-sir think , that [I]290-wayne strike the dark old drum of peril in the paradise of [children]367-children ? But consider a moment ; do not condemn [me]290-wayne hastily . Even that [paradise]2513-paradise [itself]2513-paradise contains the rumour or beginning of that danger , just as [the Eden]120-eden that was made for perfection contained the terrible tree . For judge childhood , even by [your]1754-sir own arsenal of its pleasures . [You]1754-sir keep bricks ; [you]1754-sir make [yourself]1754-sir thus , doubtless , [the witness of the constructive instinct older than the destructive]2514-the witness of the constructive instinct older than the destructive . [You]1754-sir keep dolls ; [you]1754-sir make [yourself]1754-sir [the priest of that divine idolatry]2515-the priest of that divine idolatry . [You]1754-sir keep [[Noah]228-noah 's Arks]2516-noah 's arks ; [you]1754-sir perpetuate the memory of the salvation of all life as a precious , an irreplaceable thing . But do [you]1754-sir keep only , [sir]1754-sir , the symbols of this prehistoric sanity , this childish rationality of [the earth]670-the earth ? Do [you]1754-sir not keep more terrible things ? What are those boxes , seemingly of [lead soldiers]2519-lead soldiers , that [I]290-wayne see in that glass case ? Are [they]2519-lead soldiers not witnesses to that terror and beauty , that desire for a lovely death , which could not be excluded even from the immortality of [Eden]120-eden ? Do not despise [the lead soldiers]2520-the lead soldiers , [Mr. Turnbull]298-turnbull . "[290-wayne]

" [I]298-turnbull do n't , "[298-turnbull] said [Mr. Turnbull]298-turnbull , of [the toy - shop]1189-the toy - shop , shortly , but with great emphasis .

[The little toy - shop keeper]1198-the little toy - shop keeper sprang up suddenly , slapping [his]1198-the little toy - shop keeper fat hands like two fans on the counter .

[Wayne]290-wayne was almost taken aback by this outburst .

" [I]290-wayne am delighted , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne stammered . " [I]290-wayne had no notion-- "[290-wayne]

[He]290-wayne sprang out of the way just in time to avoid [Mr. Turnbull]298-turnbull , who took a flying leap over the counter and dashed to the front of [the shop]1140-the shop .

" [You]298-turnbull look here , [sir]1754-sir , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne said ; " [you]298-turnbull just look here . "[290-wayne]

[He]290-wayne came back with two of the torn posters in [his]290-wayne hand which were flapping outside [[his]290-wayne shop]1170-his shop .

[Wayne]290-wayne bent over [them]1201-them again , evidently puzzled ; then [he]290-wayne looked at the dates . [They]1201-them were both dated in August fifteen years before .

" Why do [you]1754-sir keep these old things ? "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne said , startled entirely out of [his]290-wayne absurd tact of mysticism . " Why do [you]1754-sir hang them outside [[your]1754-sir shop]2459-your shop ? "[290-wayne]

[Wayne]290-wayne lifted [his]290-wayne large blue eyes with an infantile wonder .

" Come with [me]298-turnbull , "[298-turnbull] said [Turnbull]298-turnbull , shortly , and led [him]290-wayne into [a parlour at the back of [the shop]1140-the shop]1203-a parlour at the back of the shop .

" [You]290-wayne are acquainted , no doubt , "[298-turnbull] said [Turnbull]298-turnbull , turning [his]298-turnbull big eyes upon [Wayne--"you]303-wayne--"you are acquainted , no doubt , with the arrangement of the American and [Nicaraguan troops]2534-nicaraguan troops in the last battle ; "[298-turnbull] and [he]298-turnbull waved [his]298-turnbull hand towards the table .
