" In that case , "[298-turnbull] [he]298-turnbull said , " [I]298-turnbull may approach [you]290-wayne with an unusual degree of confidence . Touching the matter of the defence of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill , [I--]298-turnbull "[298-turnbull]

" Defence of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill ? Yes , [sir]1754-sir . This way , [sir]1754-sir , "[298-turnbull] said [Turnbull]298-turnbull , with great perturbation . " Just step into [this side room]2537-this side room ; "[298-turnbull] and [he]298-turnbull led [Wayne]290-wayne into [another apartment]1212-another apartment , in which the table was entirely covered with an arrangement of [children]367-children 's bricks . A second glance at [it]1214-it told [Wayne]290-wayne that the bricks were arranged in the form of a precise and perfect plan of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill . " [Sir]1754-sir , "[298-turnbull] said [Turnbull]298-turnbull , impressively , " [you]1754-sir have , by a kind of accident , hit upon the whole secret of [my]298-turnbull life . As [a boy]567-a boy , [I]298-turnbull grew up among the last wars of [the world]352-the world , when [Nicaragua]26-nicaragua was taken and [the dervishes]2541-the dervishes wiped out . And [I]298-turnbull adopted it as a hobby , [sir]1754-sir , as [you]1754-sir might adopt astronomy or bird - stuffing . [I]298-turnbull had no ill - will to [any one]2145-any one , but [I]298-turnbull was interested in war as a science , as a game . And suddenly [I]298-turnbull was bowled out . [The big Powers of [the world]352-the world]2544-the big powers of the world , having swallowed up [all the small ones]2546-all the small ones , came to that confounded agreement , and there was no more war . There was nothing more for [me]298-turnbull to do but to do what [I]298-turnbull do now -- to read the old campaigns in dirty old newspapers , and to work them out with [tin soldiers]2547-tin soldiers . One other thing had occurred to [me]298-turnbull . [I]298-turnbull thought it an amusing fancy to make a plan of how [this district]2548-this district or [ours]2549-ours ought to be defended if [it]2548-this district were ever attacked . It seems to interest [you]1754-sir too . "[298-turnbull]

" If it were ever attacked , "[290-wayne] repeated [Wayne]290-wayne , awed into an almost mechanical enunciation . " [Mr. Turnbull]298-turnbull , it is attacked . Thank Heaven , [I]290-wayne am bringing to at least [one human being]2550-one human being the news that is at bottom the only good news to [any son of Adam]2551-any son of adam . [Your]1754-sir life has not been useless . [Your]1754-sir work has not been play . Now , when the hair is already grey on [your]1754-sir head , [Turnbull]298-turnbull , [you]1754-sir shall have [your]1754-sir youth . [God]199-god has not destroyed , [He]199-god has only deferred it . Let [us]2549-ours sit down here , and [you]1754-sir shall explain to [me]290-wayne this military map of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill . For [you]1754-sir and [I]290-wayne have to defend [Notting Hill]2-notting hill together . "[290-wayne]

[Mr. Turnbull]298-turnbull looked at [the other]618-the other for a moment , then hesitated , and then sat down beside the bricks and [the stranger]607-the stranger . [He]298-turnbull did not rise again for seven hours , when the dawn broke .

* * * * *

[The headquarters of [Provost Adam Wayne]280-wayne]1217-the headquarters of provost adam wayne and [[his]280-wayne Commander - in - Chief]1218-his commander - in - chief consisted of [a small and somewhat unsuccessful milk - shop]1219-a small and somewhat unsuccessful milk - shop at [the corner of [Pump Street]88-pump street]1220-the corner of pump street . The blank white morning had only just begun to break over [the blank London buildings]1221-the blank london buildings when [Wayne]280-wayne and [Turnbull]298-turnbull were to be found seated in [the cheerless and unswept shop]1222-the cheerless and unswept shop . [Wayne]280-wayne had something feminine in [his]280-wayne character ; [he]280-wayne belonged to [that class of persons who forget [their]1223-that class of persons who forget their meals when anything interesting is in hand meals when anything interesting is in hand]1223-that class of persons who forget their meals when anything interesting is in hand . [He]280-wayne had had nothing for sixteen hours but hurried glasses of milk , and , with a glass standing empty beside [him]280-wayne , [he]280-wayne was writing and sketching and dotting and crossing out with inconceivable rapidity with a pencil and a piece of paper . [Turnbull]298-turnbull was of that more masculine type in which a sense of responsibility increases the appetite , and with [his]298-turnbull sketch - map beside [him]298-turnbull [he]298-turnbull was dealing strenuously with a pile of sandwiches in a paper packet , and a tankard of ale from [the tavern opposite , whose shutters had just been taken down]1224-the tavern opposite , whose shutters had just been taken down . Neither of [them]1225-them spoke , and there was no sound in the living stillness except the scratching of [Wayne]280-wayne 's pencil and the squealing of an aimless - looking cat . At length [Wayne]280-wayne broke the silence by saying--

" Seventeen pounds eight shillings and ninepence . "[280-wayne]

[Turnbull]298-turnbull nodded and put [his]298-turnbull head in the tankard .

" That , "[280-wayne] said [Wayne]280-wayne , " is not counting the five pounds [you]298-turnbull took yesterday . What did [you]298-turnbull do with it ? "[280-wayne]

" Ah , that is rather interesting ! "[298-turnbull] replied [Turnbull]298-turnbull , with [his]298-turnbull mouth full . " [I]298-turnbull used that five pounds in a kindly and philanthropic act . "[298-turnbull]

[Wayne]280-wayne was gazing with mystification in [his]280-wayne queer and innocent eyes .

" [I]618-the other used that five pounds , "[618-the other] continued [the other]618-the other , " in giving no less than [forty little [London]17-london boys]2552-forty little london boys rides in [hansom cabs]2553-hansom cabs . "[618-the other]

" Are [you]876-the provost insane ? "[876-the provost] asked [the Provost]876-the provost .

" It is only [my]298-turnbull light touch , "[298-turnbull] returned [Turnbull]298-turnbull . " These hansom - cab rides will raise the tone -- raise the tone , [[my]298-turnbull dear fellow -- of [[our]2555-our [London]17-london youths]2556-our london youths]2554-my dear fellow -- of our london youths , widen [their]2556-our london youths horizon , brace [their]2556-our london youths nervous system , make [them]2556-our london youths acquainted with [the various public monuments of [[our]2555-our great city]2558-our great city]2557-the various public monuments of our great city . Education , [Wayne]280-wayne , education . How [many excellent thinkers]2559-many excellent thinkers have pointed out that political reform is useless until [we]2555-our produce [a cultured populace]2560-a cultured populace . So that twenty years hence , when [these boys]2561-these boys are grown up-- "[298-turnbull]

" Mad ! "[280-wayne] said [Wayne]280-wayne , laying down [his]280-wayne pencil ; " and five pounds gone ! "[280-wayne]

" [You]280-wayne are in error , "[298-turnbull] explained [Turnbull]298-turnbull . " [You]280-wayne grave creatures can never be brought to understand how much quicker work really goes with the assistance of nonsense and good meals . Stripped of its decorative beauties , [my]1228-i statement was strictly accurate . Last night [I]1228-i gave forty half - crowns to [forty little boys]2562-forty little boys , and sent [them]2562-forty little boys all over [London]17-london to take [hansom cabs]2553-hansom cabs . [I]1228-i told [them]2562-forty little boys in every case to tell [the cabman]2564-the cabman to bring [them]2562-forty little boys to this spot . In half an hour from now the declaration of war will be posted up . At the same time the cabs will have begun to come in , [you]280-wayne will have ordered out [the guard]2565-the guard , [the little boys]2566-the little boys will drive up in state , [we]2567-we shall commandeer the horses for cavalry , use the cabs for barricade , and give [the men]521-the men the choice between serving in [our]2567-we ranks and detention in [[our]2567-we basements and [cellars]2570-cellars]2569-our basements and cellars . [The little boys [we]2567-we can use as [scouts]2572-scouts]2571-the little boys we can use as scouts . The main thing is that [we]2567-we start the war with an advantage unknown in all [the other armies]2573-the other armies -- horses . And now , "[1228-i] [he]1228-i said , finishing [his]1228-i beer , " [I]1228-i will go and drill [the troops]2574-the troops . "[1228-i]

And [he]1228-i walked out of [the milk - shop]1229-the milk - shop , leaving [the Provost]876-the provost staring .

A minute or two afterwards , [the Provost]876-the provost laughed . [He]876-the provost only laughed once or twice in [his]876-the provost life , and then [he]876-the provost did it in a queer way as if it were an art [he]876-the provost had not mastered . Even [he]876-the provost saw something funny in the preposterous coup of the half - crowns and [the little boys]2566-the little boys . [He]876-the provost did not see the monstrous absurdity of the whole policy and the whole war . [He]876-the provost enjoyed it seriously as a crusade , that is , [he]876-the provost enjoyed it far more than any joke can be enjoyed . [Turnbull]298-turnbull enjoyed it partly as a joke , even more perhaps as a reversion from the things [he]298-turnbull hated -- modernity and monotony and civilisation . To break up the vast machinery of modern life and use the fragments as engines of war , to make the barricade of omnibuses and points of vantage of chimney - pots , was to [him]298-turnbull a game worth infinite risk and trouble . [He]298-turnbull had that rational and deliberate preference which will always to the end trouble the peace of [the world]352-the world , the rational and deliberate preference for a short life and a merry one .

CHAPTER III--_The Experiment of [Mr. Buck]273-buck _

An earnest and eloquent petition was sent up to [the King]1924-the king signed with the names of [Wilson]274-wilson , [Barker]287-buck , [Buck]287-buck , [Swindon]305-swindon , and [others]1235-others . [It]1236-it urged that at the forthcoming conference to be held in [[his]1924-the king Majesty]756-his majesty 's presence touching the final disposition of [the property in [Pump Street]88-pump street]1238-the property in pump street , it might be held not inconsistent with political decorum and with the unutterable respect [they]1239-they entertained for [[his]1924-the king Majesty]756-his majesty if [they]1239-they appeared in ordinary morning dress , without the costume decreed for [them]1239-they as [Provosts]1241-provosts . So it happened that [the company]1242-the company appeared at that council in frock - coats and that [the King]1924-the king [himself]1924-the king limited [his]1924-the king love of ceremony to appearing ( after [his]1924-the king not unusual manner ) , in evening dress with one order -- in this case not the Garter , but the button of the Club of [Old Clipper 's Best Pals]1244-old clipper 's best pals , a decoration obtained ( with difficulty ) from [a halfpenny boy]1245-a halfpenny boy 's paper . Thus also it happened that the only spot of colour in [the room]696-the room was [Adam Wayne]280-wayne , who entered in great dignity with the great red robes and the great sword .

" [We]2575-we have met , "[261-auberon] said [Auberon]261-auberon , " to decide the most arduous of modern problems . May [we]2575-we be successful . "[261-auberon] And [he]261-auberon sat down gravely .

[Buck]287-buck turned [his]287-buck chair a little , and flung one leg over the other .

" [[Your]756-his majesty Majesty]1946-your majesty , "[287-buck] [he]287-buck said , quite good - humouredly , " there is only one thing [I]287-buck ca n't understand , and that is why this affair is not settled in five minutes . Here 's [a small property which is worth a thousand to [us]2575-we and is not worth a hundred to [any one else]2578-any one else]2577-a small property which is worth a thousand to us and is not worth a hundred to any one else . [We]2575-we offer the thousand . It 's not business - like , [I]287-buck know , for [we]2575-we ought to get it for less , and it 's not reasonable and it 's not fair on [us]2575-we , but [I]287-buck 'm damned if [I]287-buck can see why it 's difficult . "[287-buck]

" The difficulty may be very simply stated , "[280-wayne] said [Wayne]280-wayne . " [You]280-wayne may offer a million and it will be very difficult for [you]280-wayne to get [Pump Street]88-pump street . "[280-wayne]

" But look here , [Mr. Wayne]290-wayne , "[287-buck] cried [Barker]287-buck , striking in with a kind of cold excitement . " Just look here . [You]280-wayne 've no right to take up a position like that . [You]280-wayne 've a right to stand out for a bigger price , but [you]280-wayne are n't doing that . [You]280-wayne 're refusing what [you]280-wayne and [every sane man]2579-every sane man knows to be a splendid offer simply from malice or spite -- it must be malice or spite . And that kind of thing is really criminal ; it 's against the public good . [The King 's Government]123-the king 's government would be justified in forcing [you]280-wayne . "[287-buck]

With [his]280-wayne lean fingers spread on the table , [he]280-wayne stared anxiously at [Wayne]290-wayne 's face , which did not move .

" In forcing [you]290-wayne ... it would , "[280-wayne] [he]280-wayne repeated .

" [It]2580-it shall , "[287-buck] said [Buck]287-buck , shortly , turning to the table with a jerk . " [We]2581-we have done [our]2581-we best to be decent . "[287-buck]

[Wayne]290-wayne lifted [his]290-wayne large eyes slowly .

" Was it [[my]290-wayne Lord [Buck]287-buck]2234-my lord buck , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne inquired , " who said that [the King of [England]8-england]1829-the king of england ' shall ' do something ? "[290-wayne]

[Buck]287-buck flushed and said testily--

" [I]287-buck mean it must -- it ought to . As [I]287-buck say , [we]2581-we 've done [our]2581-we best to be generous ; [I]287-buck defy [any one]2145-any one to deny it . As it is , [Mr. Wayne]290-wayne , [I]287-buck do n't want to say a word that 's uncivil . [I]287-buck hope it 's not uncivil to say that [you]290-wayne can be , and ought to be , in [gaol]2585-gaol . It is criminal to stop public works for a whim . [A man]388-a man might as well burn ten thousand onions in [[his]388-a man front garden]2587-his front garden or bring up [[his]388-a man children]2588-his children to run naked in [the street]394-the street , as do what [you]290-wayne say [you]290-wayne have a right to do . [People]1752-people have been compelled to sell before now . [The King]261-auberon could compel [you]290-wayne , and [I]287-buck hope [he]261-auberon will . "[287-buck]

" Until [he]261-auberon does , "[290-wayne] said [Wayne]290-wayne , calmly , " the power and government of [this great nation]2591-this great nation is on [my]290-wayne side and not [yours]290-wayne , and [I]290-wayne defy [you]290-wayne to defy it . "[290-wayne]

" In what sense , "[287-buck] cried [Barker]287-buck , with [his]287-buck feverish eyes and hands , " is [the Government]124-the government on [your]290-wayne side ? "[287-buck]

With one ringing movement [Wayne]290-wayne unrolled a great parchment on the table . It was decorated down the sides with wild water - colour sketches of [vestrymen in crowns and wreaths]1247-vestrymen in crowns and wreaths .

" The Charter of [the Cities]692-the cities , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne began .

[Buck]287-buck exploded in a brutal oath and laughed .

" That tomfool 's joke . Have n't [we]2593-we had enough-- "[287-buck]

" And there [you]287-buck sit , "[290-wayne] cried [Wayne]290-wayne , springing erect and with a voice like a trumpet , " with no argument but to insult [the King]1924-the king before [his]1924-the king face . "[290-wayne]

[Buck]287-buck rose also with blazing eyes .

" [I]287-buck am hard to bully , "[287-buck] [he]287-buck began -- and the slow tones of [the King]1924-the king struck in with incomparable gravity--

" [[My]1924-the king Lord [Buck]287-buck]2234-my lord buck , [I]1924-the king must ask [you]287-buck to remember that [[your]287-buck King]2197-your king is present . It is not often that [he]2197-your king needs to protect [himself]2197-your king among [[his]2197-your king subjects]2597-his subjects . "[1924-the king]

[Barker]287-buck turned to [him]287-buck with frantic gestures .

" For God 's sake do n't back up [the madman]984-the madman now , "[287-buck] [he]287-buck implored . " Have [your]287-buck joke another time . Oh , for Heaven 's sake-- "[287-buck]

" [[My]261-auberon Lord Provost of [South Kensington]56-south kensington]282-the lord high provost of south kensington , "[261-auberon] said [King Auberon]261-auberon , steadily , " [I]261-auberon do not follow [your]287-buck remarks , which are uttered with a rapidity unusual at [Court]125-court . Nor do [your]287-buck well - meant efforts to convey the rest with [your]287-buck fingers materially assist [me]261-auberon . [I]261-auberon say that [[my]261-auberon Lord Provost of [North Kensington]83-north kensington]2599-my lord provost of north kensington , to whom [I]261-auberon spoke , ought not in the presence of [[his]2599-my lord provost of north kensington Sovereign]2600-his sovereign to speak disrespectfully of [his]2599-my lord provost of north kensington Sovereign 's ordinances . Do [you]287-buck disagree ? "[261-auberon]

[Barker]287-buck turned restlessly in [his]287-buck chair , and [Buck]287-buck cursed without speaking . [The King]1924-the king went on in a comfortable voice--

" [[My]1924-the king Lord Provost of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]2601-my lord provost of notting hill , proceed . "[1924-the king]

[Wayne]290-wayne turned [his]290-wayne blue eyes on [the King]1924-the king , and to [every one]1959-every one 's surprise there was a look in them not of triumph , but of a certain childish distress .

" [I]290-wayne am sorry , [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne said ; " [I]290-wayne fear [I]290-wayne was more than equally to blame with [the Lord Provost of [North Kensington]83-north kensington]2603-the lord provost of north kensington . [We]2604-we were debating somewhat eagerly , and [we]2604-we both rose to [our]2604-we feet . [I]290-wayne did so first , [I]290-wayne am ashamed to say . [The Provost of [North Kensington]83-north kensington]856-the provost of north kensington is , therefore , comparatively innocent . [I]290-wayne beseech [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty to address [your]1924-the king rebuke chiefly , at least , to [me]290-wayne . [Mr. Buck]273-buck is not innocent , for [he]273-buck did no doubt , in the heat of the moment , speak disrespectfully . But the rest of the discussion [he]273-buck seems to [me]290-wayne to have conducted with great good temper . "[290-wayne]

[Buck]273-buck looked genuinely pleased , for [business men]1252-business men are all simple - minded , and have therefore that degree of communion with [fanatics]1253-fanatics . [The King]1924-the king , for some reason , looked , for the first time in [his]1924-the king life , ashamed .

" This very kind speech of [the Provost of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]928-the provost of notting hill , "[273-buck] began [Buck]273-buck , pleasantly , " seems to [me]273-buck to show that [we]2608-we have at least got on to a friendly footing . Now come , [Mr. Wayne]290-wayne . Five hundred pounds have been offered to [you]290-wayne for a property [you]290-wayne admit not to be worth a hundred . Well , [I]273-buck am [a rich man]2609-a rich man and [I]273-buck wo n't be outdone in generosity . Let [us]2608-we say fifteen hundred pounds , and have done with it . And let [us]2608-we shake hands ; "[273-buck] and [he]1924-the king rose , glowing and laughing .

" Fifteen hundred pounds , "[274-wilson] whispered [Mr. Wilson of Bayswater]274-wilson ; " can [we]2608-we do fifteen hundred pounds ? "[274-wilson]

" [I]273-buck 'll stand the racket , "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , heartily . " [Mr. Wayne]290-wayne is [a gentleman]906-a gentleman and has spoken up for [me]273-buck . So [I]273-buck suppose the negotiations are at an end . "[273-buck]

[Wayne]290-wayne bowed .

" [They]2611-they are indeed at an end . [I]274-wilson am sorry [I]274-wilson can not sell [you]273-buck [the property]2612-the property . "[274-wilson]

" What ? "[247-barker] cried [Mr. Barker]247-barker , starting to [his]247-barker feet .

" [Mr. Buck]273-buck has spoken correctly , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king .

" [I]273-buck have , [I]273-buck have , "[273-buck] cried [Buck]273-buck , springing up also ; " [I]273-buck said-- "[273-buck]

" [Mr. Buck]273-buck has spoken correctly , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king ; " the negotiations are at an end . "[1924-the king]

[All the men at the table]1257-all the men at the table rose to [their]1257-all the men at the table feet ; [Wayne]290-wayne alone rose without excitement .

" Have [I]290-wayne , then , "[290-wayne] [he]290-wayne said , " [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty 's permission to depart ? [I]290-wayne have given [my]290-wayne last answer . "[290-wayne]

" [You]1924-the king have it , "[261-auberon] said [Auberon]261-auberon , smiling , but not lifting [his]261-auberon eyes from the table . And amid a dead silence [the Provost of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]928-the provost of notting hill passed out of [the room]696-the room .

" Well ? "[274-wilson] said [Wilson]274-wilson , turning round to [Barker--"well]306-barker--"well ? "[274-wilson]

[Barker]247-barker shook [his]247-barker head desperately .

" [The man]574-the man ought to be in [an asylum]2615-an asylum , "[247-barker] [he]247-barker said . " But one thing is clear -- [we]2616-we need not bother further about [him]574-the man . [The man]574-the man can be treated as mad . "[247-barker]

" Of course , "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , turning to [him]247-barker with sombre decisiveness . " [You]247-barker 're perfectly right , [Barker]247-barker . [He]574-the man is [a good enough fellow]2618-a good enough fellow , but [he]574-the man can be treated as mad . Let 's put it in simple form . Go and tell [any twelve men in [any town]2620-any town]2619-any twelve men in any town , go and tell [any doctor in [any town]2620-any town]2621-any doctor in any town , that there is [a man]388-a man offered fifteen hundred pounds for a thing [he]574-the man could sell commonly for four hundred , and that when asked for a reason for not accepting it [he]574-the man pleads the inviolate sanctity of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill and calls [it]2-notting hill [the Holy Mountain]126-the holy mountain . What would [they]2616-we say ? What more can [we]2624-we have on [our]2624-we side than the common sense of [everybody]595-everybody ? On what else do all laws rest ? [I]273-buck 'll tell [you]247-barker , [Barker]247-barker , what 's better than any further discussion . Let 's send in [workmen on the spot]2626-workmen on the spot to pull down [Pump Street]88-pump street . And if [old Wayne]290-wayne says a word , arrest [him]290-wayne as [a lunatic]2627-a lunatic . That 's all . "[273-buck]

[Barker]247-barker 's eyes kindled .

" [I]247-barker always regarded [you]247-barker , [Buck]273-buck , if [you]247-barker do n't mind [my]247-barker saying so , as [a very strong man]2628-a very strong man . [I]247-barker 'll follow [you]247-barker . "[247-barker]

" So , of course , will [I]274-wilson , "[274-wilson] said [Wilson]274-wilson .

[Buck]273-buck rose again impulsively .

" [[Your]247-barker Majesty]1946-your majesty , "[273-buck] [he]273-buck said , glowing with popularity , " [I]273-buck beseech [[your]247-barker Majesty]1946-your majesty to consider favourably the proposal to which [we]2631-we have committed [ourselves]2631-we . [[Your]247-barker Majesty]1946-your majesty 's leniency , [our]2631-we own offers , have fallen in vain on [that extraordinary man]2633-that extraordinary man . [He]2633-that extraordinary man may be right . [He]2633-that extraordinary man may be [God]199-god . [He]2633-that extraordinary man may be [the devil]2634-the devil . But [we]2631-we think it , for practical purposes , more probable that [he]2633-that extraordinary man is off [his]2633-that extraordinary man head . Unless that assumption were acted on , all human affairs would go to pieces . [We]2631-we act on it , and [we]2631-we propose to start operations in [Notting Hill]2-notting hill at once . "[273-buck]

[The King]1924-the king leaned back in [his]1924-the king chair .

" The Charter of [the Cities]692-the cities ... , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said with a rich intonation .

But [Buck]273-buck , being finally serious , was also cautious , and did not again make the mistake of disrespect .

" [[Your]1946-your majesty Majesty]1946-your majesty , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said , bowing , " [I]1924-the king am not here to say a word against anything [[your]1946-your majesty Majesty]1946-your majesty has said or done . [You]273-buck are [a far better educated man]2638-a far better educated man than [I]1924-the king , and no doubt there were reasons , upon intellectual grounds , for those proceedings . But may [I]1924-the king ask [you]273-buck and appeal to [your]273-buck common good - nature for a sincere answer ? When [you]273-buck drew up the Charter of [the Cities]692-the cities , did [you]273-buck contemplate the rise of [a man like [Adam Wayne]290-wayne]2640-a man like adam wayne ? Did [you]273-buck expect that the Charter -- whether it was an experiment , or a scheme of decoration , or a joke -- could ever really come to this -- to stopping a vast scheme of ordinary business , to shutting up [a road]2137-a road , to spoiling the chances of [cabs]525-cabs , [omnibuses]2643-omnibuses , [railway stations]2644-railway stations , to disorganising [half a city]2645-half a city , to risking a kind of civil war ? Whatever were [your]273-buck objects , were they that ? "[1924-the king]

[Barker]247-barker and [Wilson]274-wilson looked at [him]1261-him admiringly ; [the King]1924-the king more admiringly still .

" [Provost Buck]307-buck , "[261-auberon] said [Auberon]261-auberon , " [you]273-buck speak in public uncommonly well . [I]261-auberon give [you]273-buck [your]273-buck point with the magnanimity of [an artist]2222-an artist . [My]261-auberon scheme did not include the appearance of [Mr. Wayne]290-wayne . Alas ! would that [my]261-auberon poetic power had been great enough . "[261-auberon]

" [I]307-buck thank [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty , "[307-buck] said [Buck]307-buck , courteously , but quickly . " [[Your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty 's statements are always clear and studied ; therefore [I]307-buck may draw a deduction . As the scheme , whatever it was , on which [you]273-buck set [your]273-buck heart did not include the appearance of [Mr. Wayne]290-wayne , it will survive [his]290-wayne removal . Why not let [us]2649-our clear away [this particular Pump Street]2650-this particular pump street , which does interfere with [our]2649-our plans , and which does not , by [your]1924-the king Majesty 's own statement , interfere with [yours]273-buck . "[307-buck]

" Caught out ! "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king , enthusiastically and quite impersonally , as if [he]1924-the king were watching a cricket match .

" [This man Wayne]290-wayne , "[307-buck] continued [Buck]307-buck , " would be shut up by [any doctors in [England]8-england]2651-any doctors in england . But [we]2649-our only ask to have it put before [them]2651-any doctors in england . Meanwhile [no one]416-no one 's interests , not even in all probability [his]416-no one own , can be really damaged by going on with the improvements in [Notting Hill]2-notting hill . Not [our]2649-our interests , of course , for it has been the hard and quiet work of ten years . Not the interests of [Notting Hill]2269-notting hill , for nearly all [[its]2269-notting hill educated inhabitants]2654-its educated inhabitants desire the change . Not the interests of [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty , for [you]1924-the king say , with characteristic sense , that [you]1924-the king never contemplated the rise of [the lunatic]2656-the lunatic at all . Not , as [I]307-buck say , [his]290-wayne own interests , for [the man]574-the man has a kind heart and many talents , and [a couple of good doctors]2658-a couple of good doctors would probably put [him]290-wayne righter than [all the free cities and sacred mountains in creation]2659-all the free cities and sacred mountains in creation . [I]307-buck therefore assume , if [I]307-buck may use so bold a word , that [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty will not offer any obstacle to [our]2661-our proceeding with the improvements . "[307-buck]

[And Mr. Buck]273-buck sat down amid subdued but excited applause among [the allies]1264-the allies .

" [Mr. Buck]273-buck , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king , " [I]1924-the king beg [your]273-buck pardon , for a number of beautiful and sacred thoughts , in which [you]273-buck were generally classified as [a fool]1742-a fool . But there is another thing to be considered . Suppose [you]273-buck send in [[your]273-buck workmen]2663-your workmen , and [Mr. Wayne]290-wayne does a thing regrettable indeed , but of which , [I]1924-the king am sorry to say , [I]1924-the king think [him]290-wayne quite capable -- knocks [their]2663-your workmen teeth out ? "[1924-the king]

" [I]273-buck have thought of that , [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty , "[273-buck] said [Mr. Buck]273-buck , easily , " and [I]273-buck think it can simply be guarded against . Let [us]2665-us send in a strong guard of , say , [a hundred men]2666-a hundred men -- a hundred of the [North Kensington Halberdiers]127-north kensington halberdiers "[273-buck] ( [he]273-buck smiled grimly ) , " of whom [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty is so fond . Or say a hundred and fifty . [The whole population of [Pump Street]88-pump street]2668-the whole population of pump street , [I]273-buck fancy , is only about a hundred . "[273-buck]

" Still [they]2666-a hundred men might stand together and lick [you]273-buck , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king , dubiously .

" Then say two hundred , "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , gaily .

" It might happen , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king , restlessly , " that [one Notting Hiller]308-one notting hiller fought better than two [North Kensingtons]128-north kensingtons . "[1924-the king]

" It might , "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , coolly ; " then say two hundred and fifty . "[273-buck]

[The King]1924-the king bit [his]1924-the king lip .

" And if [they]2666-a hundred men are beaten too ? "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said viciously .

" [[Your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty , "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , and leaned back easily in [his]273-buck chair , " suppose [they]2666-a hundred men are . If anything be clear , it is clear that all fighting matters are mere matters of arithmetic . Here [we]2670-we have a hundred and fifty , say , of [Notting Hill soldiers]2671-notting hill soldiers . Or say two hundred . If [one of [them]2666-a hundred men]2672-one of them can fight [two of [us]2670-we]2673-two of us -- [we]2670-we can send in , not four hundred , but six hundred , and smash [him]2672-one of them . That is all . It is out of all immediate probability that [one of [them]2666-a hundred men]2672-one of them could fight [four of [us]2670-we]2675-four of us . So what [I]273-buck say is this . Run no risks . Finish it at once . Send in [eight hundred men]2676-eight hundred men and smash [him]2672-one of them -- smash [him]2672-one of them almost without seeing [him]2672-one of them . And go on with the improvements . "[273-buck]

And [Mr. Buck]273-buck pulled out a bandanna and blew [his]273-buck nose .

" Do [you]273-buck know , [Mr. Buck]273-buck , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king , staring gloomily at the table , " the admirable clearness of [your]273-buck reason produces in [my]1924-the king mind a sentiment which [I]1924-the king trust [I]1924-the king shall not offend [you]273-buck by describing as an aspiration to punch [your]273-buck head . [You]273-buck irritate [me]1924-the king sublimely . What can it be in [me]1924-the king ? Is it the relic of a moral sense ? "[1924-the king]

" But [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty , "[247-barker] said [Barker]247-barker , eagerly and suavely , " does not refuse [our]2678-our proposals ? "[247-barker]

" [[My]1924-the king dear]2123-my dear [Barker]247-barker , [your]247-barker proposals are as damnable as [your]247-barker manners . [I]1924-the king want to have nothing to do with them . Suppose [I]1924-the king stopped [them]1271-the men round the table altogether . What would happen ? "[1924-the king]

[Barker]247-barker answered in a very low voice--

" Revolution . "[247-barker]

[The King]1924-the king glanced quickly at [the men round the table]1271-the men round the table . [They]1271-the men round the table were all looking down silently : [their]1271-the men round the table brows were red .

[He]1924-the king rose with a startling suddenness , and an unusual pallor .

" [Gentlemen]1759-gentlemen , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said , " [you]1759-gentlemen have overruled [me]1924-the king . Therefore [I]1924-the king can speak plainly . [I]1924-the king think [Adam Wayne]290-wayne , who is as mad as [a hatter]2681-a hatter , worth more than a million of [you]1759-gentlemen . But [you]1759-gentlemen have the force , and , [I]1924-the king admit , the common sense , and [he]290-wayne is lost . Take [your]1759-gentlemen eight hundred halberdiers and smash [him]290-wayne . It would be more sportsmanlike to take two hundred . "[1924-the king]

" More sportsmanlike , "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , grimly , " but a great deal less humane . [We]2682-we are not [artists]2683-artists , and [streets purple with gore]2684-streets purple with gore do not catch [our]2682-we eye in the right way . "[273-buck]

" It is pitiful , "[261-auberon] said [Auberon]261-auberon . " With five or six times [their]2684-streets purple with gore number , there will be no fight at all . "[261-auberon]

" [I]273-buck hope not , "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , rising and adjusting [his]273-buck gloves . " [We]2682-we desire no fight , [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty . [We]2682-we are [peaceable business men]2686-peaceable business men . "[273-buck]

" Well , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king , wearily , " the conference is at an end at last . "[1924-the king]

And [he]1924-the king went out of [the room]696-the room before [any one else]2578-any one else could stir .

* * * * *

[Forty workmen]1275-forty workmen , a hundred [Bayswater Halberdiers]129-bayswater halberdiers , two hundred from [South]112-the south , and [three from [North Kensington]83-north kensington]1276-three from north kensington , assembled at the foot of [Holland Walk]131-holland walk and marched up [it]131-holland walk , under the general direction of [Barker]247-barker , who looked flushed and happy in full dress . At the end of the procession [a small and sulky figure]1277-a small and sulky figure lingered like [an urchin]1278-an urchin . It was [the King]1924-the king .

" [Barker]247-barker , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said at length , appealingly , " [you]247-barker are [an old friend of mine]2687-an old friend of mine -- [you]247-barker understand [my]1924-the king hobbies as [I]1924-the king understand [yours]247-barker . Why ca n't [you]247-barker let it alone ? [I]1924-the king hoped that such fun might come out of this Wayne business . Why ca n't [you]247-barker let it alone ? It does n't really so much matter to [you]247-barker -- what 's a road or so ? For [me]1924-the king it 's the one joke that may save [me]1924-the king from pessimism . Take [fewer men]2688-fewer men and give [me]1924-the king an hour 's fun . Really and truly , [James]247-barker , if [you]247-barker collected coins or humming - birds , and [I]1924-the king could buy one with the price of [[your]247-barker road]2689-your road , [I]1924-the king would buy it . [I]1924-the king collect incidents -- those rare , those precious things . Let [me]1924-the king have one . Pay a few pounds for it . Give [these Notting Hillers]2690-these notting hillers a chance . Let [them]2690-these notting hillers alone . "[1924-the king]

" [Auberon]227-auberon , "[247-barker] said [Barker]247-barker , kindly , forgetting all royal titles in a rare moment of sincerity , " [I]247-barker do feel what [you]247-barker mean . [I]247-barker have had moments when these hobbies have hit [me]247-barker . [I]247-barker have had moments when [I]247-barker have sympathised with [your]247-barker humours . [I]247-barker have had moments , though [you]247-barker may not easily believe it , when [I]247-barker have sympathised with the madness of [Adam Wayne]290-wayne . But [the world]352-the world , [Auberon]261-auberon , [the real world]2692-the real world , is not run on these hobbies . It goes on great brutal wheels of facts -- wheels on which [you]247-barker are the butterfly ; and [Wayne]290-wayne is [the fly on the wheel]2693-the fly on the wheel . "[247-barker]

[Auberon]261-auberon 's eyes looked frankly at the other 's .

" Thank [you]247-barker , [James]247-barker ; what [you]247-barker say is true . It is only a parenthetical consolation to [me]261-auberon to compare the intelligence of flies somewhat favourably with the intelligence of wheels . But it is the nature of flies to die soon , and the nature of wheels to go on for ever . Go on with the wheel . Good - bye , [old man]2694-old man . "[261-auberon]

And [James Barker]247-barker went on , laughing , with a high colour , slapping [his]247-barker bamboo on [his]247-barker leg .

[The King]1924-the king watched the tail of [the retreating regiment]1281-the retreating regiment with a look of genuine depression , which made [him]1924-the king seem more like [a baby]562-a baby than ever . Then [he]1924-the king swung round and struck [his]1924-the king hands together .

" In a world without humour , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said , " the only thing to do is to eat . And how perfect an exception ! How can [these people]2695-these people strike dignified attitudes , and pretend that things matter , when the total ludicrousness of life is proved by the very method by which it is supported ? [A man]388-a man strikes the lyre , and says , ' Life is real , life is earnest , ' and then goes into [a room]2697-a room and stuffs alien substances into a hole in [his]388-a man head . [I]1924-the king think [Nature]221-nature was indeed a little broad in [her]221-nature humour in these matters . But [we]2698-we all fall back on the pantomime , as [I]1924-the king have in this municipal affair . [Nature]221-nature has [her]221-nature farces , like the act of eating or the shape of the kangaroo , for the more brutal appetite . [She]221-nature keeps [her]221-nature stars and mountains for those who can appreciate something more subtly ridiculous . "[1924-the king] [He]1924-the king turned to [his]1924-the king equerry . " But , as [I]1924-the king said ' eating , ' let [us]2698-we have a picnic like [two nice little children]2699-two nice little children . Just run and bring [me]1924-the king a table and a dozen courses or so , and plenty of champagne , and under these swinging boughs , [Bowler]255-bowler , [we]2698-we will return to [Nature]221-nature . "[1924-the king]

It took about an hour to erect in [Holland Lane]134-holland lane [the monarch]1283-the monarch 's simple repast , during which time [he]1924-the king walked up and down and whistled , but still with an unaffected air of gloom . [He]1924-the king had really been done out of a pleasure [he]1924-the king had promised [himself]1924-the king , and had that empty and sickened feeling which [a child]362-a child has when disappointed of a pantomime . When [he]1924-the king and [the equerry]1285-the equerry had sat down , however , and consumed a fair amount of dry champagne , [his]1924-the king spirits began mildly to revive .

" Things take too long in [this world]2700-this world , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said . " [I]1924-the king detest all this Barkerian business about evolution and the gradual modification of things . [I]1924-the king wish [the world]352-the world had been made in six days , and knocked to pieces again in six more . And [I]1924-the king wish [I]1924-the king had done it . The joke 's good enough in a broad way , sun and moon and the image of [God]199-god , and all that , but [they]2702-they keep it up so damnably long . Did [you]255-bowler ever long for a miracle , [Bowler]255-bowler ? "[1924-the king]

" No , [sir]1754-sir , "[255-bowler] said [Bowler]255-bowler , who was [an evolutionist]1286-an evolutionist , and had been carefully brought up .

" Then [I]1924-the king have , "[1924-the king] answered [the King]1924-the king . " [I]1924-the king have walked along [a street]721-a street with the best cigar in the cosmos in [my]1924-the king mouth , and more Burgundy inside [me]1924-the king than [you]255-bowler ever saw in [your]255-bowler life , and longed that the lamp - post would turn into an elephant to save [me]1924-the king from the hell of blank existence . Take [my]1924-the king word for it , [[my]1924-the king evolutionary Bowler]2705-my evolutionary bowler , do n't [you]255-bowler believe [people]1752-people when [they]1752-people tell [you]255-bowler that [people]1752-people sought for a sign , and believed in miracles because [they]1752-people were ignorant . [They]1752-people did it because [they]1752-people were wise , filthily , vilely wise -- too wise to eat or sleep or put on [their]1752-people boots with patience . This seems delightfully like a new theory of the origin of Christianity , which would itself be a thing of no mean absurdity . Take some more wine . "[1924-the king]

The wind blew round [them]1288-them as [they]1288-them sat at [their]1288-them little table , with its white cloth and bright wine - cups , and flung the tree - tops of [Holland Park]135-holland park against each other , but the sun was in that strong temper which turns green into gold . [The King]1924-the king pushed away [his]1924-the king plate , lit a cigar slowly , and went on--

" Yesterday [I]1924-the king thought that something next door to a really entertaining miracle might happen to [me]1924-the king before [I]1924-the king went to amuse the worms . To see [that red - haired maniac waving a great sword]2708-that red - haired maniac waving a great sword , and making speeches to [[his]2708-that red - haired maniac waving a great sword incomparable followers]2709-his incomparable followers , would have been a glimpse of [that Land of Youth]2710-that land of youth from which [the Fates]2711-the fates shut [us]1288-them out . [I]1924-the king had planned some quite delightful things . [A Congress of [Knightsbridge]69-knightsbridge]2712-a congress of knightsbridge with a treaty , and [myself]1924-the king in the chair , and perhaps a Roman triumph , with [jolly old Barker led in chains]2713-jolly old barker led in chains . And now [these wretched prigs]2714-these wretched prigs have gone and stamped out [the exquisite Mr. Wayne]290-wayne altogether , and [I]1924-the king suppose [they]2714-these wretched prigs will put [him]290-wayne in [a private asylum]2715-a private asylum somewhere in [their]2714-these wretched prigs damned humane way . Think of the treasures daily poured out to [[his]290-wayne unappreciative keeper]2716-his unappreciative keeper ! [I]1924-the king wonder whether [they]2714-these wretched prigs would let [me]1924-the king be [[his]290-wayne keeper]2717-his keeper . But life is a vale . Never forget at any moment of [your]2718-your existence to regard it in the light of a vale . This graceful habit , if not acquired in youth-- "[1924-the king]

[The King]1924-the king stopped , with [his]1924-the king cigar lifted , for there had slid into [his]1924-the king eyes the startled look of [a man]388-a man listening . [He]1924-the king did not move for a few moments ; then [he]1924-the king turned [his]1924-the king head sharply towards the high , thin , and lath - like paling which fenced [certain long gardens]1292-certain long gardens and similar spaces from [the lane]1293-the lane . From behind [it]1294-it there was coming a curious scrambling and scraping noise , as of a desperate thing imprisoned in this box of thin wood . [The King]1924-the king threw away [his]1924-the king cigar , and jumped on to the table . From this position [he]1924-the king saw a pair of hands hanging with a hungry clutch on the top of the fence . Then the hands quivered with a convulsive effort , and a head shot up between [them]1296-them -- the head of one of [the Bayswater Town Council]1297-the bayswater town council , [his]1298-his eyes and whiskers wild with fear . [He]1924-the king swung [himself]1924-the king over , and fell on the other side on [his]1924-the king face , and groaned openly and without ceasing . The next moment the thin , taut wood of the fence was struck as by a bullet , so that it reverberated like a drum , and over it came tearing and cursing , with torn clothes and broken nails and bleeding faces , [twenty men at one rush]1299-twenty men at one rush . [The King]1924-the king sprang five feet clear off the table on to the ground . The moment after the table was flung over , sending bottles and glasses flying , and the _ débris _ was literally swept along the ground by that stream of [men pouring past]1301-men pouring past , and [Bowler]255-bowler was borne along with [them]1296-them , as [the King]1924-the king said in [his]1924-the king famous newspaper article , " like [a captured bride]2719-a captured bride . "[1924-the king] The great fence swung and split under the load of [climbers that still scaled and cleared it]1303-climbers that still scaled and cleared it . Tremendous gaps were torn in it by [this living artillery]1304-this living artillery ; and through [them]1305-them [the King]261-auberon could see [more and more frantic faces]1306-more and more frantic faces , as in a dream , and more and more [men]357-men running . [They]1305-them were as miscellaneous as if [some one]1308-some one had taken the lid off a human dustbin . Some were untouched , some were slashed and battered and bloody , some were splendidly dressed , some tattered and half naked , some were in the fantastic garb of [the burlesque cities]1309-the burlesque cities , some in the dullest modern dress . [The King]1924-the king stared at [all of [them]1311-all of them]1311-all of them , but [none of [them]1311-all of them]1312-none of them looked at [the King]1924-the king . Suddenly [he]1924-the king stepped forward .

" [Barker]247-barker , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said , " what is all this ? "[1924-the king]

" Beaten , "[2720-the politician--"beaten] said [the politician--"beaten]2720-the politician--"beaten all to hell ! "[1924-the king] And [he]1924-the king plunged past with nostrils shaking like a horse 's , and more and more [men]357-men plunged after [him]1924-the king .

Almost as [he]1924-the king spoke , the last standing strip of fence bowed and snapped , flinging , as from a catapult , a new figure upon [the road]583-the road . [He]1924-the king wore the flaming red of [the halberdiers of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]1316-the halberdiers of notting hill , and on [his]1924-the king weapon there was blood , and in [his]1924-the king face victory . In another moment masses of red glowed through the gaps of the fence , and [the pursuers]1317-the pursuers , with [their]1317-the pursuers halberds , came pouring down [the lane]1293-the lane . [Pursued and pursuers]1319-pursued and pursuers alike swept by [the little figure with the owlish eyes]1320-the little figure with the owlish eyes , who had not taken [his]1924-the king hands out of [his]1924-the king pockets .

[The King]1924-the king had still little beyond the confused sense of [a man caught in a torrent]1322-a man caught in a torrent -- the feeling of [men eddying by]1323-men eddying by . Then something happened which [he]1924-the king was never able afterwards to describe , and which [we]1324-we can not describe for [him]1924-the king . Suddenly in the dark entrance , between the broken gates of [a garden]1726-a garden , there appeared framed a flaming figure .

[Adam Wayne]290-wayne , [the conqueror]1326-the conqueror , with [his]290-wayne face flung back , and [his]290-wayne mane like a lion 's , stood with [his]290-wayne great sword point upwards , the red raiment of [[his]290-wayne office]1327-his office flapping round [him]290-wayne like the red wings of an archangel . And [the King]1924-the king saw , [he]1924-the king knew not how , something new and overwhelming . The great green trees and the great red robes swung together in the wind . The sword seemed made for the sunlight . [The preposterous masquerade]1329-the preposterous masquerade , born of [his]1924-the king own mockery , towered over [him]1924-the king and embraced [the world]352-the world . This was the normal , this was sanity , this was nature ; and [he]1924-the king [himself]1924-the king , with [his]1924-the king rationality and [his]1924-the king detachment and [his]1924-the king black frock - coat , [he]1924-the king was the exception and the accident -- a blot of black upon a world of crimson and gold .

BOOK IV

CHAPTER I--_The Battle of [the Lamps _

Mr. Buck]273-buck , who , though retired , frequently went down to [[his]273-buck big drapery stores in [Kensington High Street]136-kensington high street]1331-his big drapery stores in kensington high street , was locking up [those premises]1332-those premises , being the last to leave . It was a wonderful evening of green and gold , but that did not trouble [him]273-buck very much . If [you]1333-you had pointed it out , [he]273-buck would have agreed seriously , for [the rich]2227-the rich always desire to be artistic .

[He]273-buck stepped out into the cool air , buttoning up [his]273-buck light yellow coat , and blowing great clouds from [his]273-buck cigar , when a figure dashed up to [him]273-buck in another yellow overcoat , but unbuttoned and flying behind [him]273-buck .

" Hullo , [Barker]247-barker ! "[851-the draper] said [the draper]851-the draper . " Any of [our]2721-our summer articles ? [You]247-barker 're too late . [Factory Acts]2722-factory acts , [Barker]247-barker . Humanity and progress , [[my]851-the draper boy]2723-my boy . "[851-the draper]

" Oh , do n't chatter , "[247-barker] cried [Barker]247-barker , stamping . " [We]2721-our 've been beaten . "[247-barker]

" Beaten -- by what ? "[273-buck] asked [Buck]273-buck , mystified .

" By [Wayne]290-wayne . "[851-the draper]

[Buck]273-buck looked at [Barker]247-barker 's fierce white face for the first time , as it gleamed in the lamplight .

" Come and have a drink , "[273-buck] [he]273-buck said .

[They]1336-we adjourned to a cushioned and glaring buffet , and [Buck]273-buck established [himself]273-buck slowly and lazily in a seat , and pulled out [his]273-buck cigar - case .

" Have a smoke , "[273-buck] [he]273-buck said .

[Barker]247-barker was still standing , and on the fret , but after a moment 's hesitation , [he]247-barker sat down as if [he]247-barker might spring up again the next minute . [They]1336-we ordered drinks in silence .

" How did it happen ? "[273-buck] asked [Buck]273-buck , turning [his]273-buck big bold eyes on [him]247-barker .

" How the devil do [I]247-barker know ? "[247-barker] cried [Barker]247-barker . " It happened like -- like a dream . How can [two hundred men]2724-two hundred men beat six hundred ? How can [they]2724-two hundred men ? "[247-barker]

" Well , "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , coolly , " how did [they]2724-two hundred men ? [You]247-barker ought to know . "[273-buck]

" [I]618-the other do n't know ; [I]618-the other ca n't describe , "[618-the other] said [the other]618-the other , drumming on the table . " It seemed like this . [We]1336-we were six hundred , and marched with those damned poleaxes of [Auberon's]137-auberon's -- the only weapons [we]1336-we 've got . [We]1336-we marched two abreast . [We]1336-we went up [Holland Walk]131-holland walk , between the high palings which seemed to [me]618-the other to go straight as an arrow for [Pump Street]88-pump street . [I]618-the other was near the tail of the line , and it was a long one . When the end of it was still between [the high palings]2725-the high palings , the head of the line was already crossing [Holland Park Avenue]138-holland park avenue . Then the head plunged into the network of [narrow streets on the other side]2726-narrow streets on the other side , and the tail and [myself]618-the other came out on the great crossing . When [we]1336-we also had reached the northern side and turned up [a small street that points]2727-a small street that points , crookedly as [it]2727-a small street that points were , towards [Pump Street]88-pump street , the whole thing felt different . [The streets]359-the streets dodged and bent so much that the head of [our]1336-we line seemed lost altogether : it might as well have been in [North America]139-north america . And all this time [we]1336-we had n't seen [a soul]2729-a soul . "[618-the other]

[ Illustration : Map of [the SEAT of WAR]1338-the seat of war . ]

[Buck]273-buck , who was idly dabbing the ash of [his]273-buck cigar on the ash - tray , began to move it deliberately over the table , making feathery grey lines , a kind of map .

" But though [the little streets]2730-the little streets were all deserted ( which got a trifle on [my]273-buck nerves ) , as [we]1336-we got deeper and deeper into [them]2730-the little streets , a thing began to happen that [I]273-buck could n't understand . Sometimes a long way ahead -- three turns or corners ahead , as it were -- there broke suddenly a sort of noise , clattering , and confused cries , and then stopped . Then , when it happened , something , [I]273-buck ca n't describe it -- a kind of shake or stagger went down the line , as if the line were a live thing , whose head had been struck , or had been an electric cord . [None of [us]1336-we]1756-none of us knew why [we]1336-we were moving , but [we]1336-we moved and jostled . Then [we]1336-we recovered , and went on through [the little dirty streets]2732-the little dirty streets , [round corners]2733-round corners , and up twisted ways . [The little crooked streets]2734-the little crooked streets began to give [me]273-buck a feeling [I]273-buck ca n't explain -- as if it were a dream . [I]273-buck felt as if things had lost their reason , and [we]1336-we should never get out of the maze . Odd to hear [me]273-buck talk like that , is n't it ? [The streets]359-the streets were quite well - known streets , all down on the map . But the fact remains . [I]273-buck was n't afraid of something happening . [I]273-buck was afraid of nothing ever happening -- nothing ever happening for all [God]199-god 's eternity . "[273-buck]

[He]1339-he drained [his]1339-he glass and called for more whisky . [He]1339-he drank it , and went on .

" And then something did happen . [Buck]273-buck , it 's the solemn truth , that nothing has ever happened to [you]273-buck in [your]273-buck life . Nothing had ever happened to [me]1339-he in [my]1339-he life . "[1339-he]

" Nothing ever happened ! "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , staring . " What do [you]247-barker mean ? "[273-buck]

" Nothing has ever happened , "[247-barker] repeated [Barker]247-barker , with a morbid obstinacy . " [You]273-buck do n't know what a thing happening means ? [You]273-buck sit in [[your]273-buck office]2736-your office expecting [customers]2737-customers , and [customers]2737-customers come ; [you]273-buck walk in [the street]394-the street expecting [friends]2231-friends , and [friends]2231-friends meet [you]273-buck ; [you]273-buck want a drink , and get it ; [you]273-buck feel inclined for a bet , and make it . [You]273-buck expect either to win or lose , and [you]273-buck do either one or the other . But things happening ! "[247-barker] and [he]247-barker shuddered ungovernably .

" Go on , "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , shortly . " Get on . "[273-buck]

" As [we]2742-we walked wearily round the corners , something happened . When something happens , it happens first , and [you]273-buck see it afterwards . It happens of itself , and [you]273-buck have nothing to do with it . It proves a dreadful thing -- that there are other things besides [one]1758-one 's self . [I]247-barker can only put it in this way . [We]2742-we went round one turning , two turnings , three turnings , four turnings , five . Then [I]247-barker lifted [myself]247-barker slowly up from the gutter where [I]247-barker had been shot half senseless , and was beaten down again by [living men]2744-living men crashing on top of [me]247-barker , and [the world]352-the world was full of roaring , and [big men rolling about like nine - pins]2746-big men rolling about like nine - pins . "[247-barker]

[Buck]273-buck looked at [his]273-buck map with knitted brows .

" Was that [Portobello Road]140-portobello road ? "[273-buck] [he]273-buck asked .

" Yes , "[273-buck] said [Barker--"yes]309-barker--"yes ; [Portobello Road]140-portobello road . [I]273-buck saw [it]140-portobello road afterwards ; but , [[my]273-buck God]1896-my god , what [a place]2748-a place [it]140-portobello road was ! [Buck]273-buck , have [you]273-buck ever stood and let [a six foot of man]2749-a six foot of man lash and lash at [your]273-buck head with six feet of pole with six pounds of steel at the end ? Because , when [you]273-buck have had that experience , as [Walt Whitman]310-walt whitman says , ' [you]273-buck re - examine philosophies and religions . ' "[273-buck]

" [I]273-buck have no doubt , "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck . " If that was [Portobello Road]140-portobello road , do n't [you]273-buck see what happened ? "[273-buck]

" [I]273-buck know what happened exceedingly well . [I]273-buck was knocked down four times ; an experience which , as [I]273-buck say , has an effect on the mental attitude . And another thing happened , too . [I]273-buck knocked down [two men]2750-two men . After the fourth fall ( there was not much bloodshed -- more brutal rushing and throwing -- for [nobody]2751-nobody could use [their]2751-nobody weapons ) , after the fourth fall , [I]273-buck say , [I]273-buck got up like [a devil]2752-a devil , and [I]273-buck tore a poleaxe out of [a man]388-a man 's hand and struck where [I]273-buck saw the scarlet of [[Wayne]290-wayne 's fellows]2754-wayne 's fellows , struck again and again . [Two of [them]2754-wayne 's fellows]493-two of them went over , bleeding on the stones , thank [God]199-god ; and [I]273-buck laughed and found [myself]273-buck sprawling in the gutter again , and got up again , and struck again , and broke [my]273-buck halberd to pieces . [I]273-buck hurt [a man]388-a man 's head , though . "[273-buck]

[Buck]273-buck set down [his]273-buck glass with a bang , and spat out curses through [his]273-buck thick moustache .

" What is the matter ? "[247-barker] asked [Barker]247-barker , stopping , for [the man]574-the man had been calm up to now , and now [his]574-the man agitation was far more violent than [his]247-barker own .

" The matter ? "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , bitterly ; " do n't [you]247-barker see how [these maniacs]2757-these maniacs have got [us]2758-us ? Why should [two idiots]2759-two idiots , [one a clown]2760-one a clown and [the other]618-the other [a screaming lunatic]2762-a screaming lunatic , make [sane men]2763-sane men so different from [themselves]2759-two idiots ? Look here , [Barker]247-barker ; [I]273-buck will give [you]247-barker a picture . [A very well - bred young man of this century]2764-a very well - bred young man of this century is dancing about in a frock - coat . [He]2764-a very well - bred young man of this century has in [his]2764-a very well - bred young man of this century hands a nonsensical seventeenth - century halberd , with which [he]2764-a very well - bred young man of this century is trying to kill men in [a street in [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]2765-a street in notting hill . Damn it ! do n't [you]247-barker see how [they]2757-these maniacs 've got [us]2758-us ? Never mind how [you]247-barker felt -- that is how [you]247-barker looked . [The King]1924-the king would put [his]1924-the king cursed head on one side and call it exquisite . [The Provost of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]928-the provost of notting hill would put [his]928-the provost of notting hill cursed nose in the air and call it heroic . But in Heaven 's name what would [you]247-barker have called it -- two days before ? "[273-buck]

[Barker]247-barker bit [his]247-barker lip .

" [You]273-buck have n't been through it , [Buck]273-buck , "[247-barker] [he]247-barker said . " [You]273-buck do n't understand fighting -- the atmosphere . "[247-barker]

" [I]273-buck do n't deny the atmosphere , "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , striking the table . " [I]273-buck only say it 's [their]2768-their atmosphere . It 's [Adam Wayne]290-wayne 's atmosphere . It 's the atmosphere which [you]273-buck and [I]273-buck thought had vanished from [an educated world]2769-an educated world for ever . "[273-buck]

" Well , it has n't , "[247-barker] said [Barker]247-barker ; " and if [you]273-buck have any lingering doubts , lend [me]247-barker a poleaxe , and [I]247-barker 'll show [you]273-buck . "[247-barker]

There was a long silence , and then [Buck]273-buck turned to [[his]273-buck neighbour]1341-his neighbour and spoke in that good - tempered tone that comes of a power of looking facts in the face -- the tone in which [he]273-buck concluded great bargains .

" [Barker]247-barker , "[247-barker] [he]247-barker said , " [you]247-barker are right . This old thing -- this fighting , has come back . [It]2770-it has come back suddenly and taken [us]2771-us by surprise . So it is first blood to [Adam Wayne]290-wayne . But , unless reason and arithmetic and everything else have gone crazy , it must be next and last blood to [us]2771-us . But when an issue has really arisen , there is only one thing to do -- to study that issue as such and win in it . [Barker]247-barker , since it is fighting , [we]2771-us must understand fighting . [I]247-barker must understand fighting as coolly and completely as [I]247-barker understand drapery ; [you]247-barker must understand fighting as coolly and completely as [you]247-barker understand politics . Now , look at the facts . [I]247-barker stick without hesitation to [my]247-barker original formula . Fighting , when [we]2771-us have the stronger force , is only a matter of arithmetic . It must be . [You]247-barker asked [me]247-barker just now how [two hundred men]2724-two hundred men could defeat six hundred . [I]247-barker can tell [you]247-barker . [Two hundred men]2724-two hundred men can defeat six hundred when the six hundred behave like [fools]2774-fools . When [they]2724-two hundred men forget the very conditions [they]2724-two hundred men are fighting in ; when [they]2724-two hundred men fight in [a swamp]2775-a swamp as if it were [a mountain]2776-a mountain ; when [they]2724-two hundred men fight in [a forest]2777-a forest as if it were [a plain]2778-a plain ; when [they]2724-two hundred men fight in [streets]2779-streets without remembering the object of [streets]2779-streets . "[247-barker]

" What is the object of [streets]2779-streets ? "[247-barker] asked [Barker]247-barker .

" What is the object of supper ? "[273-buck] cried [Buck]273-buck , furiously . " Is n't it obvious ? This military science is mere common sense . The object of [a street]721-a street is to lead from [one place]2783-one place to another ; therefore [all streets]2784-all streets join ; therefore street fighting is quite a peculiar thing . [You]247-barker advanced into [that hive of streets]2785-that hive of streets as if [you]247-barker were advancing into [an open plain where [you]247-barker could see everything]2786-an open plain where you could see everything . Instead of that , [you]247-barker were advancing into the bowels of [a fortress]2787-a fortress , with [streets]2779-streets pointing at [you]247-barker , [streets]2779-streets turning on [you]247-barker , [streets]2779-streets jumping out at [you]247-barker , and all in the hands of [the enemy]434-the enemy . Do [you]247-barker know what [Portobello Road]140-portobello road is ? It is the only point on [your]247-barker journey where [two side streets]2792-two side streets run up opposite each other . [Wayne]290-wayne massed [[his]290-wayne men]2793-his men on the two sides , and when [he]290-wayne had let enough of [your]247-barker line go past , cut it in two like a worm . Do n't [you]247-barker see what would have saved [you]247-barker ? "[273-buck]

[Barker]247-barker shook [his]247-barker head .

" Ca n't [your]247-barker ' atmosphere ' help [you]247-barker ? "[273-buck] asked [Buck]273-buck , bitterly . " Must [I]273-buck attempt explanations in the romantic manner ? Suppose that , as [you]247-barker were fighting blindly with [the red Notting Hillers who imprisoned [you]247-barker on both sides]2794-the red notting hillers who imprisoned you on both sides , [you]247-barker had heard a shout from behind [them]2794-the red notting hillers who imprisoned you on both sides . "[273-buck]

" If the thing had been possible , "[247-barker] began [Barker]247-barker , cursing .

" The thing would have been as possible , "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , simply , " as simple as arithmetic . There are a certain number of street entries that lead to [Pump Street]88-pump street . There are not nine hundred ; there are not nine million . They do not grow in the night . They do not increase like mushrooms . It must be possible , with such an overwhelming force as [we]2795-we have , to advance by all of [them]2794-the red notting hillers who imprisoned you on both sides at once . In [every one of [the arteries]2797-the arteries]2796-every one of the arteries , or [approaches]2798-approaches , [we]2795-we can put almost as many men as [Wayne]290-wayne can put into the field altogether . Once do that , and [we]2795-we have [him]290-wayne to demonstration . It is like a proposition of Euclid . "[273-buck]

" [You]247-barker think that is certain ? "[247-barker] said [Barker]247-barker , anxious , but dominated delightfully .

" [I]273-buck 'll tell [you]247-barker what [I]273-buck think , "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , getting up jovially . " [I]273-buck think [Adam Wayne]290-wayne made an uncommonly spirited little fight ; and [I]273-buck think [I]273-buck am confoundedly sorry for [him]290-wayne . "[273-buck]

" [Buck]273-buck , [you]273-buck are [a great man]2799-a great man ! "[247-barker] cried [Barker]247-barker , rising also . " [You]273-buck 've knocked [me]247-barker sensible again . [I]247-barker am ashamed to say it , but [I]247-barker was getting romantic . Of course , what [you]273-buck say is adamantine sense . Fighting , being physical , must be mathematical . " Now , "[273-buck] said [Buck]273-buck , and walked out of [the bar]1342-the bar .

" Now ! "[247-barker] cried [Barker]247-barker , following [him]273-buck eagerly . " Do [you]273-buck mean now ? It is so late . "[247-barker]

* * * * *

A genuine reputation can sometimes be made in an hour . [Buck]273-buck , in the next sixty or eighty minutes , showed [himself]273-buck [a really great man of action]1345-a really great man of action . [[His]273-buck cab]1346-his cab carried [him]273-buck like a thunderbolt from [the King]1924-the king to [Wilson]274-wilson , from [Wilson]274-wilson to [Swindon]143-swindon , from [Swindon]143-swindon to [Barker]247-barker again ; if [his]273-buck course was jagged , it had the jaggedness of the lightning . Only two things [he]273-buck carried with [him]273-buck -- [his]273-buck inevitable cigar and the map of [North Kensington]83-north kensington and [Notting Hill]2-notting hill . There were , as [he]273-buck again and again pointed out , with every variety of persuasion and violence , only nine possible ways of approaching [Pump Street]88-pump street within a quarter of a mile round [it]88-pump street ; three out of [Westbourne Grove]84-westbourne grove , [two out of [Ladbroke Grove]145-ladbroke grove]1348-two out of ladbroke grove , and four out of [Notting Hill High Street]146-notting hill high street . And [he]273-buck had [detachments of two hundred each]1349-detachments of two hundred each , stationed at every one of the entrances before the last green of that strange sunset had sunk out of the black sky .

The sky was particularly black , and on this alone was one false protest raised against the triumphant optimism of [the Provost of [North Kensington]83-north kensington]856-the provost of north kensington . [He]273-buck overruled it with [his]273-buck infectious common sense .

" There is no such thing , "[273-buck] [he]273-buck said , " as night in [London]17-london . [You]2801-you have only to follow the line of street lamps . Look , here is the map . Two hundred purple North [Kensington]65-kensington [soldiers]2525-soldiers under [myself]273-buck march up [Ossington Street]147-ossington street , two hundred more under [Captain Bruce]311-captain bruce , of [the North Kensington Guard]2803-the north kensington guard , up [Clanricarde Gardens.[1 ] Two hundred yellow West Kensingtons under Provost Swindon]2804-clanricarde gardens.[1 ] two hundred yellow west kensingtons under provost swindon attack from [Pembridge Road]148-pembridge road . [Two hundred more of [[my]273-buck men]2806-my men from [the eastern streets]2807-the eastern streets , leading away from [Queen 's Road]149-queen 's road]2805-two hundred more of my men from the eastern streets , leading away from queen 's road .
