[Gentlemen]1759-gentlemen , it is mate in two moves . [The enemy]434-the enemy must either mass in [Pump Street]88-pump street and be cut to pieces ; or [they]434-the enemy must retreat past [the Gaslight & Coke Co.]152-the gaslight & coke co. , and rush on [my]273-buck four hundred ; or [they]434-the enemy must retreat past [St. Luke 's Church]153-st. luke 's church , and rush on the six hundred from [the West]24-the west . Unless [we]2813-we are all mad , it 's plain . Come on . To [[your]2814-your quarters]2815-your quarters and await [Captain Brace]313-captain brace 's signal to advance . Then [you]2814-your have only to walk up a line of gas - lamps and smash this nonsense by pure mathematics . To - morrow [we]2813-we shall all be [civilians]2816-civilians again . "[273-buck]

[ Footnote 1 : [Clanricarde Gardens]154-clanricarde gardens at this time was no longer [a _ cul - de - sac _]1351-a _ cul - de - sac _ , but was connected by [Pump Street]88-pump street to [Pembridge Square]155-pembridge square . See map . ]

[His]1352-his optimism glowed like a great fire in the night , and ran round the terrible ring in which [Wayne]290-wayne was now held helpless . The fight was already over . [One man]1825-one man 's energy for one hour had saved [the city]1941-the city from war .

For the next ten minutes [Buck]273-buck walked up and down silently beside the motionless clump of [his]273-buck two hundred . [He]273-buck had not changed [his]273-buck appearance in any way , except to sling across [his]273-buck yellow overcoat a case with a revolver in it . So that [[his]273-buck light - clad modern figure]1355-his light - clad modern figure showed up oddly beside the pompous purple uniforms of [[his]273-buck halberdiers]852-his halberdiers , which darkly but richly coloured the black night .

At length a shrill trumpet rang from some way up [the street]394-the street ; it was the signal of advance . [Buck]273-buck briefly gave the word , and the whole purple line , with its dimly shining steel , moved up [the side alley]1358-the side alley . Before it was a slope of [street]499-street , long , straight , and shining in the dark . It was a sword pointed at [Pump Street]88-pump street , the heart at which nine other swords were pointed that night .

A quarter of an hour 's silent marching brought [them]852-his halberdiers almost within earshot of any tumult in [the doomed citadel]1360-the doomed citadel . But still there was no sound and no sign of [the enemy]434-the enemy . This time , at any rate , [they]852-his halberdiers knew that [they]852-his halberdiers were closing in on [it]88-pump street mechanically , and [they]852-his halberdiers marched on under the lamplight and the dark without any of that eerie sense of ignorance which [Barker]247-barker had felt when entering [the hostile country]1362-the hostile country by [one avenue]1363-one avenue alone .

" [Halt -- point arms]156-halt -- point arms ! "[273-buck] cried [Buck]273-buck , suddenly , and as [he]273-buck spoke there came a clatter of feet tumbling along the stones . But the halberds were levelled in vain . [The figure that rushed up]1364-the figure that rushed up was [a messenger from [the contingent of [the North]111-the north]1366-the contingent of the north]1365-a messenger from the contingent of the north .

" Victory , [Mr. Buck]273-buck ! "[273-buck] [he]273-buck cried , panting ; " [they]852-his halberdiers are ousted . [Provost Wilson of [Bayswater]54-bayswater]2817-provost wilson of bayswater has taken [Pump Street]88-pump street . "[273-buck]

[Buck]273-buck ran forward in [his]273-buck excitement .

" Then , which way are [they]852-his halberdiers retreating ? It must be either by [St. Luke]314-st. luke 's to meet [Swindon]143-swindon , or by [the Gas Company]2818-the gas company to meet [us]2819-we . Run like mad to [Swindon]143-swindon , and see that the yellows are holding [the St. Luke 's Road]2820-the st. luke 's road . [We]2819-we will hold this , never fear . [We]2819-we have [them]852-his halberdiers in an iron trap . Run ! "[273-buck]

As [the messenger]1367-the messenger dashed away into the darkness , [the great guard of [North Kensington]83-north kensington]1368-the great guard of north kensington swung on with the certainty of a machine . Yet scarcely a hundred yards further [their]1368-the great guard of north kensington halberd - points again fell in line gleaming in the gaslight ; for again a clatter of feet was heard on the stones , and again it proved to be only [the messenger]1367-the messenger .

" [Mr. Provost]315-mr. provost , "[273-buck] [he]273-buck said , " the yellow West Kensingtons have been holding [the road by St. Luke 's]2821-the road by st. luke 's for twenty minutes since the capture of [Pump Street]88-pump street . [Pump Street]88-pump street is not two hundred yards away ; [they]852-his halberdiers can not be retreating down [that road]2822-that road . "[273-buck]

" Then [they]852-his halberdiers are retreating down this , "[307-buck] said [Provost Buck]307-buck , with a final cheerfulness , " and by good fortune down [a well - lighted road]2823-a well - lighted road , though it twists about . Forward ! "[307-buck]

As [they]1368-the great guard of north kensington moved along the last three hundred yards of [their]1368-the great guard of north kensington journey , [Buck]307-buck fell , for the first time in [his]307-buck life , perhaps , into a kind of philosophical reverie , for [men of [his]307-buck type]1370-men of his type are always made kindly , and as it were melancholy , by success .

" [I]307-buck am sorry for poor old [Wayne]290-wayne , [I]307-buck really am , "[307-buck] [he]307-buck thought . " [He]290-wayne spoke up splendidly for [me]307-buck at that Council . And [he]290-wayne blacked [old Barker]247-barker 's eye with considerable spirit . But [I]307-buck do n't see what [a man]388-a man can expect when [he]388-a man fights against arithmetic , to say nothing of civilisation . And what a wonderful hoax all this military genius is ! [I]307-buck suspect [I]307-buck 've just discovered what [Cromwell]316-cromwell discovered , that [a sensible tradesman]2825-a sensible tradesman is [the best general]2826-the best general , and that [a man who can buy [men]357-men and sell [men]357-men]2827-a man who can buy men and sell men can lead and kill [them]357-men . The thing 's simply like adding up a column in a ledger . If [Wayne]290-wayne has [two hundred men]2724-two hundred men , [he]290-wayne ca n't put [two hundred men]2724-two hundred men in nine places at once . If [they]2724-two hundred men 're ousted from [Pump Street]2832-pump street [they]2724-two hundred men 're flying somewhere . If [they]2724-two hundred men 're not flying past [the church]1771-the church [they]2724-two hundred men 're flying past [the Works]2834-the works . And so [we]2835-we have [them]2724-two hundred men . [[We]2835-we [business men]1252-business men]2836-we business men should have no chance at all except [that cleverer people]2838-that cleverer people than [we]2835-we get bees in [their]2838-that cleverer people bonnets that prevent [them]2838-that cleverer people from reasoning properly -- so [we]2835-we reason alone . And so [I]307-buck , who am comparatively stupid , see things as [God]199-god sees [them]2839-them , as a vast machine . [[My]307-buck God]1896-my god , what 's this ? "[307-buck] and [he]1371-he clapped [his]1371-he hands to [his]1371-he eyes and staggered back .

Then through the darkness [he]1371-he cried in a dreadful voice--

" Did [I]1371-he blaspheme [God]199-god ? [I]1371-he am struck blind . "[1371-he]

" What ? "[1371-he] wailed another voice behind [him]1371-he , the voice of a certain [Wilfred Jarvis of North Kensington]265-kensington .

" Blind ! "[307-buck] cried [Buck]307-buck ; " blind ! "[307-buck]

" [I]265-kensington 'm blind too ! "[265-kensington] cried [Jarvis]265-kensington , in an agony .

" [Fools]2774-fools , all of [you]1372-we , "[307-buck] said a gross voice behind [them]1372-we ; " [we]1372-we 're all blind . The lamps have gone out . "[307-buck]

" The lamps ! But why ? where ? "[307-buck] cried [Buck]307-buck , turning furiously in the darkness . " How are [we]1372-we to get on ? How are [we]1372-we to chase [the enemy]434-the enemy ? Where have [they]434-the enemy gone ? "[307-buck]

" [The enemy]434-the enemy went-- "[1373-the rough voice behind] said [the rough voice behind]1373-the rough voice behind , and then stopped doubtfully .

" Where ? "[307-buck] shouted [Buck]307-buck , stamping like [a madman]591-a madman .

" [They]434-the enemy went , "[1375-the gruff voice] said [the gruff voice]1375-the gruff voice , " past [the Gas Works]2844-the gas works , and [they]434-the enemy 've used [their]434-the enemy chance . "[1375-the gruff voice]

" [Great God]199-god ! "[307-buck] thundered [Buck]307-buck , and snatched at [his]307-buck revolver ; " do [you]199-god mean [they]434-the enemy 've turned out-- "[307-buck]

But almost before [he]307-buck had spoken the words , [he]307-buck was hurled like a stone from catapult into the midst of [[his]307-buck own men]1376-his own men .

" [Notting Hill]2-notting hill ! [Notting Hill]2-notting hill ! "[1377-they] cried frightful voices out of the darkness , and [they]1377-they seemed to come from all sides , for [the men of [North Kensington]83-north kensington]1378-the men of north kensington , unacquainted with [the road]583-the road , had lost all [their]1378-the men of north kensington bearings in [the black world of blindness]1380-the black world of blindness .

" [Notting Hill]2-notting hill ! [Notting Hill]2-notting hill ! "[1381-the invisible people] cried [the invisible people]1381-the invisible people , and [the invaders]1382-the invaders were hewn down horribly with black steel , with steel that gave no glint against any light .

* * * * *

[Buck]307-buck , though badly maimed with the blow of a halberd , kept an angry but splendid sanity . [He]307-buck groped madly for the wall and found it . Struggling with crawling fingers along it , [he]307-buck found a side opening and retreated into it with [the remnants of [[his]307-buck men]2793-his men]1383-the remnants of his men . [Their]2793-his men adventures during that prodigious night are not to be described . [They]2793-his men did not know whether [they]2793-his men were going towards or away from [the enemy]434-the enemy . Not knowing where [they]2793-his men [themselves]2793-his men were , or where [[their]2793-his men opponents]1386-their opponents were , it was mere irony to ask where was [the rest of [[their]2793-his men army]1388-their army]1387-the rest of their army . For a thing had descended upon [them]2793-his men which [London]17-london does not know -- darkness , which was before the stars were made , and [they]2793-his men were as much lost in it as if [they]2793-his men had been made before the stars . Every now and then , as those frightful hours wore on , [they]2793-his men buffeted in the darkness against [living men]2744-living men , who struck at [them]2793-his men and at whom [they]2793-his men struck , with an idiot fury . When at last the grey dawn came , [they]2793-his men found [they]2793-his men had wandered back to [the edge of [the Uxbridge Road]1391-the uxbridge road]1390-the edge of the uxbridge road . [They]2793-his men found that in those horrible eyeless encounters , [the North Kensingtons]1392-the north kensingtons and [the Bayswaters]150-two hundred green bayswaters and [the West Kensingtons]1393-the west kensingtons had again and again met and butchered [each other]1912-each other , and [they]2793-his men heard that [Adam Wayne]290-wayne was barricaded in [Pump Street]88-pump street .

CHAPTER II--_The Correspondent of [the Court Journal _

Journalism]1395-the court journal _ journalism had become , like most other such things in [England]8-england under [the cautious government]1396-the cautious government and philosophy represented by [James Barker]247-barker , somewhat sleepy and much diminished in importance . This was partly due to the disappearance of [party government]1397-party government and public speaking , partly to the compromise or dead - lock which had made foreign wars impossible , but mostly , of course , to the temper of [the whole nation]1398-the whole nation which was that of [a people]1399-a people in [a kind of back - water]1400-a kind of back - water . Perhaps the most well known of the remaining newspapers was [the _ Court Journal _]1401-the _ court journal _ , which was published in [a dusty but genteel - looking office just out of [Kensington High Street]136-kensington high street]1402-a dusty but genteel - looking office just out of kensington high street . For when all the papers of [a people]1399-a people have been for years growing more and more dim and decorous and optimistic , the dimmest and most decorous and most optimistic is very likely to win . In the journalistic competition which was still going on at the beginning of the twentieth century , the final victor was the _ Court Journal _ .

For some mysterious reason [the King]1924-the king had a great affection for hanging about in [the _ Court Journal _ office]1405-the _ court journal _ office , smoking a morning cigarette and looking over files . Like [all ingrainedly idle men]1406-all ingrainedly idle men , [he]1924-the king was very fond of lounging and chatting in places where [other people]1807-other people were doing work . But [one]1758-one would have thought that , even in the prosaic [England]8-england of [his]1924-the king day , [he]1924-the king might have found a more bustling centre .

On this particular morning , however , [he]1924-the king came out of [Kensington Palace]158-kensington palace with a more alert step and a busier air than usual . [He]1924-the king wore an extravagantly long frock - coat , a pale - green waistcoat , a very full and _ dégagé _ black tie , and curious yellow gloves . This was [his]1924-the king uniform as [Colonel of [a regiment of [his]1924-the king own creation]1410-a regiment of his own creation]1409-colonel of a regiment of his own creation , the 1st Decadents Green . It was a beautiful sight to see [him]1924-the king drilling [them]1411-them . [He]1924-the king walked quickly across [the Park]1412-the park and [the High Street]1413-the high street , lighting [his]1924-the king cigarette as [he]1924-the king went , and flung open the door of [the _ Court Journal _ office]1405-the _ court journal _ office .

" [You]1924-the king 've heard the news , [Pally]317-pally -- [you've]1924-the king heard the news ? "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said .

[The Editor]1415-the editor 's name was [Hoskins]318-hoskins , but [the King]1924-the king called [him]1924-the king [Pally]317-pally , which was an abbreviation of Paladium of [[our]1417-our Liberties]1418-our liberties .

" Well , [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty , "[318-hoskins] said [Hoskins]318-hoskins , slowly ( [he]318-hoskins was [a worried , gentlemanly looking person , with a wandering brown beard)--"well]2846-a worried , gentlemanly looking person , with a wandering brown beard)--"well , [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty , [I]318-hoskins have heard rather curious things , but [I--]318-hoskins "[318-hoskins]

" [You]1946-your majesty 'll hear more of them , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king , dancing a few steps of a kind of negro shuffle . " [You]1946-your majesty 'll hear more of them , [[my]1924-the king blood - and - thunder tribune]2848-my blood - and - thunder tribune . Do [you]1946-your majesty know what [I]1924-the king am going to do for [you]1946-your majesty ? "[1924-the king]

" No , [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty , "[319-the paladium] replied [the Paladium]319-the paladium , vaguely .

" [I]1924-the king 'm going to put [your]1946-your majesty paper on strong , dashing , enterprising lines , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king . " Now , where are [your]1946-your majesty posters of last night 's defeat ? "[1924-the king]

" [I]1415-the editor did not propose , [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty , "[1415-the editor] said [the Editor]1415-the editor , " to have any posters exactly-- "[1415-the editor]

" Paper , paper ! "[1924-the king] cried [the King]1924-the king , wildly ; " bring [me]1415-the editor paper as big as [a house]2851-a house . [I]1415-the editor 'll do [you]1946-your majesty posters . Stop , [I]1415-the editor must take [my]1415-the editor coat off . "[1415-the editor] [He]1415-the editor began removing that garment with an air of set intensity , flung it playfully at [Mr. Hoskins]318-hoskins ' head , entirely enveloping [him]1415-the editor , and looked at [himself]1415-the editor in the glass . " The coat off , "[1415-the editor] [he]1415-the editor said , " and the hat on . That looks like [a sub - editor]2852-a sub - editor . It is indeed the very essence of sub - editing . Well , "[1415-the editor] [he]1415-the editor continued , turning round abruptly , " come along with that paper . "[1415-the editor]

[The Paladium]319-the paladium had only just extricated [himself]319-the paladium reverently from the folds of [the King]1924-the king 's frock - coat , and said bewildered--

" [I]319-the paladium am afraid , [[your]1924-the king Majesty--]2853-your majesty-- "[319-the paladium]

" Oh , [you]1924-the king 've got no enterprise , "[261-auberon] said [Auberon]261-auberon . " What 's that roll in the corner ? Wall - paper ? Decorations for [[your]1924-the king private residence]2854-your private residence ? Art in [the home]2855-the home , [Pally]317-pally ? Fling it over here , and [I]261-auberon 'll paint such posters on the back of it that when [you]1924-the king put it up in [[your]1924-the king drawing - room]2856-your drawing - room [you]1924-the king 'll paste the original pattern against the wall . "[261-auberon] And [the King]1924-the king unrolled the wall - paper , spreading it over the whole floor . " Now give [me]1924-the king the scissors , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king cried , and took them [himself]1924-the king before [the other]618-the other could stir .

[He]1924-the king slit the paper into about five pieces , each nearly as big as a door . Then [he]1924-the king took a big blue pencil , and went down on [his]1924-the king knees on the dusty oil - cloth and began to write on them , in huge letters--

" FROM [THE FRONT]160-the front . [GENERAL BUCK]320-buck DEFEATED . DARKNESS , DANGER , AND DEATH . [WAYNE]290-wayne SAID TO BE IN [PUMP STREET]88-pump street . FEELING IN [THE CITY]1941-the city . "[1924-the king]

[He]1924-the king contemplated it for some time , with [his]1924-the king head on one side , and got up , with a sigh .

" Not quite intense enough , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said--"not alarming . [I]1924-the king want the _ Court Journal _ to be feared as well as loved . Let 's try something more hard - hitting . "[1924-the king] And [he]1924-the king went down on [his]1924-the king knees again . After sucking the blue pencil for some time , [he]1924-the king began writing again busily . " How will this do ? "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said--

" [WAYNE]290-wayne 'S WONDERFUL VICTORY . "[1924-the king]

" [I]1924-the king suppose , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said , looking up appealingly , and sucking the pencil--"I suppose [we]2858-we could n't say ' wictory'--'Wayne 's wonderful wictory ' ? No , no . Refinement , [Pally]317-pally , refinement . [I]1924-the king have it . "[1924-the king]

" [WAYNE]290-wayne WINS . ASTOUNDING FIGHT IN [THE DARK]161-the dark . _ The gas - lamps in [their]2859-their courses fought against [Buck]320-buck . _ "[1924-the king]

" ( Nothing like [our]2858-we fine old English translation . ) What else can [we]2858-we say ? Well , anything to annoy [old Buck]320-buck ; "[1924-the king] and [he]1924-the king added , thoughtfully , in smaller letters--

" Rumoured Court - martial on [General Buck]320-buck . "[1924-the king]

" Those will do for the present , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said , and turned [them]1426-them both face downwards . " Paste , please . "[1924-the king]

[The Paladium]1427-the paladium , with an air of great terror , brought the paste out of [an inner room]1428-an inner room .

[The King]1924-the king slabbed it on with the enjoyment of [a child]362-a child messing with treacle . Then taking one of [his]1924-the king huge compositions fluttering in each hand , [he]1924-the king ran outside , and began pasting them up in prominent positions over the front of [the office]1431-the office .

" And now , "[261-auberon] said [Auberon]261-auberon , entering again with undiminished vivacity--"now for the leading article . "[261-auberon]

[He]1924-the king picked up another of the large strips of wall - paper , and , laying it across a desk , pulled out a fountain - pen and began writing with feverish intensity , reading clauses and fragments aloud to [himself]1924-the king , and rolling them on [his]1924-the king tongue like wine , to see if they had the pure journalistic flavour .

" The news of the disaster to [[our]2858-we forces]2860-our forces in [Notting Hill]2-notting hill , awful as it is -- awful as it is--(no , distressing as it is ) , may do some good if it draws attention to the what's - [his]320-buck - name inefficiency ( scandalous inefficiency , of course ) of [the Government]124-the government 's preparations . In [our]2858-we present state of information , it would be premature ( what a jolly word!)--it would be premature to cast any reflections upon the conduct of [General Buck]320-buck , whose services upon so many stricken fields ( ha , ha ! ) , and whose honourable scars and laurels , give [him]320-buck a right to have judgment upon [him]320-buck at least suspended . But there is one matter on which [we]2858-we must speak plainly . [We]2858-we have been silent on it too long , from feelings , perhaps of mistaken caution , perhaps of mistaken loyalty . This situation would never have arisen but for what [we]2858-we can only call the indefensible conduct of [the King]1924-the king . It pains [us]2858-we to say such things , but , speaking as [we]2858-we do in the public interests ( [I]320-buck plagiarise from [Barker]247-barker 's famous epigram ) , [we]2858-we shall not shrink because of the distress [we]2858-we may cause to [any individual]2862-any individual , even the most exalted . At this crucial moment of [[our]2858-we country]2863-our country , the voice of [the People]447-the people demands with a single tongue , ' Where is [the King]1924-the king ? ' What is [he]1924-the king doing while [[his]1924-the king subjects]2597-his subjects tear each other in pieces in [the streets of [a great city]2868-a great city]2867-the streets of a great city ? Are [his]1924-the king amusements and [his]1924-the king dissipations ( of which [we]2858-we can not pretend to be ignorant ) so engrossing that [he]1924-the king can spare no thought for [a perishing nation]2869-a perishing nation ? It is with a deep sense of [our]2858-we responsibility that [we]2858-we warn [that exalted person]2870-that exalted person that neither [his]1924-the king great position nor [his]1924-the king incomparable talents will save [him]1924-the king in the hour of delirium from the fate of [all those who , in the madness of luxury or tyranny]2871-all those who , in the madness of luxury or tyranny , have met [the English people]2872-the english people in the rare day of its wrath . "[320-buck]

" [I]1924-the king am now , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king , " going to write an account of the battle by [an eye - witness]2873-an eye - witness . "[1924-the king] And [he]1924-the king picked up a fourth sheet of wall - paper . Almost at the same moment [Buck]320-buck strode quickly into [the office]1431-the office . [He]320-buck had a bandage round [his]320-buck head .

" [I]320-buck was told , "[320-buck] [he]320-buck said , with [his]320-buck usual gruff civility , " that [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty was here . "[320-buck]

" And of all things on [earth]2875-earth , "[1924-the king] cried [the King]1924-the king , with delight , " here is [an eye - witness]2873-an eye - witness ! Can [you]320-buck write [us]2878-us the special article , [Buck]320-buck ? Have [you]320-buck a rich style ? "[1924-the king]

[Buck]320-buck , with a self - restraint which almost approached politeness , took no notice whatever of [the King]1924-the king 's maddening geniality .

" [I]320-buck took the liberty , [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty , "[320-buck] [he]320-buck said shortly , " of asking [Mr. Barker]247-barker to come here also . "[320-buck]

" What is happening now ? "[320-buck] asked [Buck]320-buck , turning to [him]247-barker with a kind of relief .

" Fighting still going on , "[247-barker] said [Barker]247-barker . " [The four hundred from [West Kensington]73-west kensington]2880-the four hundred from west kensington were hardly touched last night . [[Poor Wilson]321-poor wilson 's [Bayswater]54-bayswater [men]357-men]2882-poor wilson 's bayswater men got cut about , though . [They]357-men fought confoundedly well . [They]357-men took [Pump Street]88-pump street once . What mad things do happen in [the world]352-the world . " [I]1924-the king have an idea , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said . " [I]1924-the king will be [an eye - witness]2873-an eye - witness . " Well , "[247-barker] said [Barker]247-barker , gloomily , " well . "[247-barker]

" [Barker]247-barker , "[320-buck] said [Buck]320-buck , " business may be lower than politics , but war is , as [I]320-buck discovered last night , a long sight more like business . [[You]320-buck [politicians]1965-politicians]2891-you politicians are such ingrained demagogues that even when [you]320-buck have a despotism [you]320-buck think of nothing but public opinion . So [you]320-buck learn to tack and run , and are afraid of the first breeze . Now [we]2893-we stick to a thing and get it . And [our]2893-we mistakes help [us]2893-we . [Barker]247-barker smiled grimly .

" It is a gratification to [me]247-barker , [[my]247-barker dear]2123-my dear [Buck]320-buck , to be able to say that [we]2893-we anticipated [your]320-buck suggestions precisely . "[247-barker]

There was a silence for a few moments , and [Barker]247-barker lay back wearily in a chair . The office clock ticked exactly in the stillness .

At length [Barker]247-barker said suddenly--

" [Buck]320-buck , does it ever cross [your]320-buck mind what this is all about ? [You]320-buck and [I]247-barker hoped a great deal from it . But is it worth it ? It will cost [us]2893-we thousands to crush this ridiculous riot . Suppose [we]2893-we let it alone ? "[247-barker]

" And be thrashed in public by [a red - haired madman whom [any two doctors]2904-any two doctors would lock up]2903-a red - haired madman whom any two doctors would lock up ? " [Buck]320-buck , "[247-barker] said [Barker]247-barker , " [I]247-barker always admired [you]320-buck . And [you]320-buck were quite right in what [you]320-buck said the other day . "[247-barker]

" In what ? "[320-buck]

* * * * *

[The King]1924-the king , meanwhile , was rattling along on the top of [[his]1924-the king blue omnibus]1443-his blue omnibus . [The traffic of [London]17-london]1444-the traffic of london as a whole had not , of course , been greatly disturbed by these events , for the affair was treated as a [Notting Hill]2-notting hill riot , and [that area]1445-that area was marked off as if [it]1445-that area had been in the hands of [a gang of recognised rioters]1446-a gang of recognised rioters . The blue omnibuses simply went round as [they]1447-they would have done if [a road]2137-a road were being mended , and the omnibus on which [the correspondent of [the _ Court Journal _]1401-the _ court journal _]1449-the correspondent of the _ court journal _ was sitting swept round the corner of [Queen 's Road]149-queen 's road , [Bayswater]54-bayswater .

[The King]1924-the king was alone on the top of [the vehicle]830-the vehicle , and was enjoying the speed at which it was going .

" Forward , [[my]1924-the king beauty]2918-my beauty , [[my]1924-the king Arab]2919-my arab , "[1924-the king] [he]1924-the king said , patting [the omnibus]1453-the omnibus encouragingly , " fleetest of all [[thy]2919-my arab bounding tribe]2920-thy bounding tribe . [His]1924-the king meditations were broken by a sudden and jarring stoppage .
