If [they]3270-they fought for [these trumpery shops]3271-these trumpery shops and a few lamp - posts , shall [we]3264-we not fight for [the great High Street]3272-the great high street and [the sacred Natural History Museum]3273-the sacred natural history museum ? "[247-barker]

" [Great Heavens]189-great heavens ! "[334-auberon] said [the astounded Auberon]334-auberon . " Will wonders never cease ? Have the two greatest marvels been achieved ? Have [you]247-barker turned altruistic , and has [Wayne]280-wayne turned selfish ? Are [you]247-barker [the patriot]1080-the patriot , and [he]280-wayne [the tyrant]3275-the tyrant ? "[334-auberon]

" It is not from [Wayne]280-wayne [himself]280-wayne altogether that the evil comes , "[247-barker] answered [Barker]247-barker . " [He]280-wayne , indeed , is now mostly wrapped in dreams , and sits with [his]280-wayne old sword beside the fire . But [Notting Hill]2-notting hill is [the tyrant]3275-the tyrant , [[your]247-barker Majesty]1946-your majesty . [Its]2-notting hill Council and [[its]2-notting hill crowds]3278-its crowds have been so intoxicated by the spreading over [the whole city of Wayne]3279-the whole city of wayne 's old ways and visions , that [they]3278-its crowds try to meddle with every one , and rule every one , and civilise every one , and tell [every one]1959-every one what is good for [him]280-wayne . [I]247-barker do not deny the great impulse which [his]280-wayne old war , wild as it seemed , gave to the civic life of [our]3281-we time . It came when [I]247-barker was still [a young man]3282-a young man , and [I]247-barker admit it enlarged [my]247-barker career . But [we]3281-we are not going to see [[our]3281-we own cities]3283-our own cities flouted and thwarted from day to day because of something [Wayne]280-wayne did for [us]3281-we all nearly a quarter of a century ago . [I]247-barker am just waiting here for news upon this very matter . It is rumoured that [Notting Hill]2-notting hill has vetoed the statue of [General Wilson]328-wilson [they]2-notting hill are putting up opposite [Chepstow Place]151-chepstow place . If that is so , it is a black and white shameless breach of the terms on which [we]3281-we surrendered to [Turnbull]325-turnbull after the battle of [the Tower]190-the tower . [We]3281-we were to keep [our]3281-we own customs and self - government . If that is so-- "[247-barker]

" It is so , "[334-auberon] said a deep voice ; and [both men]649-both men turned round .

[A burly figure in purple robes , with a silver eagle hung round [his]1585-a burly figure in purple robes , with a silver eagle hung round his neck and moustaches almost as florid as his plumes neck and moustaches almost as florid as [his]1585-a burly figure in purple robes , with a silver eagle hung round his neck and moustaches almost as florid as his plumes plumes]1585-a burly figure in purple robes , with a silver eagle hung round his neck and moustaches almost as florid as his plumes , stood in the doorway .

" Yes , "[1585-a burly figure in purple robes , with a silver eagle hung round his neck and moustaches almost as florid as his plumes] [he]1585-a burly figure in purple robes , with a silver eagle hung round his neck and moustaches almost as florid as his plumes said , acknowledging [the King]1924-the king 's start , " [I]1585-a burly figure in purple robes , with a silver eagle hung round his neck and moustaches almost as florid as his plumes am [Provost Buck]307-buck , and the news is true . [These men of the Hill]3284-these men of the hill have forgotten that [we]3281-we fought round [the Tower]190-the tower as well as [they]3284-these men of the hill , and that it is sometimes foolish , as well as base , to despise [the conquered]3285-the conquered . "[1585-a burly figure in purple robes , with a silver eagle hung round his neck and moustaches almost as florid as his plumes]

" Let [us]3281-we step outside , "[247-barker] said [Barker]247-barker , with a grim composure .

[Buck]307-buck did so , and stood rolling [his]307-buck eyes up and down [the lamp - lit street]1587-the lamp - lit street .

" [I]307-buck would like to have a go at smashing all this , "[307-buck] [he]307-buck muttered , " though [I]307-buck am over sixty . [I]307-buck would like-- "[307-buck]

[His]307-buck voice ended in a cry , and [he]307-buck reeled back a step , with [his]307-buck hands to [his]307-buck eyes , as [he]307-buck had done in [those streets]1588-those streets twenty years before .

" Darkness ! "[307-buck] [he]307-buck cried--"darkness again ! What does it mean ? "[1129-the chemist]

For in truth every lamp in [the street]394-the street had gone out , so that [they]1590-we could not see even [each other]1912-each other 's outline , except faintly . The voice of [the chemist]1129-the chemist came with startling cheerfulness out of the density .

" Oh , do n't [you]1129-the chemist know ? "[1129-the chemist] [he]1129-the chemist said . " Did [they]1590-we never tell [you]1129-the chemist this is the Feast of the Lamps , the anniversary of the great battle that almost lost and just saved [Notting Hill]2-notting hill ? Do n't [you]1129-the chemist know , [[your]1129-the chemist Majesty]1946-your majesty , that on this night twenty - one years ago [we]1590-we saw [Wilson]328-wilson 's green uniforms charging down [this street]3287-this street , and driving [Wayne]280-wayne and [Turnbull]325-turnbull back upon [the gas - works]3288-the gas - works , fighting with [[their]1590-we handful]3289-their handful like fiends from hell ? And that then , in that great hour , [Wayne]280-wayne sprang through a window of [the gas - works]3288-the gas - works , with one blow of [his]280-wayne hand brought darkness on [the whole city]3291-the whole city , and then with a cry like a lion 's , that was heard through [four streets]3292-four streets , flew at [[Wilson]328-wilson 's men]3009-wilson 's men , sword in hand , and swept [them]3009-wilson 's men , bewildered as [they]3009-wilson 's men were , and ignorant of the map , clear out of [the sacred street]3294-the sacred street again ? And do n't [you]1129-the chemist know that upon that night every year all lights are turned out for half an hour while [we]1590-we sing the Notting Hill anthem in the darkness ? Hark ! there it begins . "[1129-the chemist]

Through the night came a crash of drums , and then a strong swell of human voices--

" When [the world]352-the world was in the balance , there was night on [Notting Hill]2-notting hill , ( There was night on [Notting Hill]2-notting hill ): it was nobler than the day ; On [the cities]692-the cities where the lights are and the firesides glow , From [the seas]3297-the seas and from [the deserts]3298-the deserts came the thing [we]1590-we did not know , Came the darkness , came the darkness , came the darkness on [the foe]3299-the foe , And [the old guard of [God]199-god]3300-the old guard of god turned to bay . For [the old guard of God]3300-the old guard of god turns to bay , turns to bay , And the stars fall down before it ere its banners fall to - day : For when [armies]3302-armies were around [us]1590-we as a howling and [a horde]3303-a horde , When falling was [the citadel]3304-the citadel and broken was the sword , The darkness came upon [them]3302-armies like the Dragon of [the Lord]3305-the lord , When [the old guard of God]3300-the old guard of god turned to bay . "[1129-the chemist]

The voices were just uplifting [themselves]1593-themselves in a second verse when [they]1593-themselves were stopped by a scurry and a yell . [Barker]247-barker had bounded into [the street]394-the street with a cry of " [South Kensington]56-south kensington ! "[247-barker] and a drawn dagger . In less time than [a man]388-a man could blink , [the whole packed street]1596-the whole packed street was full of curses and struggling . [Barker]247-barker was flung back against [the shop - front]1597-the shop - front , but used the second only to draw [his]247-barker sword as well as [his]247-barker dagger , and calling out , " This is not the first time [I]247-barker 've come through the thick of [you]307-buck , "[247-barker] flung [himself]247-barker again into the press . It was evident that [he]247-barker had drawn blood at last , for a more violent outcry arose , and many other knives and swords were discernible in the faint light . [Barker]247-barker , after having wounded more than [one man]1825-one man , seemed on the point of being flung back again , when [Buck]307-buck suddenly stepped out into [the street]394-the street . [He]307-buck had no weapon , for [he]307-buck affected rather the peaceful magnificence of [the great burgher]1600-the great burgher , than the pugnacious dandyism which had replaced the old sombre dandyism in [Barker]247-barker . But with a blow of [his]307-buck clenched fist [he]307-buck broke the pane of [the next shop , which was [the old curiosity shop]1125-the old curiosity shop]1601-the next shop , which was the old curiosity shop , and , plunging in [his]307-buck hand , snatched a kind of Japanese scimitar , and calling out , " [Kensington]265-kensington ! [Kensington]265-kensington ! "[307-buck] rushed to [Barker]247-barker 's assistance .

[Barker]247-barker 's sword was broken , but [he]247-barker was laying about [him]247-barker with [his]247-barker dagger . Just as [Buck]307-buck ran up , [a man of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]1603-a man of notting hill struck [Barker]247-barker down , but [Buck]307-buck struck [the man]574-the man down on top of [him]574-the man , and [Barker]247-barker sprang up again , the blood running down [his]247-barker face .

Suddenly all these cries were cloven by a great voice , that seemed to fall out of heaven . It was terrible to [Buck]307-buck and [Barker]247-barker and [the King]1924-the king , from its seeming to come out the empty skies ; but it was more terrible because it was a familiar voice , and one which at the same time [they]1606-they had not heard for so long .

" Turn up the lights , "[307-buck] said the voice from above [them]1606-they , and for a moment there was no reply , but only a tumult .

" In the name of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill and of [the great Council of [the City]1941-the city]3307-the great council of the city , turn up the lights . "[307-buck]

There was again a tumult and a vagueness for a moment , then [the whole street]1607-the whole street and every object in [it]1607-the whole street sprang suddenly out of the darkness , as every lamp sprang into life . And looking up [they]1606-they saw , standing upon a balcony near the roof of [one of [the highest houses]1609-the highest houses]1608-one of the highest houses , the figure and the face of [Adam Wayne]280-wayne , [his]280-wayne red hair blowing behind [him]280-wayne , a little streaked with grey .

" What is this , [[my]280-wayne people]1765-my people ? "[280-wayne] [he]280-wayne said . " Is it altogether impossible to make a thing good without it immediately insisting on being wicked ? The glory of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill in having achieved [its]2-notting hill independence , has been enough for [me]280-wayne to dream of for many years , as [I]280-wayne sat beside the fire . Is it really not enough for [you]3310-you , who have had so many other affairs to excite and distract [you]3310-you ? [Notting Hill]2-notting hill is [a nation]1785-a nation . Why should it condescend to be [a mere Empire]3312-a mere empire ? [You]3310-you wish to pull down the statue of [General Wilson]328-wilson , which [the men of]2166-the men of [Bayswater]54-bayswater have so rightly erected in [Westbourne Grove]84-westbourne grove . [Fools]2774-fools ! Who erected that statue ? Did [Bayswater]54-bayswater erect [it]3315-it ? No . [Notting Hill]2-notting hill erected [it]3315-it . Do [you]3310-you not see that it is the glory of [our]3316-our achievement that [we]3316-our have infected [the other cities]3317-the other cities with the idealism of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill ? It is [we]3316-our who have created not only [our]3316-our own side , but both sides of this controversy . [O too humble fools]3318-o too humble fools , why should [you]3310-you wish to destroy [[your]3310-you enemies]3319-your enemies ? [You]3310-you have done something more to [them]3319-your enemies . [You]3310-you have created [[your]3310-you enemies]3319-your enemies . [You]3310-you wish to pull down that gigantic silver hammer , which stands , like an obelisk , in the centre of [the Broadway of [Hammersmith]63-hammersmith]3321-the broadway of hammersmith . [Fools]2774-fools ! Before [Notting Hill]2-notting hill arose , did [any person]3323-any person passing through [Hammersmith Broadway]87-hammersmith broadway expect to see there a gigantic silver hammer ? [You]3310-you wish to abolish the great bronze figure of [a knight standing upon [the artificial bridge at [Knightsbridge]69-knightsbridge]3325-the artificial bridge at knightsbridge]3324-a knight standing upon the artificial bridge at knightsbridge . [Fools]2774-fools ! Who would have thought of it before [Notting Hill]2-notting hill arose ? [I]280-wayne have even heard , and with deep pain [I]280-wayne have heard it , that the evil eye of [our]3327-we imperial envy has been cast towards [the remote horizon of [the west]3329-the west]3328-the remote horizon of the west , and that [we]3327-we have objected to the great black monument of a crowned raven , which commemorates [the skirmish of [Ravenscourt Park]194-ravenscourt park]3330-the skirmish of ravenscourt park . Who created all these things ? Were [they]3331-they there before [we]3327-we came ? Can not [you]3310-you be content with that destiny which was enough for [Athens]27-athens , which was enough for [Nazareth]337-nazareth ? the destiny , the humble purpose , of creating [a new world]3332-a new world . Is [Athens]27-athens angry because [Romans]339-romans and [Florentines]3333-florentines have adopted [her]27-athens phraseology for expressing [their]3331-they own patriotism ? Is [Nazareth]337-nazareth angry because as [a little village]3334-a little village [it]337-nazareth has become the type of [all little villages]3335-all little villages out of which , as [the Snobs]3336-the snobs say , no good can come ? Has [Athens]27-athens asked [every one to wear the chlamys]3337-every one to wear the chlamys ? Are [all followers of [the Nazarene]3339-the nazarene]3338-all followers of the nazarene compelled to wear turbans . No ! but the soul of [Athens]27-athens went forth and made [men]357-men drink hemlock , and the soul of [Nazareth]337-nazareth went forth and made [men]357-men consent to be crucified . So has the soul of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill gone forth and made [men]357-men realise what it is to live in [a city]3156-a city . Just as [we]3344-we inaugurated [our]3344-we symbols and ceremonies , so [they]357-men have inaugurated [theirs]357-men ; and are [you]3345-you so mad as to contend against [them]357-men ? [Notting Hill]2-notting hill is right ; it has always been right . [It]2-notting hill has moulded [itself]2-notting hill on [its]2-notting hill own necessities , [its]2-notting hill own _ sine quâ non _ ; it has accepted [its]2-notting hill own ultimatum . Because it is a nation [it]2-notting hill has created [itself]2-notting hill ; and because [it]2-notting hill is [a nation]1785-a nation [it]2-notting hill can destroy [itself]2-notting hill . [Notting Hill]2-notting hill shall always be [the judge]3347-the judge . If it is [your]3348-your will because of this matter of [General Wilson]328-wilson 's statue to make war upon [Bayswater--]48-bayswater-- "[280-wayne]

A roar of cheers broke in upon [his]1610-he words , and further speech was impossible . Pale to the lips , [the great patriot]1611-the great patriot tried again and again to speak ; but even [his]1610-he authority could not keep down the dark and roaring masses in [the street]394-the street below [him]1610-he . [He]1610-he said something further , but it was not audible . [He]1610-he descended at last sadly from [the garret in which [he]1610-he lived]1613-the garret in which he lived , and mingled with [the crowd at the foot of the houses]1614-the crowd at the foot of the houses . Finding [General Turnbull]325-turnbull , [he]1610-he put [his]1610-he hand on [his]325-turnbull shoulder with a queer affection and gravity , and said--

" To - morrow , [old man]2694-old man , [we]3350-we shall have a new experience , as fresh as the flowers of spring . [We]3350-we shall be defeated . [You]2694-old man and [I]1610-he have been through three battles together , and have somehow or other missed this peculiar delight . It is unfortunate that [we]3350-we shall not probably be able to exchange [our]3350-we experiences , because , as it most annoyingly happens , [we]3350-we shall probably both be dead . "[1610-he]

[Turnbull]325-turnbull looked dimly surprised .

" [I]325-turnbull do n't mind so much about being dead , "[325-turnbull] [he]325-turnbull said , " but why should [you]280-wayne say that [we]3350-we shall be defeated ? "[325-turnbull]

" The answer is very simple , "[280-wayne] replied [Wayne]280-wayne , calmly . " It is because [we]3350-we ought to be defeated . [We]3350-we have been in the most horrible holes before now ; but in all those [I]280-wayne was perfectly certain that the stars were on [our]3350-we side , and that [we]3350-we ought to get out . Now [I]280-wayne know that [we]3350-we ought not to get out ; and that takes away from [me]280-wayne everything with which [I]280-wayne won . "[280-wayne]

As [Wayne]280-wayne spoke [he]280-wayne started a little , for [both men]649-both men became aware that [a third figure]1616-a third figure was listening to [them]649-both men -- [a small figure with wondering eyes]1617-a small figure with wondering eyes .

" Is it really true , [my]1924-the king dear [Wayne]280-wayne , "[1924-the king] said [the King]1924-the king , interrupting , " that [you]280-wayne think [you]280-wayne will be beaten to - morrow ? "[1924-the king]

" There can be no doubt about it whatever , "[280-wayne] replied [Adam Wayne]280-wayne ; " the real reason is the one of which [I]280-wayne have just spoken . But as a concession to [your]280-wayne materialism , [I]280-wayne will add that [they]3351-they have [an organised army of [a hundred allied cities against [our]3354-our one]3353-a hundred allied cities against our one]3352-an organised army of a hundred allied cities against our one . That in itself , however , would be unimportant . "[280-wayne]

[Quin]227-auberon , with [his]227-auberon round eyes , seemed strangely insistent .

" [You]280-wayne are quite sure , "[227-auberon] [he]227-auberon said , " that [you]280-wayne must be beaten ? "[227-auberon]

" [I]325-turnbull am afraid , "[325-turnbull] said [Turnbull]325-turnbull , gloomily , " that there can be no doubt about it . "[325-turnbull]

" Then , "[1924-the king] cried [the King]1924-the king , flinging out [his]1924-the king arms , " give [me]1924-the king a halberd ! Give [me]1924-the king a halberd , [somebody]598-somebody ! [I]1924-the king desire [all men]592-all men to witness that [I]1924-the king , [Auberon]227-auberon , [King of [England]8-england]3357-king of england , do here and now abdicate , and implore [the Provost of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]928-the provost of notting hill to permit [me]1924-the king to enlist in [[his]928-the provost of notting hill army]3359-his army . Give [me]1924-the king a halberd ! "[1924-the king]

[He]1924-the king seized one from [some passing guard]1620-some passing guard , and , shouldering it , stamped solemnly after the shouting columns of halberdiers which were , by this time , parading [the streets]359-the streets . [He]1924-the king had , however , nothing to do with the wrecking of the statue of [General Wilson]328-wilson , which took place before morning .

CHAPTER II--_The Last Battle _

The day was cloudy when [Wayne]280-wayne went down to die with all [his]280-wayne army in [Kensington Gardens]36-kensington gardens ; it was cloudy again when [that army]1483-that army had been swallowed up by [the vast armies of [a new world]3332-a new world]1623-the vast armies of a new world . There had been an almost uncanny interval of sunshine , in which [the Provost of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]928-the provost of notting hill , with all the placidity of [an onlooker]1626-an onlooker , had gazed across to the hostile armies on [the great spaces of verdure opposite]1627-the great spaces of verdure opposite ; the long strips of green and blue and gold lay across [the park]1412-the park in squares and oblongs like a proposition in Euclid wrought in a rich embroidery . But the sunlight was a weak and , as it were , a wet sunlight , and was soon swallowed up . [Wayne]280-wayne spoke to [the King]1924-the king , with a queer sort of coldness and languor , as to the military operations . It was as [he]280-wayne had said the night before -- that being deprived of [his]280-wayne sense of an impracticable rectitude , [he]280-wayne was , in effect , being deprived of everything . [He]280-wayne was out of date , and at [sea]1630-sea in a mere world of compromise and competition , of Empire against Empire , of the tolerably right and the tolerably wrong . When [his]280-wayne eye fell on [the King]1924-the king , however , who was marching very gravely with a top hat and a halberd , it brightened slightly .

" Well , [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty , "[280-wayne] [he]280-wayne said , " [you]1924-the king at least ought to be proud to - day . If [[your]1924-the king children]3361-your children are fighting [each other]1912-each other , at least those who win are [[your]1924-the king children]3361-your children . [Other kings]3364-other kings have distributed justice , [you]1924-the king have distributed life . [Other kings]3364-other kings have ruled [a nation]1785-a nation , [you]1924-the king have created [nations]3367-nations . [Others]1235-others have made kingdoms , [you]1924-the king have begotten [them]1235-others . Look at [[your]1924-the king children]3361-your children , [father]3370-father ! "[280-wayne] and [he]280-wayne stretched [his]280-wayne hand out towards [the enemy]434-the enemy .

[Auberon]227-auberon did not raise [his]227-auberon eyes .

" See how splendidly , "[280-wayne] cried [Wayne]280-wayne , " [the new cities]3371-the new cities come on -- [the new cities]3371-the new cities from across [the river]1975-the river . See where [Battersea]61-battersea advances over there -- under the flag of [the Lost Dog]3374-the lost dog ; and [Putney]340-putney -- don't [you]1924-the king see [the Man on the White Boar]3375-the man on the white boar shining on [their]3375-the man on the white boar standard as the sun catches it ? It is the coming of a new age , [[your]1924-the king Majesty]1946-your majesty . [Notting Hill]2-notting hill is not [a common empire]3377-a common empire ; it is a thing like [Athens]27-athens , [the mother of a mode of life]3378-the mother of a mode of life , of a manner of living , which shall renew the youth of [the world]352-the world -- a thing like [Nazareth]337-nazareth . When [I]280-wayne was young [I]280-wayne remember , in the old dreary days , [wiseacres]3380-wiseacres used to write books about how [trains]2096-trains would get faster , and all [the world]352-the world be one empire , and [tram - cars]3383-tram - cars go to the moon . And even as [a child]362-a child [I]280-wayne used to say to [myself]280-wayne , ' Far more likely that [we]3385-we shall go on the crusades again , or worship [the gods of [the city]1941-the city]3386-the gods of the city . ' And so it has been . And [I]280-wayne am glad , though this is [my]280-wayne last battle . "[280-wayne]

Even as [he]1633-he spoke there came a crash of steel from the left , and [he]1633-he turned [his]1633-he head .

" [Wilson]328-wilson ! "[1633-he] [he]1633-he cried , with a kind of joy . " [Red Wilson]341-wilson has charged [our]3385-we left . [No one]416-no one can hold [him]341-wilson in ; [he]341-wilson eats swords . [He]341-wilson is as keen [a soldier]1513-a soldier as [Turnbull]325-turnbull , but less patient -- less really great . Ha ! and [Barker]247-barker is moving . How [Barker]247-barker has improved ; how handsome [he]247-barker looks ! It is not all having plumes ; it is also having a soul in [one]1758-one 's daily life . Ha ! "[1633-he]

And another crash of steel on the right showed that [Barker]247-barker had closed with [Notting Hill]2-notting hill on the other side .

" [Turnbull]325-turnbull is there ! "[280-wayne] cried [Wayne]280-wayne . " See [him]325-turnbull hurl [them]3391-them back ! [Barker]247-barker is checked ! [Turnbull]325-turnbull charges -- wins ! But [our]3392-our left is broken . [Wilson]328-wilson has smashed [Bowles]296-mr. bowles and [Mead]292-mr. mead , and may turn [our]3392-our flank . Forward , [the Provost]876-the provost 's Guard ! "[280-wayne]

And [the whole centre]1634-the whole centre moved forward , [Wayne]280-wayne 's face and hair and sword flaming in [the van]1635-the van .

[The King]1924-the king ran suddenly forward .

The next instant a great jar that went through [it]1637-it told that it had met [the enemy]434-the enemy . And right over against [them]434-the enemy through the wood of [their]434-the enemy own weapons [Auberon]227-auberon saw the Purple Eagle of [Buck of [North Kensington]83-north kensington]197-buck of north kensington .

On the left [Red Wilson]341-wilson was storming the broken ranks , [his]341-wilson little green figure conspicuous even in the tangle of [men]357-men and weapons , with the flaming red moustaches and the crown of laurel . [Bowles]296-mr. bowles slashed at [his]341-wilson head and tore away some of the wreath , leaving the rest bloody , and , with a roar like a bull 's , [Wilson]341-wilson sprang at [him]341-wilson , and , after a rattle of fencing , plunged [his]341-wilson point into [the chemist , who fell]1640-the chemist , who fell , crying , " [Notting Hill]2-notting hill ! "[1640-the chemist , who fell] Then [the Notting Hillers]342-the notting hillers wavered , and [Bayswater]54-bayswater swept [them]342-the notting hillers back in confusion . [Wilson]341-wilson had carried everything before [him]341-wilson .

On the right , however , [Turnbull]325-turnbull had carried the Red Lion banner with a rush against [[Barker]247-barker 's men]2961-barker 's men , and the banner of the Golden Birds bore up with difficulty against it . [[Barker]247-barker 's men]2961-barker 's men fell fast . In the centre [Wayne]280-wayne and [Buck]307-buck were engaged , stubborn and confused . So far as the fighting went , it was precisely equal . But the fighting was a farce . For behind [the three small armies with which [[Wayne]280-wayne 's small army]1644-wayne 's small army was engaged]1643-the three small armies with which wayne 's small army was engaged lay [the great sea of [the allied armies , which looked on as yet as scornful spectators]1646-the allied armies , which looked on as yet as scornful spectators]1645-the great sea of the allied armies , which looked on as yet as scornful spectators , but could have broken all four armies by moving a finger .

Suddenly [they]1643-the three small armies with which wayne 's small army was engaged did move . [Some of [the front contingents]1648-the front contingents]1647-some of the front contingents , [the pastoral chiefs from Shepherd 's Bush]1649-the pastoral chiefs from shepherd 's bush , with [their]1649-the pastoral chiefs from shepherd 's bush spears and fleeces , were seen advancing , and [the rude clans from [Paddington Green]198-paddington green]1650-the rude clans from paddington green . [They]1643-the three small armies with which wayne 's small army was engaged were advancing for a very good reason . [Buck]307-buck , of [North Kensington]83-north kensington , was signalling wildly ; [he]307-buck was surrounded , and totally cut off . [[His]307-buck regiments]1651-his regiments were [a struggling mass of [people]1752-people , islanded in [a red sea of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]1654-a red sea of notting hill]1652-a struggling mass of people , islanded in a red sea of notting hill .

[The allies]1264-the allies had been too careless and confident . [They]1264-the allies had allowed [[Barker]247-barker 's force]1656-barker 's force to be broken to pieces by [Turnbull]325-turnbull , and the moment that was done , [the astute old leader of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]1657-the astute old leader of notting hill swung [[his]1657-the astute old leader of notting hill men]2793-his men round and attacked [Buck]307-buck behind and on both sides . At the same moment [Wayne]280-wayne cried , " Charge ! "[280-wayne] and struck [him]307-buck in front like a thunderbolt .

[Two - thirds of [[Buck]307-buck 's men]1660-buck 's men]1659-two - thirds of buck 's men were cut to pieces before [[their]1659-two - thirds of buck 's men allies]1661-their allies could reach [them]1659-two - thirds of buck 's men . Then [the sea of [cities]1663-cities]1662-the sea of cities came on with [their]1662-the sea of cities banners like breakers , and swallowed [Notting Hill]2-notting hill for ever . The battle was not over , for [not one of [[Wayne]280-wayne 's men]1665-wayne 's men]1664-not one of wayne 's men would surrender , and it lasted till sundown , and long after . But it was decided ; the story of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill was ended .

When [Turnbull]325-turnbull saw it , [he]325-turnbull ceased a moment from fighting , and looked round [him]325-turnbull . The evening sunlight struck [his]325-turnbull face ; it looked like [a child]362-a child 's .

" [I]325-turnbull have had [my]325-turnbull youth , "[325-turnbull] [he]325-turnbull said . Then , snatching an axe from [a man]388-a man , [he]325-turnbull dashed into the thick of the spears of [Shepherd]275-shepherd 's Bush , and died somewhere far in the depths of [their]1668-their reeling ranks . Then the battle roared on ; [every man of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]1669-every man of notting hill was slain before night .

[Wayne]280-wayne was standing by a tree alone after the battle . [Several men]1670-several men approached [him]280-wayne with axes . One struck at [him]280-wayne . [His]280-wayne foot seemed partly to slip ; but [he]280-wayne flung [his]280-wayne hand out , and steadied [himself]280-wayne against the tree .

[Barker]247-barker sprang after [him]280-wayne , sword in hand , and shaking with excitement .

" How large now , [[my]247-barker lord]2134-my lord , "[247-barker] [he]247-barker cried , " is [the Empire of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]1519-the empire of notting hill ? "[247-barker]

[Wayne]280-wayne smiled in the gathering dark .

" Always as large as this , "[247-barker] [he]247-barker said , and swept [his]247-barker sword round in a semicircle of silver .

[Barker]247-barker dropped , wounded in the neck ; and [Wilson]341-wilson sprang over [his]280-wayne body like a tiger - cat , rushing at [Wayne]280-wayne . At the same moment there came behind [the Lord of the Red Lion]1671-the lord of the red lion a cry and a flare of yellow , and a mass of [the West Kensington halberdiers]1672-the west kensington halberdiers ploughed up the slope , knee - deep in grass , bearing the yellow banner of [the city]1941-the city before [them]1672-the west kensington halberdiers , and shouting aloud .

At the same second [Wilson]341-wilson went down under [Wayne]280-wayne 's sword , seemingly smashed like a fly . The great sword rose again like a bird , but [Wilson]341-wilson seemed to rise with it , and , [his]341-wilson sword being broken , sprang at [Wayne]280-wayne 's throat like a dog . [The foremost of the yellow halberdiers]1674-the foremost of the yellow halberdiers had reached the tree and swung [his]1674-the foremost of the yellow halberdiers axe above [the struggling Wayne]280-wayne . With a curse [the King]1924-the king whirled up [his]1924-the king own halberd , and dashed the blade in [the man]574-the man 's face . [He]1924-the king reeled and rolled down [the slope]1677-the slope , just as [the furious Wilson]341-wilson was flung on [his]1924-the king back again . And again [he]341-wilson was on [his]341-wilson feet , and again at [Wayne]280-wayne 's throat . Then [he]341-wilson was flung again , but this time laughing triumphantly . Grasped in [his]280-wayne hand was the red and yellow favour that [Wayne]280-wayne wore as Provost of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill . [He]280-wayne had torn it from [the place where it had been carried for twenty - five years]1678-the place where it had been carried for twenty - five years .

With a shout [the West Kensington men]1679-the west kensington men closed round [Wayne]280-wayne , the great yellow banner flapping over [his]280-wayne head .

" Where is [your]280-wayne favour now , [Provost]280-wayne ? "[1680-the west kensington leader] cried [the West Kensington leader]1680-the west kensington leader .

And a laugh went up .

[Adam]280-wayne struck at [the standard - bearer]1681-the standard - bearer and brought [him]1681-the standard - bearer reeling forward . As the banner stooped , [he]280-wayne grasped the yellow folds and tore off a shred . A halberdier struck [him]280-wayne on the shoulder , wounding bloodily .

" Here is one colour ! "[280-wayne] [he]280-wayne cried , pushing the yellow into [his]280-wayne belt ; " and here ! "[280-wayne] [he]280-wayne cried , pointing to [his]280-wayne own blood--"here is the other . "[280-wayne]

At the same instant the shock of a sudden and heavy halberd laid [the King]1924-the king stunned or dead . In the wild visions of vanishing consciousness , [he]1924-the king saw again something that belonged to an utterly forgotten time , something that [he]1924-the king had seen somewhere long ago in [a restaurant]1683-a restaurant . [He]1924-the king saw , with [his]1924-the king swimming eyes , red and yellow , the colours of [Nicaragua]26-nicaragua .

[Quin]227-auberon did not see the end . [Wilson]341-wilson , wild with joy , sprang again at [Adam Wayne]280-wayne , and the great sword of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill was whirled above once more . Then [men]357-men ducked instinctively at the rushing noise of the sword coming down out of the sky , and [Wilson of Bayswater]274-wilson was smashed and wiped down upon the floor like a fly . Nothing was left of [him]280-wayne but a wreck ; but the blade that had broken [him]280-wayne was broken . In dying [he]280-wayne had snapped the great sword and the spell of it ; the sword of [Wayne]280-wayne was broken at the hilt . One rush of [the enemy]434-the enemy carried [Wayne]280-wayne by force against the tree . [They]357-men were too close to use halberd or even sword ; [they]357-men were breast to breast , even nostrils to nostrils . But [Buck]307-buck got [his]307-buck dagger free .

" Kill [him]307-buck ! "[307-buck] [he]307-buck cried , in a strange stifled voice . " Kill [him]307-buck ! Good or bad , [he]307-buck is [none of [us]3397-us]1756-none of us ! Do not be blinded by the face ! ... [God]199-god ! have [we]3397-us not been blinded all along ! "[307-buck] and [he]307-buck drew [his]307-buck arm back for a stab , and seemed to close [his]307-buck eyes .

[Wayne]280-wayne did not drop the hand that hung on to the tree - branch . But a mighty heave went over [his]280-wayne breast and [his]280-wayne whole huge figure , like an earthquake over [great hills]1686-great hills . And with that convulsion of effort [he]280-wayne rent the branch out of the tree , with tongues of torn wood ; and , swaying it once only , [he]280-wayne let the splintered club fall on [Buck]307-buck , breaking [his]307-buck neck . [The planner of [the Great Road]1688-the great road]1687-the planner of the great road fell face foremost dead , with [his]280-wayne dagger in a grip of steel .

" For [you]3398-you and [me]280-wayne , and for [all brave men]3399-all brave men , [[my]280-wayne brother]3400-my brother , "[280-wayne] said [Wayne]280-wayne , in [his]280-wayne strange chant , " there is good wine poured in [the inn]3401-the inn at [the end of [the world]352-the world]3402-the end of the world . "[280-wayne]

[The packed men]1689-the packed men made another lurch or heave towards [him]280-wayne ; it was almost too dark to fight clearly . [He]280-wayne caught hold of the oak again , this time getting [his]280-wayne hand into a wide crevice and grasping , as it were , the bowels of the tree . [The whole crowd]1690-the whole crowd , numbering [some thirty men]1691-some thirty men , made a rush to tear [him]280-wayne away from it ; [they]1690-the whole crowd hung on with all [their]1690-the whole crowd weight and numbers , and nothing stirred . A solitude could not have been stiller than [that group of [straining men]1693-straining men]1692-that group of straining men . Then there was a faint sound .

" [His]280-wayne hand is slipping , "[2750-two men] cried [two men]2750-two men in exultation .

" [You]3404-you do n't know much of [him]280-wayne , "[1695-a man of the old war] said another , grimly ( [a man of the old war]1695-a man of the old war ) . " More likely [his]280-wayne bone cracks . "[1695-a man of the old war]

" It is neither -- by [God]199-god , it is neither ! "[1696-the first two] said one of [the first two]1696-the first two .

" What is it , then ? "[1697-the second] asked [the second]1697-the second .

" The tree is falling , "[1697-the second] [he]1697-the second replied .

" As the tree falleth , so shall it lie , "[280-wayne] said [Wayne]280-wayne 's voice out of the darkness , and it had the same sweet and yet horrible air that it had had throughout , of coming from a great distance , from before or after the event . Even when [he]280-wayne was struggling like an eel or battering like [a madman]591-a madman , [he]280-wayne spoke like [a spectator]1699-a spectator . " As the tree falleth , so shall it lie , "[280-wayne] [he]280-wayne said . " [Men]357-men have called that a gloomy text . It is the essence of all exultation . [I]280-wayne am doing now what [I]280-wayne have done all [my]280-wayne life , what is the only happiness , what is the only universality . [I]280-wayne am clinging to something . Let [it]280-wayne fall , and there let it lie . [Fools]2774-fools , [you]2774-fools go about and see [the kingdoms of [the earth]670-the earth]3407-the kingdoms of the earth , and are liberal and wise and cosmopolitan , which is all that [the devil]2634-the devil can give [you]2774-fools -- all that [he]2634-the devil could offer to [Christ]343-christ , only to be spurned away . [I]280-wayne am doing what [the truly wise]3410-the truly wise do . When [a child]362-a child goes out into [the garden]2085-the garden and takes hold of a tree , saying , ' Let this tree be all [I]280-wayne have , ' that moment its roots take hold on hell and its branches on the stars . The joy [I]280-wayne have is what [the lover]3413-the lover knows when [a woman]385-a woman is everything . It is what [a savage]3415-a savage knows when [[his]3415-a savage idol]3416-his idol is everything . It is what [I]280-wayne know when [Notting Hill]2-notting hill is everything . [I]280-wayne have [a city]3156-a city . Let [it]3156-a city stand or fall . "[280-wayne]

As [he]1700-he spoke , the turf lifted itself like a living thing , and out of it rose slowly , like crested serpents , the roots of the oak . Then the great head of the tree , that seemed a green cloud among grey ones , swept the sky suddenly like a broom , and the whole tree heeled over like [a ship]1701-a ship , smashing every one in its fall .

CHAPTER III--_Two Voices _

In [a place in which there was total darkness for hours]1702-a place in which there was total darkness for hours , there was also for hours total silence . Then a voice spoke out of the darkness , [no one]416-no one could have told from where , and said aloud--

" So ends [the Empire of [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]1519-the empire of notting hill . As it began in blood , so it ended in blood , and all things are always the same . "[1704-the first voice]

And there was silence again , and then again there was a voice , but it had not the same tone ; it seemed that it was not the same voice .

" If all things are always the same , it is because they are always heroic . If all things are always the same , it is because they are always new . To [each man]3419-each man [one soul]3420-one soul only is given ; to each soul only is given a little power -- the power at some moments to outgrow and swallow up the stars . If age after age that power comes upon [men]357-men , whatever gives it to [them]357-men is great . Whatever makes [men]357-men feel old is mean -- an empire or a skin - flint shop . Whatever makes [men]357-men feel young is great -- a great war or a love - story . And in the darkest of the books of [God]199-god there is written a truth that is also a riddle . It is of the new things that [men]357-men tire -- of fashions and proposals and improvements and change . It is the old things that startle and intoxicate . It is the old things that are young . There is [no sceptic who does not feel that many have doubted before]3425-no sceptic who does not feel that many have doubted before . There is [no rich and fickle man]3426-no rich and fickle man who does not feel that all [his]3426-no rich and fickle man novelties are ancient . There is [no worshipper of change]3427-no worshipper of change who does not feel upon [his]3426-no rich and fickle man neck the vast weight of the weariness of [the universe]519-the universe . But [we]3429-we who do the old things are fed by nature with a perpetual infancy . [No man who is in love]3430-no man who is in love thinks that [any one]2145-any one has been in love before . [No woman who has a child]3432-no woman who has a child thinks that there have been such things as [children]367-children . [No people that fight for [[their]3434-no people that fight for their own city own city]3435-their own city]3434-no people that fight for their own city are haunted with the burden of the broken empires . Yes , [O dark voice]3436-o dark voice , [the world]352-the world is always the same , for it is always unexpected . "[1705-the other voice]

A little gust of wind blew through the night , and then [the first voice]1704-the first voice answered--

" But in [this world]2700-this world there are some , be [they]3439-they wise or foolish , whom nothing intoxicates . There are some who see all [your]3440-your disturbances like a cloud of flies . [They]3439-they know that while [men]357-men will laugh at [[your]3440-your [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]3442-your notting hill , and will study and rehearse and sing of [Athens]27-athens and [Jerusalem]28-jerusalem , [Athens]27-athens and [Jerusalem]28-jerusalem were [silly suburbs like [[your]3440-your [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]3442-your notting hill]3443-silly suburbs like your notting hill . [They]3439-they know that [the earth itself]3445-the earth itself is [a suburb]3446-a suburb , and can feel only drearily and respectably amused as [they]3439-they move upon [it]3445-the earth itself . "[1704-the first voice]

" [They]3439-they are [philosophers]3447-philosophers or [they]3439-they are [fools]2774-fools , "[1705-the other voice] said [the other voice]1705-the other voice . " [They]3439-they are not [men]357-men . [Men]357-men live , as [I]1705-the other voice say , rejoicing from age to age in something fresher than progress -- in the fact that with every baby a new sun and a new moon are made . If [[our]3451-our ancient humanity]3452-our ancient humanity were [a single man]553-a single man , it might perhaps be that [he]553-a single man would break down under the memory of so many loyalties , under the burden of so many diverse heroisms , under the load and terror of all the goodness of [men]357-men . But it has pleased [God]199-god so to isolate [the individual soul]3455-the individual soul that [it]3455-the individual soul can only learn of [all other souls]3456-all other souls by hearsay , and to each one goodness and happiness come with the youth and violence of lightning , as momentary and as pure . And the doom of failure that lies on all human systems does not in real fact affect [them]357-men any more than the worms of the inevitable grave affect a [children]367-children 's game in [a meadow]1003-a meadow . [Notting Hill]2-notting hill has fallen ; [Notting Hill]2-notting hill has died . But that is not the tremendous issue . [Notting Hill]2-notting hill has lived . "[1705-the other voice]

" But if , "[1705-the other voice] answered [the other voice]1705-the other voice , " if what is achieved by all these efforts be only the common contentment of [humanity]3103-humanity , why do [men]357-men so extravagantly toil and die in [them]357-men ? Has nothing been done by [Notting Hill]2-notting hill than any chance clump of [farmers]3461-farmers or [clan of savages]3462-clan of savages would not have done without it ? What might have been done to [Notting Hill]2-notting hill if [the world]352-the world had been different may be a deep question ; but there is a deeper . What could have happened to [the world]352-the world if [Notting Hill]2-notting hill had never been ? "[1705-the other voice]

[The other voice]1705-the other voice replied--

" The same that would have happened to [the world]352-the world and [all the starry systems]3466-all the starry systems if an apple - tree grew six apples instead of seven ; something would have been eternally lost . There has never been anything in [the world]352-the world absolutely like [Notting Hill]2-notting hill . There will never be anything quite like it to the crack of doom . [I]1705-the other voice can not believe anything but that [God]199-god loved it as [He]199-god must surely love anything that is itself and unreplaceable . But even for that [I]1705-the other voice do not care . If [God]199-god , with all [His]199-god thunders , hated it , [I]1705-the other voice loved it . "[1705-the other voice]

And with the voice [a tall , strange figure]1708-a tall , strange figure lifted itself out of the _ débris _ in the half - darkness .

The other voice came after a long pause , and as it were hoarsely .

" But suppose the whole matter were really a hocus - pocus . Suppose that whatever meaning [you]3468-you may choose in [your]3468-you fancy to give to it , the real meaning of the whole was mockery . Suppose it was all folly . Suppose-- "[1708-a tall , strange figure]

" [I]1709-the tall and strange figure have been in it , "[1709-the tall and strange figure] answered the voice from [the tall and strange figure]1709-the tall and strange figure , " and [I]1709-the tall and strange figure know it was not . "[1709-the tall and strange figure]

[A smaller figure]1710-a smaller figure seemed half to rise in the dark .

" Suppose [I]1711-the voice am [God]199-god , "[1711-the voice] said [the voice]1711-the voice , " and suppose [I]1711-the voice made [the world]352-the world in idleness . Suppose the stars , that [you]3468-you think eternal , are only the idiot fireworks of [an everlasting schoolboy]3470-an everlasting schoolboy . Suppose the sun and the moon , to which [you]3468-you sing alternately , are only the two eyes of [one vast and sneering giant]3471-one vast and sneering giant , opened alternately in a never - ending wink . Suppose the trees , in [my]1711-the voice eyes , are as foolish as enormous toad - stools . Suppose [Socrates]344-socrates and [Charlemagne]345-charlemagne are to [me]1711-the voice only beasts , made funnier by walking on [their]3472-their hind legs . Suppose [I]1711-the voice am [God]199-god , and having made things , laugh at [them]3473-them . "[1711-the voice]

" And suppose [I]618-the other am [man]384-man , "[618-the other] answered [the other]618-the other . " And suppose that [I]618-the other give the answer that shatters even a laugh . Suppose [I]618-the other do not laugh back at [you]3468-you , do not blaspheme [you]3468-you , do not curse [you]3468-you . But suppose , standing up straight under the sky , with every power of [my]618-the other being , [I]618-the other thank [you]3468-you for the fools ' paradise [you]3468-you have made . Suppose [I]618-the other praise [you]3468-you , with a literal pain of ecstasy , for the jest that has brought [me]618-the other so terrible a joy . If [we]3475-we have taken [the child]3476-the child 's games , and given [them]3476-the child the seriousness of a Crusade , if [we]3475-we have drenched [[your]3468-you grotesque Dutch garden]3477-your grotesque dutch garden with the blood of [martyrs]3478-martyrs , [we]3475-we have turned [a nursery]3479-a nursery into [a temple]3480-a temple . [I]618-the other ask [you]3468-you , in the name of [Heaven]268-heaven , who wins ? "[618-the other]

The sky close about the crests of [the hills]1713-the hills and trees was beginning to turn from black to grey , with a random suggestion of the morning . [The slight figure]1714-the slight figure seemed to crawl towards [the larger one]1715-the larger one , and the voice was more human .

" But suppose , [friend]3481-friend , "[1714-the slight figure] it said , " suppose that , in a bitterer and more real sense , it was all a mockery . Suppose that there had been , from the beginning of these great wars , [one who watched them with a sense that is beyond expression , a sense of detachment , of responsibility , of irony , of agony]3482-one who watched them with a sense that is beyond expression , a sense of detachment , of responsibility , of irony , of agony . Suppose that there were [one who knew it was all a joke]3483-one who knew it was all a joke . "[1714-the slight figure]

[The tall figure]1716-the tall figure answered--

" [He]3483-one who knew it was all a joke could not know it . For it was not all a joke . "[1716-the tall figure]

And a gust of wind blew away some clouds that sealed the sky - line , and showed a strip of silver behind [his]1716-the tall figure great dark legs . Then the other voice came , having crept nearer still .

[ Illustration : " [WAYNE]280-wayne , [IT]3484-it WAS ALL A JOKE . "[1716-the tall figure] ]

" [Adam Wayne]280-wayne , "[1714-the slight figure] it said , " there are [men who confess only in _ articulo mortis _]3485-men who confess only in _ articulo mortis _ ; there are [people who blame [themselves]3486-people who blame themselves only when they can no longer help others only when [they]3486-people who blame themselves only when they can no longer help others can no longer help [others]1235-others]3486-people who blame themselves only when they can no longer help others . [I]1714-the slight figure am [one of [them]3486-people who blame themselves only when they can no longer help others]2672-one of them . Here , upon [the field of the bloody end of it all]3489-the field of the bloody end of it all , [I]1714-the slight figure come to tell [you]3481-friend plainly what [you]3481-friend would never understand before . Do [you]3481-friend know who [I]1714-the slight figure am ? "[1714-the slight figure]

" [I]1716-the tall figure know [you]3481-friend , [Auberon Quin]227-auberon , "[1716-the tall figure] answered [the tall figure]1716-the tall figure , " and [I]1716-the tall figure shall be glad to unburden [your]3481-friend spirit of anything that lies upon it . "[1716-the tall figure]

" [Adam Wayne]280-wayne , "[1705-the other voice] said [the other voice]1705-the other voice , " of what [I]1705-the other voice have to say [you]280-wayne can not in common reason be glad to unburden [me]1705-the other voice . [Wayne]280-wayne , it was all a joke . When [I]1705-the other voice made [these cities]3490-these cities , [I]1705-the other voice cared no more for [them]3490-these cities than [I]1705-the other voice care for [a centaur]3491-a centaur , or [a merman]3492-a merman , or a fish with legs , or a pig with feathers , or any other absurdity . When [I]1705-the other voice spoke to [you]280-wayne solemnly and encouragingly about the flag of [your]280-wayne freedom and the peace of [[your]280-wayne city]3493-your city , [I]1705-the other voice was playing a vulgar practical joke on [an honest gentleman]3494-an honest gentleman , a vulgar practical joke that has lasted for twenty years . Though [no one]416-no one could believe it of [me]1705-the other voice , perhaps , it is the truth that [I]1705-the other voice am [a man]388-a man both timid and tender - hearted . [I]1705-the other voice never dared in the early days of [your]280-wayne hope , or the central days of [your]280-wayne supremacy , to tell [you]280-wayne this ; [I]1705-the other voice never dared to break the colossal calm of [your]280-wayne face . God knows why [I]1705-the other voice should do it now , when [my]1705-the other voice farce has ended in tragedy and the ruin of all [[your]280-wayne people]1791-your people ! But [I]1705-the other voice say it now . [Wayne]280-wayne , it was done as a joke . "[1705-the other voice]

There was silence , and the freshening breeze blew the sky clearer and clearer , leaving great spaces of the white dawn .

At last [Wayne]280-wayne said , very slowly--

" [You]1705-the other voice did it all only as a joke ? "[280-wayne]

" Yes , "[227-auberon] said [Quin]227-auberon , briefly .

" When [you]1705-the other voice conceived the idea , "[280-wayne] went on [Wayne]280-wayne , dreamily , " of [an army for [Bayswater]54-bayswater and a flag for [Notting Hill]2-notting hill]3498-an army for bayswater and a flag for notting hill , there was no gleam , no suggestion in [your]1705-the other voice mind that such things might be real and passionate ? "[280-wayne]

" No , "[227-auberon] answered [Auberon]227-auberon , turning [his]227-auberon round white face to the morning with a dull and splendid sincerity ; " [I]227-auberon had none at all . "[227-auberon]

[Wayne]280-wayne sprang down from the height above [him]227-auberon and held out [his]280-wayne hand .

" [I]280-wayne will not stop to thank [you]1705-the other voice , "[280-wayne] [he]280-wayne said , with a curious joy in [his]280-wayne voice , " for the great good for [the world]352-the world [you]1705-the other voice have actually wrought . All that [I]280-wayne think of that [I]280-wayne have said to [you]1705-the other voice a moment ago , even when [I]280-wayne thought that [your]1705-the other voice voice was the voice of a derisive omnipotence , its laughter older than the winds of heaven . But let [me]280-wayne say what is immediate and true . [You]1705-the other voice and [I]280-wayne , [Auberon Quin]227-auberon , have both of [us]3500-we throughout [our]3500-we lives been again and again called mad . And [we]3500-we are mad . [We]3500-we are mad , because [we]3500-we are [not two men]3501-not two men , but [one man]1825-one man . [We]3500-we are mad , because [we]3500-we are two lobes of the same brain , and that brain has been cloven in two . And if [you]1705-the other voice ask for the proof of it , it is not hard to find . It is not merely that [you]1705-the other voice , [the humorist]3503-the humorist , have been in these dark days stripped of the joy of gravity . It is not merely that [I]280-wayne , [the fanatic]3504-the fanatic , have had to grope without humour . It is that , though [we]3500-we seem to be opposite in everything , [we]3500-we have been opposite like [man]384-man and [woman]3506-woman , aiming at the same moment at the same practical thing . [We]3500-we are [the father]3507-the father and [the mother of the Charter of [the Cities]692-the cities]3508-the mother of the charter of the cities . "[280-wayne]

[Quin]227-auberon looked down at the _ débris _ of leaves and timber , the relics of the battle and stampede , now glistening in the growing daylight , and finally said--

" Yet nothing can alter the antagonism -- the fact that [I]280-wayne laughed at these things and [you]1705-the other voice adored them . "[280-wayne]

[Wayne]280-wayne 's wild face flamed with something god - like , as [he]280-wayne turned it to be struck by the sunrise .

" [I]280-wayne know of something that will alter that antagonism , something that is outside [us]3500-we , something that [you]1705-the other voice and [I]280-wayne have all [our]3500-we lives perhaps taken too little account of . [The equal and eternal human being]3510-the equal and eternal human being will alter that antagonism , for [the human being]3511-the human being sees no real antagonism between laughter and respect , [the human being]3511-the human being , [the common man , whom mere geniuses like [you]1705-the other voice and [me]280-wayne can only worship like [a god]588-a god]3513-the common man , whom mere geniuses like you and me can only worship like a god . When dark and dreary days come , [you]1705-the other voice and [I]280-wayne are necessary , [the pure fanatic]3515-the pure fanatic , [the pure satirist]3516-the pure satirist . [We]3500-we have between [us]3500-we remedied a great wrong . [We]3500-we have lifted [the modern cities]3517-the modern cities into that poetry which [every one who knows [mankind]1889-mankind knows to be immeasurably more common than the commonplace . But in [healthy people]3520-healthy people]3518-every one who knows mankind knows to be immeasurably more common than the commonplace . but in healthy people there is no war between [us]3500-we . [We]3500-we are but the two lobes of the brain of [a ploughman]3521-a ploughman . Laughter and love are everywhere . [The cathedrals]3522-the cathedrals , built in the ages that loved [God]199-god , are full of blasphemous grotesques . [The mother]3523-the mother laughs continually at [the child]3476-the child , [the lover]3413-the lover laughs continually at [the lover]3413-the lover , [the wife]3527-the wife at [the husband]3528-the husband , [the friend]3529-the friend at [the friend]3529-the friend . [Auberon Quin]227-auberon , [we]3500-we have been too long separated ; let [us]3500-we go out together . [You]227-auberon have a halberd and [I]280-wayne a sword , let [us]3500-we start [our]3500-we wanderings over [the world]352-the world . For [we]3500-we are its two essentials . Come , it is already day . "[280-wayne]

In the blank white light [Auberon]227-auberon hesitated a moment . Then [he]227-auberon made the formal salute with [his]227-auberon halberd , and [they]1719-they went away together into [the unknown world]1720-the unknown world .

[[THE END]1721-the end]1721-the end
